He will use the KES 70,000 loan to buy shoeshine supplies and other business materials. His business goal is to open another outlet within five years.

This is his fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to buy shoeshine supplies and other business materials.

loans.name: Maribeth

texts.en: Maribeth is a 39-year-old woman from Tubigon, Bohol. She is married and has three children ages 16, nine and five years old. Her husband is a seaman while Maribeth is engaged in “buri” (the largest palm in the Philippines) weaving. This woven “buri” has various usages. It can be made into bags, mats, native hats and sometimes it is used as costumes in some dance contests and activities. She has been doing this business for 15 years. Aside from “buri” weaving, Maribeth is also engaged in raising pigs as a business. Thus, she is asking for a loan to buy more “buri” to weave. She will also use the money she is requesting to buy piglets to raise and feed. In the future, she is aiming to enhance her livelihood for her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy buri, piglets and feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy frozen foods, soft drinks, noodles and bowls needed for his lomi (noodle) nook business.

loans.name: Purity

texts.en:
Purity is a married woman. She has 2 children. She operates a farm where she grows bananas and other crops. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a fertile area and her primary customers are locals.

She will use the Kes 80,000 loan to buy farm supplies. Her business goal is to own a wholesale business within 5 years.

She hopes that in the future she will be successful. This is her fifth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy farm supplies.

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is a Kiva borrower. She has 3 children. She operates a food stall where she cooks food to sell. She has been involved in this business for 5 years.

Her business is located in a residential area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high prices of products.

She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food. She hopes that in the future, she will live a comfortable life.

This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food

loans.name: Cherry Mei

texts.en: Cherry is a married woman who has two children. She is 22 years old and resides at Gubaan, Aurora Zamboanga Del Sur, Philippines. Cherry owns and operates a buy and sell business to earn a living. She buys plenty of eggs and sells them in her local community and she's been in this business for more than three years. Each month, she earns 15,000 PHP doing this type of business. In addition to this, she also buys eggs to resell in bulk for a higher price. With this strategy, she will be able to earn more profit. She joined GDMPC and gained access to financial services and recently, she borrowed a loan of 10,000 PHP to purchase eggs to resell. Her goal was to help improve her living situation and increase her ability to engage in business activities.

loans.use: to purchase  eggs to resell

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a married man. He has four children. He describes himself to be humble and obedient. He operates a retail business where he sells clothes. He has been involved in this business for six years. His primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. He will use the Kes 60,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. His business goal is to be a major distributor of clothes within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will educate his children and have a stable business. He will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes.

loans.name: Kính

texts.en:
Mrs Kính is 44 years old and she is married. She has been working in agriculture raising marine aquaculture for six years.

Kính lives in Hau Loc district, a rural town in Thanh Hoa province. Her income is lower than the national average income and the market need is low in this region. The income from this business is not stable enough for her to do what she really needs to comfort her life.

One of the most critical difficulties that concerns her is not having a hygienic latrine. She is requesting a loan to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a new toilet.

In 2012, Kính joined Thanh Hoa Microfinance institution to improve her business. Kính has successfully repaid four loans from Thanh Hoa Microfinance institution.

In the future, Kính hopes for her business to do well, for her family to be healthy and happy, and to build a new house.

loans.use: to purchase sand, cement, brick and equipment to build a new toilet.

loans.name: Meriam

texts.en:
Meriam is a 35-year-old woman from Clarin Bohol. She is married and has four children, ages 14, 12, 7 and 4 years old. She earns a living through buying and selling RTW (ready to wear) such as bags, slippers, shoes, shirts and underwear. She also sells frozen goods such as hot dogs and sweetened meat.

She has been doing this for three years. Meriam is asking for a loan to buy more RTW products and frozen goods to sell in order to enhance their livelihood.

She plans in the future to improve her business to give a better education to her children so that she can send them to college and finish their studies.

loans.use: to buy RTW, such as bags, slippers, shoes, shirts and underwear. She will also buy frozen goods, such as hot dogs and sweetened meat.

loans.name: Faith

texts.en:
Faith is a married woman. She has two children.

She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a strategic place, and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

She will use the KES 80,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes.

Her business goal is to open another business outlet within five years. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to puchase additional stock.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes.

loans.name: Rosenda

texts.en:
Rosenda is 65 years old and married with adult-age children. She is known in Bato, Plaridel, Misamis Occidental for her snack vending business. She is a MIGS (member in good standing) member of Paglaum MPC, and she had accessed a loan for her business needs.

This time, she needs to have enough inventory of ingredients, so she is asking for a loan to purchase bags of flour, sugar, margarine, butter, cheese, cooking oil, and other ingredients.

loans.use: to purchase bags of flour, sugar, margarine, butter, cheese, cooking oil, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Milcah

texts.en:
Milcah is a married woman. She has 2 children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 5 years.

Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

She will use the Kes 100,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. She hopes that in the future, she will improve the business. This is her fifth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes.

loans.name: Zhanna

texts.en:
This woman is 52 years old, and her name is Zhanna. She lives in Sevan city in the Gegharkunik region. Zhanna is married, and she has a son.

Zhanna graduated from Vanadzor city’s State Pedagogical Institute, and she is a specialist of Armenian language and literature. She has a great deal of pedagogical experience, and now she also works at the school as a teacher of Armenian language and literature. Zhanna is also busy preparing pupils for their entrance exam. Her courses are conducted at her house in a separate room.

With this Kiva loan, Zhanna would like to buy a computer and also several items of very important, innovative, professional literature, which she greatly needs, and which will greatly help her to develop the quality of her courses.

loans.use: to buy a computer and also several items of very important, innovative, professional literature.

loans.name: Hellen

texts.en:
Hellen is a married woman. She has three children. She operates a retail business where she sells tomatoes, carrots, and onions. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the perishability of goods.

She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more stock of tomatoes, carrots, and onions.

This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tomatoes, carrots, and onions.

loans.name: Meriam

texts.en:
Meriam is managing her fish stall business in Usocan, Plaridel. She mastered the business when she and her husband were in the early years of their marriage. The business has been doing well, supporting the needs of the family.

Recently, Meriam borrowed an amount to buy more fish to sell.

She wants to expand her business and would be happier if she could acquire an additional stall.

loans.use: to buy more fish to sell.

loans.name: Millicent

texts.en: Millicent is a married woman. She has five children. She describes herself to be humble. She operates a retail business where she sells cereals. She has been involved in this business for nine years. Her business is located in a good place and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low stock. She will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more stock of maize and beans. Her business goal is to have a cereals store within five years. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to puchase additional stock.

loans.use: to buy more stock of maize and beans

loans.name: Joann

texts.en: Joann is a business-minded person. She has owned and operated her grocery store for two years. She offers complete grocery items. She has been living with her live-in partner since 2011 and they are blessed with two children. Joann also has six hectares of corn farm land. With her determination to obtain a better income and improve her grocery store, she is requesting a loan of PHP 50,000 to buy more stocks of grocery items, sacks of rice and hog feed. She is hoping to avail this loan to keep her business progressive and have a stable source of income.

loans.use: to purchase stocks of grocery items, sacks of rice and hog feed to sell

loans.name: Oscar Alejandro

texts.es:
Oscar ha sabido administrar los créditos que la institución le otorga, así como también las ganancias, su negocio continúa con vida y él aporta un poco más para que en su hogar disminuyan las necesidades.
Hace la solicitud de un nuevo crédito para comprar CD´S, DVD´S, recipientes plásticos, detergentes, y otros productos que le sean de utilidad para mantener las ventas y clientes satisfechos, espera seguir progresando.
texts.en:
Oscar has done a good job administering the loans that the institution has offered him, as well as managing the earnings. His business continues to go strong and he contributes a bit more to household expenses so that more of the needs are taken care of. 

He is once again requesting a loan to purchase CDs, DVDs, plastic containers, detergents and other products that will be useful in order to keep up with sales and keep his clients satisfied. He hopes to continue progressing.

loans.use: to purchase CDs, DVDs, plastic containers, detergent, and other products that are useful to keep up with sales and keep clients satisfied.

loans.name: Dorila

texts.es:
Dorila, tiene como negocio una pupusería y practica la crianza de pollos, es casada, tiene dos hijos, vive con su esposo y uno de sus hijos vive en otra vivienda pero muy cercana a la suya; el negocio lo aprendió por iniciativa propia y su nuera le ayuda a realizar las actividades del negocio.
Con el financiamiento tiene programado comprar harina, quesillo, tomates, repollos, aceite, etc., reparara la plancha de hacer pupusas y remodelara el local, pretende tener una pupusería bien equipada y con buena imagen para que sus clientes tengan calidad y comodidad al momento de consumir su producto, no tiene riesgos en la inversión.
Dorila tiene como visión mejorar su negocio, mantener buen record en el uso de créditos y remodelar su vivienda.
texts.en: Dorila's business is a store where she makes pupusas (stuffed tortillas), and she also raises chickens. She is married and has two children. She lives with her husband, and one of her children lives in another house which is very close to hers. She learned this business on her own initiative, and her daughter in law helps her with the business activities. With the loan she wants to buy flour, fresh cheese, tomatoes, cabbage, oil, etc., to repair the grill to make "pupusas" and to remodel the store. She wants to have a well equipped "pupusa" store, with a good image so that her customers have quality and comfort when they are consuming her product, and she has no risks in her investment. Dora's vision is to improve her business, to keep a good record in the use of the loans, and to remodel her house.

loans.use: to buy flour, fresh cheese, tomatoes, cabbage, oil, etc., to repair the grill to make "pupusas" (stuffed tortillas) and to remodel the store.

loans.name: Daniel Isaac

texts.es:
Daniel, opta por un nuevo crédito por la facilidad de pago y atención que le brinda Padecomsm, lo invertirá en suelas, hilos, agujas, pega y cuero, tendrá a su alcance los materiales necesarios para reparar calzado.
Con la facilidad de tener recursos económicos que le dio el crédito anterior, tuvo oportunidad de mejorar su negocio, trabajar con mayor calidad e incrementar sus ingresos, con los que cancelo las cuotas de la deuda y da mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en: Daniel is choosing a new loan because of the payment facilities and the service given by  Padecomsm. He will invest it in: soles, threads, glue and leather, to have the needed materials to repair shoes. With the facilities from the previous loan, he had the chance to improve his business, to work with better quality and to increase his income. With the earnings, he was able to pay off his debt and give better quality of life to his family.

loans.use: to invest in soles, threads, needles, glue and leather, and have the needed materials to repair shoes.

loans.name: Lilia

texts.en:
Lilia has wide experience in farming. She has mastered farming activities including growing, caring, harvesting and earning income as well. Lilia has supported her husband doing this type of work. Like a farmer, Lilia has nurtured her membership with PMPC and has maintained a good repayment record. She knows she can always turn to the Cooperative for her financial needs. Recently, she applied for a loan to purchase rice seeds so she will have good results in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings.

Someday, Lilia hopes to purchase more rice land to cultivate that will potentially add income for the family.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds so she will have good results in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings.

loans.name: Moises

texts.en: When Moises, a farmer in Burgos, Lopez Jaena, learned about Paglaum MPC and the financial assistance it gives start-ups, he tried his luck and took out a loan to jump-start his corn production. After several months, he was able to repay his borrowed capital. To this day, Moises feels he owes his good fortune to the Cooperative for having trusted him with the money he used to start his business. Recently, he borrowed again to buy farm inputs and fertilizer for the next crop season. Moises wishes to sustain his business and be able to supply rice to the neighboring towns.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs and fertilizer

loans.name: Sunita

texts.en:
Sunita is 33 years old. She is married and has one child, seven years old. A few years ago, she established her milk sales business. Working seven days a week and eight hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid four loans from Patan BPW, and she used her most recent to buy feed and medicines. In the future, Sunita plans to improve the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support.

Dairy cows are an important source of nutrition and income in Nepal. Cows are not raised for beef, but for their milk, from which curd (duy) and fresh cheese (paneer) are made. Jersey cows are the preferred breed for milking. On average, a dairy cow in Nepal will produce about 10 liters of milk each day. In the local market, a liter of milk sells for about 50 U.S. cents. In addition to producing milk, cows provide dung that is used in home construction and as fuel for fires, and which can be captured in methane storage tanks. The purchase of a dairy cow, made possible through a Kiva loan, is an investment that will pay for itself many times over.

loans.use: to buy feed and medicines.

loans.name: Narine

texts.en: Narine, 54, lives in Vanadzor, a city in the Lori region. Narine has studied pedagogy, and she is a specialist in Armenian Language and Literature. Narine likes her work and is devoted to her profession. She has been doing her beloved work for 25 years with the same interest and enthusiasm that she had many years ago, when she was very young and started her pedagogical activities. Now Narine also gives paid private courses at her house, preparing pupils for their entrance examinations. Narine has two daughters, both of whom are married. She lives with her sister. Her husband works abroad. Narine will be very happy to receive this loan, as she wants to buy a computer and also several professional works for her self-development activities.

loans.use: to buy a computer, as well as professional literature for her self-development activities.

loans.name: Primitivo

texts.en: Primitivo supports his family with his bakery. He bakes “binangkal” (a fried bread with a sesame seed coating) and “nilubid” (a fried dough sprinkled with sugar). He has been doing this for five years, to earn a living and to provide the needs of his family. Primitivo is a married man and a father of five children. His oldest child is 21 years old, while his youngest school-aged child is 11. He dreams in the future of enhanceing their livelihood, for the sake of his children’s education. He is applying for a loan to buy baking ingredients, such as flour, sugar, milk and sesame seeds.

loans.use: to buy baking ingredients, such as flour, sugar, milk and sesame seeds.

loans.name: Dorcas

texts.en:
Dorcas is a married woman. She describes herself to be ambitious. She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, milk, flour, bread, salt and other items. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, milk, flour, soap and other items. She hopes that in the future, she will open a supermarket.

This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to purchase additional stock.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, milk, flour, soap and other items.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en: Gladys is a Kiva borrower. She has five children, and she operates a retail business where she sells beauty products. Gladys has been in this business for six years. Her business is located in a strategic place, and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge as a shortage of stock. Gladys will use her KES 10,000 loan to buy more beauty products. Her business goal is to have a big boutique within five years. This is her third loan from SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her prior loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to buy additional stock.

loans.use: to enlarge her stock of beauty products.

loans.name: Arnold

texts.en: Arnold landed at the right place for his needed capital when he joined PMPC. He knew this would be his last chance to get back on his feet when he went broke after his first business went bad. PMPC came to Arnold as a rescuer, lending him money when he needed it the most. Now, he availed of another loan for the next cropping season. He took a loan amount for land and seedbed preparation.  Arnold perseveres and always believes in reaching for his goals to continuously provide for his family.

loans.use: to pay for land and seedbed preparation

loans.name: Karine

texts.en:
Karine, with her beloved husband and two children, lives in Tsovagyugh in Gegharkunik region. Karine has no higher education but she is a master in farming, in which she has been engaged since she got married as a 18-year-old lady. Cattle care and also land cultivation she does perfectly and with pleasure, and her husband also helps her in that work. On the farm she has cows, calves, heifers, a bull, pigs, sheep and chickens. Karine arranges the sale of her farm products easily, as she sells very tasty milk, macun (a national dairy product), cheese, meat and eggs. On her plot of land she cultivates potatoes, peppers, cucumbers, tomatoes, greens and garlic. These products she takes to the city’s wholesale market and sells mainly to re-sellers.

Now Karine has some worries connected with fodder for her farm cattle, and she wants to solve this problem with the help of Kiva loan. She will use this loan amount of 550.000 Armenian drams for the purchase of fodder for all her farm cattle.

loans.use: purchase fodder for all her farm cattle.

loans.name: Karori

texts.en:
Karori has requested a loan of ugx3,000,000. This is his fourth loan from UGAFODE MDI. He is 39 years old, married, and has five children. Of the five children, three attend school. His children are 13, 10, 8, 6, and 4 years old. He has no additional dependents.

Karori trades in goats. He works 8 hours a day. He also earns money from his coffee garden. He started this business in 2005 in Karangara village, Bunyaruguru county Rubirizi District. He started this business to earn money to take care of his family. He says he will use this loan to buy more goats for trade. He sells to hotels and schools. His dream is to grow his business

loans.use: to buy more goats for trade

loans.name: Saraswoti

texts.en:
Saraswoti is 38 years old. She is married and has two children aged 18 and 15 years old. Many years ago, she established her produce and vegetable sales business. Working seven days a week and eight hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid twelve loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy pesticides and seeds. In the future, Saraswoti plans to uplift the economic conditions of her family. She thanks you for your support.

Over 70% of Nepal's economy is agricultural. Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land. Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet. With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seed and fertilizer. With more seeds and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market. Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much-needed cash income throughout the year.

loans.use: to buy seeds and pesticides

loans.name: Batsaikhan

texts.en: Mr. Batsaikhan, 28 years old, lives with his wife in Erdenet, the third largest city in Mongolia. He has been working as a technician at a road company since 2009. His wife works at a carpet company. The young couple moved into an old house and wants to renovate it before winter. So he is requesting a loan of 1,000 USD to buy building materials such as bricks, cement, fiberglass and foam. After the renovation, his family will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned for heating, releasing less pollutants into the air.

loans.use: to renovate his house in order to burn less coal.

loans.name: Getrude

texts.en:
Getrude is a married woman. She has five children. She describes herself to be optimistic. She operates a restaurant. She has been involved in this business for seven years. Her business is located in a favourable location and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy ingredients for preparing food. Her business goal is to have a stable business within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for preparing food.

loans.name: Evan

texts.en: Evan is a married man with one child. He operates a farm where he grows rice. His business is located in a fertile area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy fertilizer and other farm inputs. He hopes that in the future he will have improved living standards. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Damaris Aracely

texts.es: Damaris tiene 31 años de edad es madre soltera habita en casa de su propiedad junto a sus tres amados hijos de 15 años, 12 años y la más pequeña de 7 años de edad a los que con mucho sacrificio está sacando adelante en sus estudios porque quiere verlos triunfar en la vida, ella es una mujer muy luchadora que se preocupa por llevar el sustento al hogar y que no les falte nada. Damaris se dedica a la elaboración y venta de sopa de patas los fines de semana y buscando la manera de obtener mejores ingresos económicos se ha dedicado a la elaboración y venta de pupusas todos los días solo por las noches desde hace 8 años, por lo que desea comprar más materia prima para su negocio, y mandar a reparar su plancha de horno por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: platos soperos, bolsas, cuchara, quesillo, quintales de maíz, frijol, manteca, tomate, repollo, vinagre, cebolla pepino, y a la vez brindarles una mejor condición de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Damaris is a 31 year old single mother who lives in her own home with her three beloved children, ages 15, 12 and the youngest is 7. With great sacrifice she is pulling them ahead in their studies because she wants to see them triumph in life. She's a very strong woman who cares about putting food on the table and ensuring that they want for nothing.

Damaris makes her living with the preparation and sale of potato soup on the weekends, and is looking for ways to earn a better income. She has been preparing and selling Pupusas daily, always at night, for 8 years. She wants to buy more ingredients for her business and to repair her cooking pan, so she is requesting a loan with FUSAI to invest in: soup bowls, bags, spoons, cottage cheese, sacks of corn, beans, butter, tomato, cabbage, vinegar, cucumber, onion, and also to provide a better quality of life for her children.

loans.use: to invest in: soup bowls, bags, spoons, cottage cheese, sacks of corn, beans, butter, tomato, cabbage, vinegar, onions and cucumbers.

loans.name: Carolina Yesika

texts.es: Carolina es una microempresaria Barranquillera de 43 años que reside en un barrio del municipio en compañía de su cónyuge e hijos, dos niños de 6 y 14 años. Desde el año 2000, se dedica a la confección de ropa interior, trajes de baño y pijamas para mujeres; su madre siempre se dedicó a este ofició  y por su experiencia la motivó para que conjuntamente con sus hermanas organizaran su taller, además siempre quiso tener una microempresa familiar. Sus clientes son familiares, amigos y referidos que al ver la calidad de sus productos se deciden a comprar; ella afirma que no tiene un horario definido de trabajo, pues está siempre disponible para atender a su clientela. Actualmente tramita su primer credikiva con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, financiamiento que planea invertir en telas e insumos con el fin de mantener un inventario suficiente que le permita atender la demanda  que genera la temporada de fin de año. Carolina sueña con adecuar su taller con maquinaria de última tecnología que le permita mejorar la calidad y el acabado de sus productos y fortalecer su negocio de tal manera que le genere ingresos suficientes para brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Carolina is a micro-entrepreneur from Barranquilla who is 43 years old and lives with her life partner and children who are 6 and 14 years old.

She has been making women's underwear, bathing suits and pajamas since the year 2000. Her mother always did this and her experience motivated Carolina to start up her own shop with her sisters, as she always wanted to have a small family business. Her customers are family members, friends, and others who decide to make purchases when they see the quality of her products. Carolina states that she doesn't have a set work schedule but is always available to tend to her customers.

Currently she is applying for her first Kiva loan through Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo. She plans to use the money to invest in fabrics and supplies so she can maintain an inventory large enough to satisfy the demand generated during the year-end season.

Carolina dreams of outfitting her shop with the most technologically advanced machines so she can improve the quality and finishing of her products and strengthen her business so that it will generate enough income for her to provide a good education for her children.

loans.use: to invest in fabrics and supplies.

loans.name: Rama

texts.en:
Rama is 32 years old. She is married and has three children, ages eleven, nine, and one.

Many years ago, she established her poultry farming business. Working seven days a week and four hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid five loans from Patan BPW, and she used her most recent loan to buy chicks for her business.

In the future, Rama plans to uplift the economic conditions of her family. She thanks you for your support.

In the Kathmandu Valley, raising poultry for eggs and meat is a very profitable business. Kiva loans are used to purchase chicks, food, and necessary medicine to keep the chickens healthy. Once matured, the chickens are sold at small butcher shops or in the many open air markets throughout the valley.

loans.use: to buy small chicks for her business

loans.name: Ramon

texts.en: Ramon and his family live in the town of Clarin in Bohol, Philipines. He is married and has three teenage sons aged 18, 16 and 15 years old. He raised his family through his furniture-making business. He has been doing this for seven years. Aside from this, he also engages in raising pigs. Ramon works hard to provide for the needs of his family and to give a good education to his children. Thus, he is asking for an amount to buy plywood and nails for furniture making, and to buy feed for his pigs. Additionally, 45-year-old Ramon dreams of improving his business to have a better means of living in the future.

loans.use: to buy plywood and nails for furniture making, and to buy feed for his pigs.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan is in the variety store business. She started running this business in 2008. She is married to a farmer and has four children. Three of her children go to school while her youngest child is still an infant. Susan would like to borrow additional capital of PHP 10,000 to buy stocks of grocery items such as sugar, ingredients, flour, detergent soap, bath soap, shampoo and coffee to sell. She knows that she could improve her variety store and obtain better income.

loans.use: to buy stocks of grocery items such as sugar, ingredients, flour, detergent soap, bath soap, shampoo and coffee to sell.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en: Mercy is a married woman with three children. She operates a tailoring business where she makes clothes. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more stock of tailoring materials. Her business goal is to have a big tailoring shop within five years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tailoring materials

loans.name: Omar

texts.en:
Omar is a single man. He describes himself to be ambitious. He operates a retail business where he sells charcoal.

He has been involved in this business for five years. His business is located in a good area, and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be rain, which affects business.

He will use the Kes 100,000 loan to buy more stocks of charcoal. His business goal is to buy a lorry for transport within five years. He will use the anticipated profits to expand his business.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of charcoal.

loans.name: Vagharshak

texts.en: Vagharshak lives with his beloved wife, son and daughter (both of them are school-aged) in the Tsovagyugh village of the Gegharkunik region. He has been a farmer for 20 years. He has cows, a heifer, a bull, a pig and piglets on his farm. He is also a master in land cultivation work and sells a very good sort of potato. He sells all of his farm products such as milk, cheese, meat and potatoes from his land at the local wholesale market to his regular customers. Vagharshak needs more income for his family and he hopes that growing his farm will somehow solve this problem. With this Kiva loan he wants to buy one more cow and fodder for his farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy one more cow and fodder for his farm cattle.

loans.name: Winrose

texts.en: Winrose is a married woman with six children. She operates a retail business where she sells meat. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her primary customers are locals. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of meat. Her business goal is to have a bigger business within five years. She hopes that in the future she will have a stable business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of meat

loans.name: Oridah

texts.en: Oridah is a Kiva borrower with three children. She operates a tailoring business where she makes clothes. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her primary customers are locals. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of tailoring materials. She hopes that in the future, she will have better living standards. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She will use the anticipated profits to buy another sewing machine.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tailoring materials

loans.name: Baatar

texts.en:
Mr. Baatar, 53 years old, lives with his wife and daughter in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been rendering taxi services to local people since 2005.

Using his previous loan four years ago, he renovated his house, but over time, the house became damaged. So he is requesting a loan of 1,000 USD to buy building materials such as bricks, cements, fiberglass, and foam for house renovation. By doing so, his family will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned for heating, releasing less pollutants into the air.

loans.use: to renovate his house in order to burn less coal

loans.name: Meena

texts.en:
Meena is 29 years old. She is married and has two children, aged 10 and 4. Many years ago, she established her grocery store business. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid four loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy grocery goods for her business. In the future, Meena plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support.

In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery store, called a pasal, is an important part of the local economy. Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home. Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margins. By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability. While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods for her store

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en: Margaret is a married woman with five children. She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, salt, rice, cooking oil, soft drinks, flour and other items. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the KES 60,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, bread, flour, salt and other items. Her business goal is to own a wholesale business within five years. This is her fifth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to expand to a wholesale business.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, bread, flour, salt and other items

loans.name: Nabina

texts.en:
Nabina is 28 years old. She is married and has three children aged three, two and one year old. Many years ago, she established her poultry farming business. Working seven days a week and four hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid one loan from Patan BPW and used her most recent loan to buy small chicks for her business. In the future, Nabina plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support.

In the Kathmandu Valley, raising poultry for eggs and meat is a very profitable business. Kiva loans are used to purchase chicks, food, and necessary medicine to keep the chickens healthy. Once mature, the chickens are sold at small butcher shops or in the many open air markets throughout the valley.

loans.use: to buy small chicks

loans.name: Malaasen

texts.en: Malaasen is a married woman with two children. She describes herself as patient. She owns rental houses. She has been involved in this business for one year. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy materials to renovate her rental houses. She hopes that in the future she will educate her children to university level. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy materials to renovate her rental houses.

loans.name: Agam

texts.en:
Agam is a married 36-year-old woman with two children aged ten and eighteen years old. Many years ago she established her poultry farming business. Working seven days a week and four hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid six loans from Patan BPW. She used her most recent loan to buy chicks for her business. In the future, Agam plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support.

In the Kathmandu Valley, raising poultry for eggs and meat is a very profitable business. Kiva loans are used to purchase chicks, food, and necessary medicine to keep the chickens healthy. Once mature, the chickens are sold at small butcher shops or in the many open air markets throughout the valley.

loans.use: to buy small chicks for her business

loans.name: Zakayo

texts.en: Zakayo is a married man with three children. He operates a farm where he grows rice. His business is located in a fertile area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy fertilizer and other farm inputs. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm inputs

loans.name: Darlet

texts.en:
Darlet is 45 years old and married with two children. With both children in school, Darlet works very hard to provide for them.

Darlet has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell.

Darlet has been in this business for four years and sells a variety of items such as canned goods, snack food and other groceries.

In the future Darlet would like to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Teresa

texts.en:
Teresa is 46 years old and married with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Teresa has a fishing business in the Philippines. Teresa requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

Teresa has been in this business for 17 years. In the future, Teresa would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and other equipment.

loans.name: Adelfa

texts.en:
Adelfa works hard to support her family. Adelfa is married and has a tailoring shop business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials needed like thread, needles, fabrics, etc. for her tailoring shop.

Adelfa has been in this business for 50 years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials needed like thread, needles, fabrics, etc. for her tailoring shop.

loans.name: Leila

texts.en: Leila is 45 years old. She lives in Batumi district with her husband and school-aged son. Leila works as a cleaner locally and her husband is a driver. They both have a small monthly income. Leila wants to start a trading business and requested a loan. The Start Up program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo enables her to get a loan of 1,000 USD. With the received credit she will start trading clothes and will be able to increase her family income. Leila is very motivated and she hopes that the business will be profitable. Leila awaits your support.

loans.use: to begin trade clothes

loans.name: Magdalena

texts.en:
Magdalena is 60 years old, married, and has eight children.

Magdalena is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Magdalena requested a PHP 40,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vaccines for her pigs.

Magdalena has been raising pigs for 12 years and has borrowed 21 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Magdalena would like to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family's home.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Delgerbuyant

texts.en: Mr. Delgerbuyant, 27 years old, lives with his wife and two children in Ulaanbaatar, the capital city of Mongolia. He has been working as an electrician at a building company since 2011. His wife stays at home, looking after two little children. He wants to renovate his house before winter in order to provide comfortable and warm accommodations for his children. So he is requesting a loan of 1,700 USD to buy building materials such as bricks, cement, fiberglass and foam for his house renovation. By doing so, his family will live in a comfortable and warm place where less coal is burned for heating, releasing less pollutants into the air.

loans.use: to renovate his house in order to burn less coal for heating

loans.name: Martin

texts.en: Martin is a married man with two children. He operates a farm where he grows rice. His business is located in a fertile area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. He will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy fertilizer and other farm inputs. He hopes that in the future he will educate his children to university level.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm inputs.

loans.name: Julius

texts.en: Julius is a married man. He describes himself as trustworthy. He operates a retail business where he sells herbal medicine. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a highly populated place and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. He will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of herbal medicine. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. He will use the anticipated profits to purchase additional stock.

loans.use: to buy more stock of herbal medicine

loans.name: Rebecca

texts.en:
Rebecca is 59 years old and widowed with four children.

Rebecca works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional materials like bread, coffee, cereals, canned goods, biscuits, etc. to sell.

Rebecca has borrowed and paid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for three years and also earns an income from farming vegetables.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Rebecca aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional materials like bread, coffee, cereals, canned goods, biscuits, etc. to sell

loans.name: Sandy

texts.en:
Sandy is 37 years old and married with two children.

Sandy works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 27,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Sandy has borrowed and paid nine loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 17 years and also earns an income from selling frozen foods.

Sandy aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Alma

texts.en:
Alma is 47 years old, married, and has five children, three of whom are in school.

She is in the agricultural business, farming sugarcane in the Philippines. Alma requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Alma has been farming sugarcane for 10 years and has borrowed 24 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Alma would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Celia

texts.en:
Celia is 44 years old and married with four children. Two of her children are enrolled in school.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. Celia is borrowing PHP 35,000 through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Celia has been farming rice for 12 years and also earns additional income from fattening pigs and a general store.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream to save enough money to expand her business and continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Marites

texts.en:
As a married mother of two children, Marites works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from businesses farming rice and fattening pigs. Marites is borrowing PHP 31,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Marites has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Aurelio

texts.en:
Aurelio is a married man with three grown children. He engages in rice retailing for his livelihood. He lives in Concepcion, Ilo-ilo. He has been in that kind of livelihood for quite a long number of years. He needs funds to finance his livelihood.

He would like to improve his earnings by purchasing more sacks of rice to sustain his income. Thus, it would enable him to pay his obligations and he would be able to afford nutritious meals to help with his day-to-day living.

Aurelio is doing his best to continue improving his livelihood by investing in other sources of income to become financially stable.

loans.use: to buy more rice

loans.name: Rosalito

texts.en: Rosalito is a 46-year-old man from Tubigon, Bohol. He is married and has seven children. His oldest school-aged child is 20 years old while his youngest school-aged child is 10 years old. He raised his family by driving his tricycle every day. He is also determined to do other things to enhance their livelihood such as raising pigs. Rosalito has been driving his tricycle for almost 16 years. He is asking for a loan to pay for tricycle maintenance and feed for his pigs. In the future he wants to improve his business for his family.

loans.use: pay for tricycle maintenance and feed for his pigs.

loans.name: Francisco

texts.es:
El Sr. Francisco es dueño de una Aguatería ubicada en el Chaco, comenta que su papá inicio este trabajo hace 18 años, y hoy día el Sr. Francisco continua con este trabajo. Cuenta actualmente tiene 1049 usuarios y es la mejor aguatería de la zona, la mejor tratada y con mejor aceptación en la ciudad.
La aguatería está dotada con infraestructura de primera calidad, tres motores sumergibles y un reservorio para 12.000 lts de agua.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la construcción de un nuevo pozo para poder seguir dando un servicio tan esencial en un área tan necesitada como es el Chaco.
texts.en:
Sr. Francisco is the owner of a water distribution center in El Chaco. He says that his father started in this line of work 18 years ago and today Sr. Francisco continues in this same profession. He currently has 1,049 users and his distribution center is the largest in the area. Francisco provides the best service and is well-received in the city.

His water distribution center is equipped with a first-class infrastructure. There are three submergible motors and a reservoir that holds 12,000 liters of water.

Francisco is requesting this loan so that he can invest in the construction of a new well. This will enable him to continue providing an essential service that is needed in an area such as El Chaco.

loans.use: to build a well for his water distribution center.

loans.name: Doris

texts.en: Doris is a married woman with one child. She describes herself to be reliable. She operates a retail business where she sells rice, bread, sugar, flour and other items. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the KES 10,000 loan to buy more stock of bread, flour, rice, sugar and other items. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She will use the anticipated profits to puchase additional stock.

loans.use: to buy more stock of bread, flour, rice, sugar and other items.

loans.name: Zena

texts.en: Zena is a Kiva borrower. She describes herself as focused. She operates a retail business where she sells beauty products. She has been involved in this business for one year. Her business is located in a busy residential area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more stock of beauty products. Her business goal is to be a supplier of beauty products within five years. She hopes that in the future she will be successful.

loans.use: to buy more stock of beauty products.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en: Catherine is a married woman with two children. She describes herself as humble. She operates a restaurant. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a strategic place and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the KES 95,000 loan to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food and renovate the restaurant. She hopes that in the future, she will buy land. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to renovate the restaurant and buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food.

loans.name: Louela

texts.en:
Louela is 23 years old and has one child. Louela is married and has one child who is in school.

Louela is in the agricultural business, pig fattening in the Philippines. Louela requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase feeds, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs.

Louela has been in pig fattening for two years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Louela would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase feeds, vitamins and other supplies for her pigs

loans.name: Amada

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Amada works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from food vending. Amada is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Amada has been sustaining her business activities through her past seven loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more stock to sell in her general store.

loans.name: Arlyn

texts.en:
Arlyn works hard to support her family. Arlyn is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 19,500 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like flour, cooking oil, sugar, milk, etc.

Arlyn has been in this business for seven years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like flour, cooking oil, sugar, milk, etc

loans.name: Christina

texts.en:
Christina is 57 years old and married with eight children. Two of her children are in school and she is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Christina has a rice milling business in the Philippines. Christina requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy new tools and equipment for her rice milling business.

Christina has been in this business for 15 years. In the future, Christina would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy new tools and equipment for her rice milling business.

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
Melanie is married and works hard to support her family.

She has a food stall business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Melanie is borrowing PHP 29,500 through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of spices to sell in her stall.

Melanie has been sustaining her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF and more recently through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of spices to sell in her stall.

loans.name: Sheila Idiane

texts.es:
Sheila Idiane con 37 años de edad, de estado civil conviviente, con 02 hijos a su cargo. vive en casa de familiar,en el distrito de Cayalti, provincia de Chiclayo, departamento de Lambayeque, país Perú,en una zona rural.

Sheila Idiane se dedica a la venta al por menor de cervezas, gaseosas, hace más de 02 años. Su negocio se encuentra ubicado en su domicilio.Solicita préstamo para invertir en capital de trabajo; cervezas, gaseosas, cigarillos, etc, esto le servirá para tener mayor variedad en lo que vende al público consumidor, con la finalidad de poder satifacer los gustos de sus clientes y asi poder incrementar sus ventas.

Sheila Idiane es recurrente en Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Sheila Idiane is 37 years old, in a common-law relationship, and has two children under her care. She lives in the family house in the District of Cayalti in Chiclayo Province, Department of Lambayeque, in the country of Peru. This is a rural area.

Sheila Idiane has been selling beer and sodas in small quantities for more than two years. Her business is located in her home. She is requesting a loan to invest as operating capital in the purchase of beer, sodas, cigarettes, and other products. This will allow her to have a greater variety of goods that she can sell to the public. In the end, she will be able to satisfy her customers’ tastes and also increase her sales.

Sheila Idiane is a returning client of Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to buy beer, sodas, cigarettes, and other products to sell.

loans.name: Nidiam Del Carmen

texts.es: Nidiam de 37 años combina su rol de ama de casa y madre de dos hijos con sus actividades  comerciales; aprovechando sus habilidades para el comercio, la experiencia y el contacto con el sector de productos cárnicos de su cónyuge que trabaja en una instalación industrial donde se sacrifica el ganado para el consumo de carne, Nidiam desde hace 4 años distribuye carnes, embutidos y vísceras en las tiendas y piqueteaderos del barrio. Así mismo oferta productos por catálogos entre ellas prendas de vestir, calzado, cosméticos y demás a sus a vecinos, familiares y amigos.  Actualmente tramita su primer credikiva con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo con el fin de incrementar su capital de trabajo con el fin de mantener un stock de productos cárnicos que le permita atender demanda de sus productos, pues considera muy importante  la fidelización de sus clientes al igual que desea prepararse con un buen volumen de prendas de vestir, calzado y demás productos que ofrece el catálogo que promociona, para aprovechar la temporada de fin de año. Ella sueña con fortalecer su negocio día a día, mejorar sus ingresos y brindar una buena educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
37-year-old Nidiam combines her role as housewife and mother of two children with her work in sales. She uses her knack for sales, her experience, and her contact with the meat industry from her husband, who works in an industrial installation where livestock are butchered for meat.

For the past 4 years, Nidiam has sold meat, cold cuts, and organ meats in the neighborhood's stores and restaurants. In addition, she sells products by catalog to her neighbors, family, and friends, such as clothing, shoes, cosmetics, and others.

She is currently applying for her first CrediKiva with the Mario Santo Domingo Foundation. Her goal is to increase her working capital, so she can maintain a stock of meat that will allow her to meet the demand for her products.

She considers loyalty to her customers very important, and she also wants to prepare herself with a good amount of clothing, shoes, and other products offered in the catalog that she promotes, in order to take advantage of the end-of-year season.

She dreams of strengthening her business day by day, improving her earnings, and providing her children a good education.

loans.use: to maintain a stock of meat products, and clothing, shoes, and other products offered in her catalog

loans.name: Rey

texts.en: Rey has wide experience in farming. He has mastered farming activities such as growing, caring for, and harvesting and as well as earning income. Rey has supported his wife doing this type of work.  Like a farmer, Rey has nurtured his membership with PMPC and has maintained a good repayment record. He knows he can always turn to the Cooperative for his financial needs. Recently, he applied for a loan to purchase rice seeds so he will have good results in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings.  Someday, Rey hopes to purchase more rice land to cultivate that will potentially add income for the family.

loans.use: to purchase rice seeds so he will have good results in healthier, heavier, and potentially higher-yielding seedlings

loans.name: Bella

texts.en:
Bella is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines and is borrowing PHP 29000 through NWTF to purchase additional sacks of fertilizers.

She supplements this income with earnings from her general store. She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Bella dreams that one day she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional sacks of fertilizers.

loans.name: Cherly

texts.en:
Cherly is single and works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Cherly is borrowing PHP 28,000 through NWTF in order to buy more groceries to sell for her general store business.

Cherly has been sustaining her business activities through her past 20 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Jacklyne

texts.en:
Jacklyne is a married woman. She has 3 children. She describes herself as dedicated. She operates a restaurant and has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her business is located in a strategic place and her primary customers are locals.

She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food.

Her business goal is to have a better restaurant within 5 years. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of ingredients for preparing food

loans.name: Deivis Jhonson

texts.es: Deivis es habitante de un barrio ubicado en Barranquilla en el departamento del Atlántico, en donde reside con su cónyuge e hijos, él tiene 29 años pero su experiencia en la metalmecánica data desde hace once años, porque desde muy joven se involucró en la actividad de su padre de quien aprendió el oficio; en su taller ubicado en un barrio popular de la ciudad, su padre realizaba trabajos a empresas del sector metalmecánico, todo lo relacionado con construcciones metálicas, montajes metálicos, carpintería metálica y  reparaciones en general, de este modo Deivis tuvo el privilegio de participar en los procesos productivos que realizaba su padre y convertirse en un experto.  Años más tarde inició su propio taller en el que brinda los mismos servicios que su padre y en la actualidad tramita su primer credikiva a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo el cual piensa invertir en la compra de materiales como láminas de acero, hierro, soldaduras y productos de ferretería en general. Su visión es fortalecer su negocio con la incorporación de nuevas maquinarias, mejorar sus ingresos y adquirir casa propia.
texts.en:
Deivis is an inhabitant of a neighborhood of Barranquilla in el Atlántico department. He lives with his spouse and children. He is 29 years old but his experience in metal mechanics goes back to when he was 11 years old. Since he was very young he was involved in his father's business and he learned the trade.

From his shop in a low income neighborhood of the city his father does work for companies in the metal mechanical sector related with metallic construction, metal assembly, metal carpentry and repairs in general. In this way Deivis had the privilege to participate in the productive processes his father did and become an expert.

Years later he started his own workshop which offers the same services as his father. He is currently processing his first loan from Kiva through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. He is thinking of investing it in the purchase of materials like to buy materials like laminated steel sheeting, steel, solders and general hardware products. His goal is to consolidate his business with the incorporation of new machinery, improving his income and obtain his own house.

loans.use: to buy materials like laminated steel sheeting, steel, solder and general hardware products.

loans.name: Ever Eduardo

texts.es:
Ever es un hombre con 40 años de edad, luego de perder a su esposa, quien falleció hace poco, y quedar totalmente a cargo de sus tres hijos menores, este hombre se dedicó a la cría y venta de ganado, con esto h atenido un gran progreso, los ingresos obtenidos son invertidos en la alimentación, educación y vestimenta de sus hijos.

Su desea es aumentar su producción, aumentar sus clientes e incrementar sus ganancias, es por esto que solicita un préstamo el cual lo invertirá en la compra de ganado porcino y alimento al por mayor para lo los mismos.

Sueña con poder pagar la educación de sus hijos, tener formalizado su negocio y en un futuro que pertenezcan a ellos.

Con su aporte este hombre invertirá en un mejor futuro para su familia, haga un préstamo.
texts.en:
Ever is a 40 year old man. After losing his wife, who passed away a short time ago, he is left with the total responsibility for his three minor children. This man works raising and selling livestock and he has made great progress in this. The income he obtains is invested in the food, education and clothing of his children.

He wishes to increase his production, his number of clients and his profits. So he is requesting a loan that he will invest in the purchase of pigs and food, wholesale, for them.

He dreams of being able to pay for his children's education and formalize his business so that in the future it can belong to them.

With your support this man can invest in a better future for his family. Make a loan.

loans.use: to buy pigs and wholesale feed for them.

loans.name: Vilma Lilian

texts.es: Vilma de 42 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposo y sus tres hijos, ella se dedica desde hace 20 años a la venta de ropa, vende de manera ambulante por las diferentes colonias que se encuentran cerca de su lugar de residencia, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gatos de su hogar, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas ropa por mayor y asi tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en:
42-year-old Vilma lives with her husband and her three children in a house they own.

For the past 20 years, she has worked selling clothes as a traveling saleswoman throughout the different neighborhoods located near her place of residence. With the income she earns, she is able to cover some of her household's expenses.

She is requesting a loan to purchase more clothing wholesale, in order to have better economic income.

loans.use: to buy more clothes wholesale

loans.name: Alejandro De Jesus

texts.es:
Alejandro es un hombre con 21 años de edad, desde niño se dedica a realizar trabajos de campo, una actividad que aprendió gracias a las enseñanzas de su padre. Hoy en día le pertenece un gran cultivo que le genera muy buenos ingresos los cuales son invertidos en sus estudios y aporta para los gastos de su casa.
Se encuentra solicitando un préstamo para poder comprar insumos como insecticidas,  fertilizantes, abonos y otros.
Su  mayor anhelo es continuar trabajando para comprarse su casita.
Con su aporte este hombre podrá hacer de sus sueños una realidad, anímese, haga aun préstamo.
texts.en:
Alejandro is a 21-year-old man. Ever since he was a child he has worked in farming, a trade he has learned through the teachings of his father. He currently owns a large crop which yields him very good profits. He uses the profits to pay for his studies and contribute to his household expenses.

He currently requests a loan in order to purchase supplies such as insecticide, fertilizer, compost and other items.

His biggest wish is to keep on working so that he can buy a little house of his own.

With your contribution, this man will be able to make his dreams come true, so go ahead and make a loan.

loans.use: to purchase supplies such as insecticide, fertilizer, compost, etc.

loans.name: Mario De Jesus

texts.es: Don Mario de 60 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el se dedica al cultivo de maiz y frijol desde hace 20 años, vende sus prodcutos en los alrededores de la zona donde el reside en con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra salir adelante, el esta solicitando un credito para la compra de insumos agricolas como: fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y asi poder continuar con sus cultivos.
texts.en:
60-year-old Mario lives with his family in a house they own. For the past 20 years, he has made a living by growing corn and beans. He sells his products in the areas near where he lives. With what he earns from his sales, he is able to get ahead.

He is requesting a loan to purchase farming supplies such as fertilizers, manure, plague control, etc. in order to continue with his crops.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies such as fertilizers, manure, plague control, etc.

loans.name: Horacio Antonio

texts.es:
Antonio es un hombre soltero con 24 años de edad, con mucho esfuerzo hace poco logro montar su propio negocio, una tienda en un pequeño local arrendado por un familiar.
Trabaja todos los días durante 11 horas.

Los logros obtenidos en las ventas no son suficientes para este hombre que quiere surgir a toda costa para estabilizarse, es por esto que solicita un préstamo con el cual abastecerá su negocio con productos de la canasta familiar, de aseo personal y variedad de bebidas.

Sus deseos de salir adelante son admirables, los diversos factores que lo han llevado al fracaso en situaciones anteriores no han sido impedimento para este hombre querer salir adelante y cumplir con sus sueños, entre ellos tener su casa propia.

Con su aporte este hombre invertirá para un mejor futuro, anímese, haga un préstamo.
texts.en:
Antonio is a 24-year-old single man. With a great deal of effort he recently succeeded in starting his own business, a store at a small venue that he rents from a relative.

He works for 11 hours every day.

The profits he earns from his sales aren't enough for this man who wishes to acquire stability at all costs. That's why he's requesting a loan with which he'll stock his business with household staples, personal care products and a variety of beverages.

His drive to get ahead is admirable. The various factors that have caused him to fail in previous situations haven't stopped this man from wishing to get ahead and accomplish his dreams. One of his dreams is to own a house of his own.

With your contribution, this man will invest in a better future, so go ahead and make a loan.

loans.use: to stock his business with household staples, personal care products and a variety of beverages.

loans.name: Wendy Paola

texts.es: Wendy es una joven emprendedora de 26 años, casada y madre de una niña de dos años. Hace un año ante la necesidad de generar un ingreso adicional para apoyar en los gastos del hogar se decidió por el negocio de decorar fiestas especiales. Ella creció vinculada a la actividad de los eventos porque su padre tiene una empresa dedicada a la producción de eventos musicales, lo que desarrolló su gusto por la decoración y la creatividad;  ella considera que esta actividad  tiene un potencial muy importante, debido a que las personas buscan una experiencia completa en sus fiestas, lo cual incluye un decorado para la ocasión y que ellos no dominan. Así ella se dedica a  decorar casas para distintos eventos, como fiestas de años nuevo, cumpleaños (con decoraciones especiales de acuerdo al número de años cumplidos), aniversarios de bodas, entre otros.  Wendy no cuenta con los muebles y accesorios que requiere para el ejercicio de su actividad, por lo que debe incurrir en gastos de alquiler para cada evento, circunstancia que proyecta solucionar con los recursos provenientes de su primer credikiva que actualmente tramita con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. Su visión es ampliar la cobertura de su servicio a otras ciudades, fidelizar  clientela con buenos precios y buena calidad generando utilidades suficientes que a futuro le permita comprar su propio apartamento.
texts.en: Wendy is an enterprising 26 year old young woman and the mother of a two year old girl. A year ago, faced with the need to generate additional income to support her household expenses, she decided to start a business decorating special parties. She grew up with links to the events business, because her father has a company producing musical events. This made her develop her taste for decoration and creativity. She thinks this business has a very important potential, because people look for complete experience in their parties which includes decoration for each occasion, and which they do not master. Thus, she works decorating houses for different events, such as New Year parties, birthdays (with special decorations according to the birthday age they are celebrating), wedding anniversaries, among other events. Wendy does not have the required furniture and accessories to carry out her job; therefore, she has to spend money in rental expenses for each event. She wants to solve this situation with the resources from her first Credikiva loan, to which she is currently applying through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. Her vision is to expand the coverage of her services to other cities, to get her customers' loyalty through good prices and good quality, generating enough profit to allow her in the future to buy her own apartment.

loans.use: to pay for rental expenses of each event.

loans.name: Bakari

texts.en:
Bakari is a Kiva borrower.  For 3 years he has operated a hardware store selling pipes, iron sheets, cement, and other hardware items.  His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals.

Bakari will use the 40,000 KES loan to buy additional stock of hardware items.  His business goal is to operate a big hardware store within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of hardware items.

loans.name: Blanca Stella

texts.es:
Stella es una señora con 39 años de edad, trabajadora y muy humilde, tiene dos hijos menores los cuales adora con todas sus fuerzas y son el motor que la impulsa a salir adelante y luchar por un futuro mejor.
Esta señora desde hace poco logro  montar sus primer negocio, una pequeña tienda la cual ubico en la sala de la casa donde reside, con los ingresos obtenido por las ventas Stella logra cubrir las necesidades básicas de su hogar.

Se encuentra solicitando un préstamo el cual lo invertirá en la compra de vitrinas, pintura para dar una mejor imagen y principalmente en surtido como aceite, arroz, carnes frías y bebidas.
Con esto espera ser más competitivo en el mercado, aumentar sus clientes y ofrecer un mejor servicio.

Su mayor anhelo es poder pagar la educación de sus hijos y mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda.
Sabe que de la mano de Interactuar y los colaboradores del portal Kiva sus sueños se cumplirán.
texts.en:
Stella is a 39-year-old lady who's hardworking and very unassuming. She has two underage children whom she loves with all her heart. They're the driving force that propels her to get ahead and strive for a better future.

This lady has recently succeeded in starting her first business, a small store located in the living room of her house. With the profits she makes from her sales Stella is able to afford the basic necessities of her household.

She's currently requesting a loan which she'll use to purchase display cases and paint for improving the appearance of her store, and especially to stock up on cooking oil, rice, cold cuts and beverages.

That way she hopes to become more competitive in the market, get more customers and offer better services.

Her biggest wish is to afford her children's education and improve her living conditions.

She's confident that with help from Interactuar and Kiva lenders, her dreams will come true.

loans.use: to purchase display cases and paint for improving the appearance of her store, and especially to stock up on cooking oil, rice, cold cuts and beverages.

loans.name: Fara Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel es una señora con 68 años de edad, debido a la situación económica tan dura por la que le toco pasar hace varios meses, ya que su esposo se quedó sin empleo, busco una solución adecuada para surgir en medio de tanta adversidad, inicio a laborar en la cría y venta de ganado, de allí se generan muy buenos ingresos con los cuales logra solventar las necesidades de su casa.

Se encuentra solicitando un crédito con el cual comprará carneros, chivos, alimentación y vacunas para los mismos.

Su principal es ver su casa bonita, ya que esta lleva mucho tiempo de construida y su estado actual no es el mejor.

Con su aporte esta señora podrá cumplir sus sueños, anímese, haga un préstamo.
texts.en:
Isabel is a 68-year-old lady who's been going through a very difficult financial situation for the past several months. Since her husband became unemployed, she searched for an adequate solution for overcoming so much adversity. She started to work on raising and selling cattle, and from that she makes a very good profit with which she's able to afford her household necessities.

She's currently requesting a loan with which she'll purchase rams, kids, feed and vaccines for the animals.

Her biggest wish is to improve her house, because it has been built quite some time ago and it's currently not in the best conditions.

With your contribution this lady will be able to achieve her dreams, so go ahead and make a loan.

loans.use: to purchase rams, kids, feed and vaccines for the animals.

loans.name: Carmen Maria

texts.es:
Carmen es una señora casada con 62 años de edad y vive en el Municipio de Cerete. Junto a su esposo se dedica a la cría y venta de ganado y porcino, un medio por el cual encontraron la solución adecuada a sus problemas económicos, con los ingresos obtenidos de esto pueden pagar el arriendo y la alimentación.
Trabaja todos los días durante 8 horas.

Se encuentra solicitando un préstamo con el cual comprará cerdos y remodelará las marraneras.
Desea es crecer con su negocio, mejorar ventas e incrementar sus ganancias.

Su  mayor sueño es poder ayudar a sus hijos económicamente en sus estudios profesionales.

Con su aporte esta mujer podrá cumplir sus sueños, anímese, haga un préstamo.
texts.en:
Carmen is married and is 62 years old. She lives in the municipality of Cerete. She breeds and sells cattle and pigs with her husband. They found this to provide adequately to their economic problems. Income is able to cover the rent and food.
