She works every day for 8 hours. She requests a loan to buy pigs and to remodel the pigsty. She wants to grow her business, improve sales and increase profit. Her biggest dream is to be able to help her children financially in their professional studies. This loan will enable her fulfill her dreams. Take part and make a loan.

loans.use: to buy pigs and to remodel the pigsty

loans.name: Cherry

texts.en:
Cherry is 50 years old, married, and has eleven children. Six of her children are enrolled in school.

Cherry is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a 22,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Cherry has been raising pigs for six years now, and has borrowed 11 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Cherry would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Martha Cecilia

texts.es:
Marta es una señora con 46 años de edad, tiene tres hijos, uno de ellos ya mayores de edad. Trabajadora y muy humilde. Se dedica a la preparación y venta de arepas las cuales son vendidas en el municipio de San Vicente Ferrer.

Las ventas no son suficientes para esta señora que quiere surgir a toda costa, es por esto que se encuentra solicitando un préstamo con el fin de comprar un horno y una parrilla más grande, también comprara insumos como maíz, sal y harina. Con esto espera aumentar sus cliente, mejorar sus ventas e incrementar sus ganancias.

Su deseo el llegar abrir su primer local, formalizar su negocio y llegar a generar empleo a las personas que  más lo necesiten.

El sueño de Marta es poder pagar la educación de sus hijos, pues su bienestar le preocupa.
Su actitud positiva y los deseos de salir adelante permiten ver en esta persona unas ganas inmensas de superarse y por supuesto una respuesta favorable a su petición.
texts.en:
Marta is 46 years old and has three children. One of them is an adult. She is hardworking and very humble. She prepares and sells arepas which are sold in the municipality of San Vicente Ferrer.

Sales are not enough for her to cover all costs that she wants to cover. This is why she requests a loan to buy an oven and a larger grille. She will also buy inputs such as corn, salt and flour. She expects to increase her customers, improve sales and increase profit.

She hopes to open her first store, formalize her business and create jobs for those in need. Marta's dream is to pay for the education for her children. Their well-being is her concern.

Her positive attitude and desire to succeed shows an immense desire to overcome and of course a favorable response to her request.

loans.use: to buy an oven and a larger grille, as well as inputs such as corn, salt and flour

loans.name: Yawa

texts.fr: Yawa est une femme mariée résidant à Adidogomé avec trois enfants à charge. Yawa est une revendeuse de charbon de bois qui s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché et le revend à la devanture de son domicile. Pour financer son achat, Yawa nécessite ce prêt pour commander des sacs de charbon de bois afin de réaliser plus de bénéfice et soutenir son mari dans les charges de la famille puis permettre une bonne éducation scolaire à leurs enfants.
texts.en: Yawa is a married woman living in  Adidogomé with her three dependent children. Yawa resells charcoal, stocking up twice a month at the marketplace and reselling in front of her house. Yawa needs this loan to restock on charcoal in order to earn more revenues and help her husband provide for family needs as well as their children's education.

loans.use: to buy 13 bags of charcoal.

loans.name: Ana Marie

texts.en:
Ana Marie is 29 years old, married, and works hard to provide for her family.  For 5 years she has operated a general store in the Philippines, and also earns an income from farming rice.  

Ana Marie requested a 23,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell.  She has borrowed and repaid 7 loans from NWTF before this loan. 

Ana Marie aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Luz Dary

texts.es:
Luz es una señora con 47 años de edad, trabajadora y muy humilde, junto a su esposo se dedica a la cría de aves, un medio por el que lograron salir adelante después de que los dos se quedaran sin empleo durante varios meses.
Desde hace poco siente que su negocio ha ido desmejorando en cuento a las ventas, debido a la competencia en el sector, es por esto que solicita un crédito con el cual podrá comprar aves, cuido y mejorara varios galpones que los tiene sin uso por su mal estado.

Esta pareja tiene un sueño en común, es seguir trabajando para comprar la casa que tanto deseas, tener una mejor estabilidad económica y gozar de una buena salud.

Los deseos de salir adelante y su actitud positiva permiten ver en esta pareja unas ganas inmensas de superarse y por supuesto una respuesta favorable a su petición.
texts.en:
Luz is 47 years old, hard-working and very humble. Together with her husband she makes a living raising chickens, a livelihood that has allowed them to come out ahead after several months without work. Recently she feels like her sales have been decreasing due to competition in the market. This is why she is requesting a loan to purchase chickens, and to maintain and improve various sheds that they have been unable to use because of their state of disrepair. 

This member has a common dream, to continue working to buy the house that she so badly desires, and to have better financial stability and enjoy good health. Her positive attitude and desire to come out ahead indicates her ambition and of course her wish to have a favorable response to her loan request.

loans.use: purchase chickens, and maintain and improve sheds which are in a state of disrepair.

loans.name: Emiro Jose

texts.es:
José es un señor con 40 años de edad, vive con su mujer y tienen tres hijos menores de edad, por necesidad económica se dedicó a la cría y venta de ganado, de allí se obtiene buenos ingresos con los cuales logran solventar las necesidades básicas de su hogar.

Este hombre se encuentra solicitando un préstamo para la compra de ganado porcino, alimentación y vacunas para los cerdos en sus primeros meses y también hará la reparación de unas marraneras que las tiene en mal estado.

Su mayor sueño es mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda pero principalmente pagar la educación de sus hijos.

Sabe que de la mano de Interactuar y los colaboradores del portal Kiva sus sueños se cumplirán.
texts.en:
José is 40 years old and lives with his wife and three minor children. Out of economic necessity, he started to breed and sell livestock. He earns good income which meets the basic household needs.

He requests a loan to buy pigs, feed and vaccines for pigs in their first months. He will also repair pigsty that are in poor condition.

His biggest dream is to improve their housing conditions but mainly to pay for the education of their children. He knows that he will fulfill his dreams in the hands of Interact and collaborators of Kiva.

loans.use: to buy pigs, feed and vaccines for pigs in their first months, as well as to repair pigsty that are in poor condition.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Eunice is a married woman with 3 children.  She describes herself as a God fearing person.  

For 4 years Eunice has operated a retail business selling maize, beans, millet, and sorghum.  Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. 

Eunice describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital and will use the 30,000 KES loan to buy additional stock of maize, beans, and millet.  This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.  She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children.			

Her business goal is to own a cereals store within 5 years.

loans.use: to buy additional stock of maize, beans, and millet.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn is 32 years old and married, with seven children.  

For 3 years Marilyn has earned a living by raising livestock in the Philippines. She also earns additional income from selling ready to wear clothing.

Marilyn is borrowing 11,000 PHP through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock.

She is working tirelessly towards the attainment of her dream, to save enough money to afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 56 years old, married and has seven children, two of whom are in school.

Virginia is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Virginia has been raising pigs for four years now, and has borrowed 18 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Virginia would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Ayoko

texts.fr: Mariée et mère de deux enfants, Ayoko est une femme âgée de 37 ans qui vit à Adidogomé. Ayoko est une couturière qui expose des articles de mercerie dans son atelier de couture sise à son domicile. Pour s’approvisionner du nécessaire, Ayoko se rend trois fois par mois au marché et demande ce prêt pour commander des rouleaux de vaselines en vue de gagner un gain et pouvoir subvenir aux besoins de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Married with two children, Ayoko is a 37-year-old woman who lives in Adidogomé. She is a seamstress who displays haberdashery in her sewing shop located in her home.

Ayoko resupplies three times a month at the market and is requesting this loan so she can order rolls of fabric, make some profit, and be able to provide for her children.

loans.use: buy eight rolls of fabric

loans.name: Jacob

texts.en: Jacob is a married man. He has one child. He describes himself to be focused. He operates a farm where he keeps dairy cows. He has been involved in this business for seven years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. He will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more dairy cows. His business goal is to be a large scale farmer within five years. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more dairy cows

loans.name: Gina

texts.en:
Gina is 28 years old and married with one child.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like rice, coffee, milk, soap, noodles, etc. to sell.

Gina has borrowed and paid back 17 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for eight years and also earns an income from pig fattening.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like rice, coffee, milk, soap, noodles, etc. to sell

loans.name: Ahoefa

texts.fr: Ahoefa est une femme mariée âgée de 31 ans qui vit à Baguida. Ayant trois enfants à charge, Ahoefa se bat  pour gagner son revenu  en revendant des plateaux d’œufs. Pour s’approvisionner, Ahoefa se rend cinq fois par mois au marché et le revend en parcourant les quartiers. Pour commander des unités de petits, moyens et grands oeufs, Ahoefa nécessite ce fonds pour financer son approvisionnement. Avec la marge bénéficiaire qui en résultera, Ahoefa va pouvoir aider son mari dans les charges quotidiennes de la famille et favoriser l’éducation scolaire de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Ahoefa is a 31-year-old married woman who lives in Baguida. With three children to care for, Ahoefa struggles to generate income by selling trays of eggs. She resupplies five times a month at the market and resells throughout the neighborhoods.

Ahoefa is requesting this loan so she can resupply by ordering trays of small, medium and large eggs. With the resulting profit margins, Ahoefa will be able to help her husband with daily household expenses and promote her children's education.

loans.use: buy 90 trays of small, medium and large eggs

loans.name: Marissa

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Marissa works hard to support her family.

She has a buy-and-sell ready to wear business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a general store. Marissa is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to purchase more stock of ready to wear to sell for her buy-and-sell ready to wear business.

Marissa has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of ready to wear to sell.

loans.name: Lourdes

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Lourdes works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and also earns additional income from food vending. Lourdes is borrowing PHP 30,000 through NWTF in order to purchase additional groceries to sell for her general store business.

Lourdes has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Adjovi

texts.fr: Agée de 50 ans, Adjovi est une femme mariée qui vit à Baguida avec ses six enfants à charge. Adjovi se bat énormément en revendant de l’huile rouge en bidons. Adjovi s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché et le revend en circulant dans les quartiers environnant. Pour commander des unités de bidons d’huile rouge, Adjovi sollicite ce prêt pour financer son approvisionnement et mieux vendre en vue de réaliser une marge bénéficiaire afin de participer aux charges de la famille.
texts.en:
50-year-old Adjovi is a married woman who lives with her six children in Baguida. She does her best by selling containers of red palm oil.

Adjovi resupplies twice a month at the market and resells throughout the surrounding neighborhoods. She is requesting this loan to finance the order of red palm oil containers, so she can improve her sales, genrate more profits, and help deal with household expenses.

loans.use: buy 32 containers of red palm oil

loans.name: Erma

texts.en:
Erma is 48 years old and married with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Erma has a general store business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 29,500 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Erma has been in this business for 24 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Bernadeth

texts.en:
Bernadeth is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, soft drinks, etc.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like pig fattening and buying and selling ready to wear products.

Bernadeth dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like canned goods, eggs, milk, sugar, soft drinks, etc.

loans.name: Afiavi

texts.fr: Afiwavi est une dynamique femme mariée qui vit à Baguida  avec ses cinq enfants à charge. Afiwavi est âgée de 40 ans et s’active parfaitement  pour avoir une bonne situation financière. Afiwavi est une revendeuse des chaussures qui s’approvisionne quatre fois par mois au marché. Pour atteindre ses objectifs, Afiwavi nécessite ce prêt pour commander des unités de chaussures pour hommes et femmes afin de répondre favorablement aux attentes de ses clients et avoir une autonomie financière remarquable  pour aider ses enfants dans leur éducation scolaire et à leur épanouissement.
texts.en:
Afiwavi is a dynamic married woman who lives in Baguida with five children. She is 40 years old and is quite active at improving her financial situation.

Afiwavi is a retailer of shoes and resupplies four times a month at the market. To achieve her objectives, she is requesting this loan so she can order footwear for men and women in response to her customer's expectations.

She hopes to achieve financial autonomy so she can help her children with their schooling and development.

loans.use: buy 20 pairs of men's shoes and 10 pairs of women's shoes

loans.name: Ayaovi

texts.fr: Ayaovi est une femme mariée résidant à Baguida avec quatre enfants à charge. Ayaovi est une revendeuse de charbon de bois qui s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché et le revend à la devanture de son domicile. Pour financer son achat, Ayaovi nécessite ce prêt pour commander des sacs de charbon de bois afin de réaliser plus de bénéfices et soutenir son mari dans les charges de la famille puis permettre une bonne éducation scolaire à leurs enfants.
texts.en:
Ayaovi is a married woman who resides in Baguida with four children. She is a retailer of charcoal who resupplies twice a month at the market and resells from the front of her home.

To finance her supplies, Ayaovi is requesting this loan to order bags of charcoal, so she can generate more income, support her husband with family expenses, and ensure a good education for their children.

loans.use: buy 15 bags of charcoal

loans.name: Lorna

texts.en:
Lorna is 61 years old and married with four children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stock like soft drinks, eggs, canned goods, coffee, etc.

Lorna has been in this business for 11 years.

In the future Lorna would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like soft drinks, eggs, canned goods, coffee, etc.

loans.name: Bebelyn

texts.en:
Bebelyn is a hardworking woman and her main livelihood is raising animals like ducks and pigs. She has been engaged in that kind of livelihood for more than 10 years.

She lives in the town of Sara, Ilo-ilo. She is married with one grown child. Her husband is a farmer.

She has requested a loan to buy pigs and feed. These will boost her ongoing source of income and at the same time improve the quality of the animals she is about to raise. Thus, causing her to augment her sales and roll-out her capital. Thus, she could now manage her finances wisely and continue struggling her best to make it productive in the future to come.

Bebelyn is extending her thanks for supporting her livelihood to help improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to buy pigs and feed.

loans.name: Ellen

texts.en:
Ellen is a married woman with one child. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Ellen is 29 years old and has one child who is in school.

Ellen has a fishing/fish vending business in the Philippines. Ellen requested a PHP 19,000 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional materials for her business.

Ellen has been in this business for six years. Ellen would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials for her business

loans.name: Dadyluz

texts.en:
Dadyluz is 67 years old and a widow with four children.

Dadyluz works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,500 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Dadyluz has borrowed and repaid 20 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 20 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Dadyluz aspires to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is a Kiva borrower. She describes herself to be loving. She operates a retail business where she sells bags, plastic containers and other items. Her business is located in a good area, and her primary customers are locals.

She describes her family challenge to be lack of enough water. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a water tank

loans.name: Elsa

texts.en:
Elsa is 48 years old and married with three children.

Elsa works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell in her general store.

Elsa has borrowed and paid 19 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 11 years and also earns an income from raising pigs.

Elsa aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell in her general store

loans.name: Lucenia

texts.en:
Lucenia is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with eight children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 27,000 loan through NWTF to buy more items to sell like canned goods, eggs, noodles, soap, shampoo, etc.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like buying and selling nipa roofing and rice grains.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Lucenia dreams that one day, she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more items to sell like canned goods, eggs, noodles, soap, shampoo, etc.

loans.name: Charles

texts.en: Charles is a married man. He has two children. He describes himself to be honest. He operates a retail business where he sells phone accessories and also offers M-pesa services. He has been involved in this business for four years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals. He will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more stock of phone accessories. His business goal is to open another outlet within five years. He hopes that in the future, he will have a good life. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of phone accessories

loans.name: Neolita

texts.en:
Neolita is 75 years old and a widow with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Neolita has a fish vending business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 13,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy more seafood to sell.

Neolita has been in this business for 30 years. In the future, Neolita would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more seafood to sell.

loans.name: Lucrecia

texts.en:
Lucrecia works hard to support her family. Lucrecia is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients for her food production business.

Lucrecia has been in this business for 21 years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy ingredients for her food production business

loans.name: Ma. Amy

texts.en:
Ma. Amy is 38 years old and married with three children.

Ma. Amy works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Ma. Amy has borrowed and repaid nine loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from tailoring.

Ma. Amy aspires to building and expanding her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Ma. Fe

texts.en:
Ma. Fe is 42 years old and married with six children, five of whom are in school. Ma. Fe works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like sugar, sardines, noodles, etc. to sell.

Ma. Fe has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future, Ma. Fe would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks like sugar, sardines, and noodles to sell.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a rug-making business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase more materials for her rug-making business.

Mary has been in this business for 10 years. She earns more income from raising pigs.

Mary has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of building and expanding her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more materials for her business

loans.name: Jane

texts.en: Jane is a single woman. She describes herself to be focused. She operates an M-pesa business where she offers mobile phone based money transfer services. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her business is located in a strategic place and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient float. She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to add M-pesa float. Her business goal is to have a chain of M-pesa businesses within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will own a company. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to add M-pesa float

loans.name: Roseline

texts.en: Roseline is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be faithful. She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, soap, cooking oil, flour and other items. She has been involved in this business for one year. Her primary customers are locals. She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more stock of flour, cooking oil, sugar, soap and other items. She hopes that in the future, she will improve her family. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of flour, cooking oil, sugar, soap and other items.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.en:
Yolanda is a widowed woman with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Yolanda is 62 years old and all of her children are in school.

Yolanda has a fish vending business in the Philippines. Yolanda requested a PHP 19,500 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more varieties of fish to sell in her fish stall.

Yolanda has been in this business for 30 years. In the future, Yolanda would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more varieties of fish to sell in her fish stall.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is 47 years old and married with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

She has a buy and sell of ready to wear products business in the Philippines. Mary Jane requested a PHP 29,500 loan amount through NWTF to purchase additional stocks like shorts, sandals, shirts, pants, etc. to sell.

She successfully paid back her previous loan and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Mary Jane has been in this business for 17 years. In the future, Mary Jane would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock like shorts, sandals, shirts, and pants to sell.

loans.name: Riche

texts.en:
As a married mother of three children, Riche works hard to support her family.

She has a general store business in the Philippines and earns additional income from fattening pigs. Riche is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell in her general store business.

Riche has been sustaining her business activities through her past 22 loans from NWTF and more recently, through Kiva. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: la joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 21 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica a la venta de papas fritas, empanadas entre otros alimentos desde hace 2 años, su negocio esta ubicado cerca de su lugar de residencia y tiene muchos clientes, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, la joven vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de papas, platanos, leche, entre otros ingredientes para continuar con su trabajo y asi
texts.en:
The young woman has her face pixelated because she is 21 years old and lives in a high risk zone.

She has been earning a living selling fries, empanadas and other food for the last two years. Her business is located close to her home and it has many customers. She manages to meet household costs with the profits that she makes.

The young woman lives in her own home with her family. She is applying for a loan in order to buy potatoes, bananas, milk and other ingredients in order to continue working.

loans.use: to buy potatoes, bananas, milk and other ingredients.

loans.name: Erilyn

texts.en:
Erilyn is a merchant from the town of Ajuy, Ilo-ilo. She has sold dried fish for almost 10 years now. She is married with two dependents who are three and eight years old, respectively. Her husband has an income which is fishing, and the fish are used for family consumption and an additional source of income.

She would like to boost her daily earnings by asking for a loan to buy a variety of dried fish. These will maintain the flow of merchandise and prevent her from running out of stock. In this way, Erilyn could now continue to manage her resources well and start to settle her obligations.

In the future, she is determined that she will be expanding her sources of income properly to improve the family's living condition.

loans.use: to buy a variety of dried fish.

loans.name: Onesmus

texts.en: Onesmus is a Kiva borrower. He describes himself to be focused. He operates a retail business where he sells clothes. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a strategic  place and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. He will use the Kes 15,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. He hopes that in the future, he will have a wholesale business. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Emerson

texts.es:
Emerson es un señor soltero con 48 años de edad, dedicado a la venta y cría de ganado, con esto ha tenido un gran progreso, luego de quedar sin empleo este fue el único medio por el cual pudo surgir en medio de tanto obstáculo.
Los ingresos obtenidos de allí son invertidos en su alimentación y en su negocio.
Actualmente se encuentra solicitando un préstamo el cual lo invertirá en la compra de cerdos y alimento para los mismos.
Su sueño es formalizar su negocio y en un futuro dejárselo a sus hijos, también tiene en sus planes remodelar su casa, ya que esta no se encuentra en buen estado.
texts.en:
Emerson is 48 years old and single. He makes a living raising and selling cattle, a business that has allowed him to progress a lot. After being left unemployed, this business was the only means that Emerson had to move forward when so many obstacles blocked other paths.

The income from Emerson's business are invested in food for himself, and in his business.

Emerson is currently applying for a loan to buy pigs and feeds.

Emerson's dream is to formalise his business and one day leave it to his children. In addition, Emerson plans to renovate his house, which is not in very good condition.

loans.use: to buy pigs and feeds.

loans.name: Stephanie Carolina

texts.es: Stephanie de 22 años es una emprendedora que forma parte de un grupo de jóvenes que se formalizaron académicamente mediante un programa de prácticas de fútbol para el desarrollo, que consiste en un modelo constructivista implementado exitosamente por Fútbol con Corazón, un programa social de becas destinadas a niños que hace parte del programa de FCC y con el objetivo de replicar el modelo de intervención de Fútbol con Corazón en otras comunidades e impactar mediante la masificación del modelo a las comunidades, ella se encuentra liderando un grupo de 30 niños a quienes les ofrece los servicios de entrenamiento y la práctica del futbol bajo el esquema de este programa social. Sin embargo requiere capital de trabajo para la adquisición de implementos deportivos como camisetas, guayos, balones, entre otros, proyecto que planea financiar con los recursos del primer credikiva que tramita a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. Su meta es poder abrir otras canchas donde atender un mayor número de niños y personalmente terminar su carrera universitaria.
texts.en:
Stephanie is 22 years old. She is an entrepreneur and part of a group of young people who gained their education through a football programme. This programme uses a constructivist model, and is successfully operated by "Fútbol con Corazón" (FCC, "Football with a heart"). This social programme provides grants to children who are part of FCC.

With a view to replicating the FCC model in other communities and to making an impact by spreading this model, Stephanie is leader of a group of 30 children to whom football training and practice is offered. The football practice is offered within the confines of this social programme.

However, Stephanie needs capital to buy sports equipment, including shirts, trainers, balls and more. She plans to finance this project with her first Kiva loan through the Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo. Stephanie's goal is to have other pitches where she can look after more children. On a personal level, Stephanie would like to finish her university studies.

loans.use: to buy sports supplies such as shirts, balls, trainers and more.

loans.name: Noel

texts.es:
Noel es un hombre campesino con 48 años de edad, desde niño se dedica a realizar actividades de campo gracias a las enseñanzas de sus padres. Con esto ha tenido un gran progreso, actualmente es dueño de un gran cultivo el cual le genera muy buenos ingresos y con lo que logra cubrir la mayoría de sus necesidades.
Trabaja todos los días durante 7 horas diarias.

Se encuentra solicitando un préstamo el cual lo invertirá en la compra de fertilizantes, agro-químicos y canalización de finca.

Su sueño es poder pagar la educación, formalizar su negocio y que en un futuro pertenezca a sus hijos.

Su actitud positiva y los deseos de salir adelante permiten ver en esta persona unas ganas inmensas de superarse y por supuesto una respuesta favorable a su petición.
texts.en:
Noel, 48 years old, is from the countryside. Since he was a boy he has worked in the fields thanks to teachings from his parents. With this up-bringing, Noel has progressed well. He is currently owner of a large farm where he earns a very good income that he uses to pay for the majority of his necessities.

Noel works seven hours per day every day.

He is currently applying for a loan in order to buy fertilisers, agrochemicals, and to create a pipeline system in his farm.

Noel's dream is to pay for his children's education, to formalise his business, and to pass the business on to his children.

Noel's positive attitude and desire to move forward show that Noel is somebody with a huge desire to do better. He would really like this loan request to be approved.

loans.use: to buy fertilisers, agrochemicals, and to create a pipeline system in his farm.

loans.name: Ayoko

texts.fr: Ayoko est une femme mariée âgée de 39 ans résidante à Baguiuda. Mère de quatre enfants, Ayoko prépare du riz qu’elle revend à  la devanture de son domicile. Ayoko s’approvisionne du nécessaire trois fois par mois  au marché et désire ce prêt pour commander le sac de riz, des bidons d’huile et le carton de maca	ronis.  Avec la marge bénéficiaire qui en résultera, Ayoko compte améliorer sa prestation de vente et aider ses enfants à avoir un épanouissement et une bonne éducation scolaire.
texts.en: Ayoko is a married woman of 39, who lives in Baguiuda. She has four children. Ayoko prepares rice that she sells in front of her home. Ayoko buys the stock necessary to her business three times each month at the market. Ayoko requests this loan to order a sack of rice, cans of oil, and a box of macaroni. With the profit margin that this will bring in, Ayoko hopes to improve her sales and help her children to thrive and to receive a good education.

loans.use: to buy 01 sack of rice, 02 cans of oil and 01 carton of macaronis.

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Afi est une femme mariée et mère de trois enfants. Afi vit à Adidogomé et est âgée de 38 ans. Afi fait est une revendeuse des caleçons et de soutiens à gorge. Afi s’approvisionne deux fois par mois  au marché et sollicite ce crédit pour commander des douzaines de caleçons  en vue d’augmenter son stock puis en suite ses recettes; ce qui permettra à Afi de mieux préparer la rentrée scolaire de ses enfants et assurer les dépenses quotidiennes de la famille.
texts.en: Afi is a married woman with three children. Afi lives in Adidogomé and is 38 years old. Afi sells boxer shorts and brassieres. Afi stocks up twice each month at the market, and requests this loan to order dozens of boxer shorts to increase her stock and thus the profits; which will enable Afi to prepare better for the new school term for her children, and to provide for the daily family expenses.

loans.use: to buy 20 dozen pairs of boxer shorts.

loans.name: Jose Arbey

texts.es:
José es un señor con 45 años de edad, trabajador y humilde dedicado a realizar actividades de campo desde niño, gracias a esto hoy en día este hombre ha podido salir con su familia adelante y brindarle una buena estabilidad económica.
Su propósito es continuar trabajando y mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda ya que esta lleva mucho tiempo de construida y su actual estado no es el mejor.

Se encuentra solicitando un préstamo el cual lo invertirá en la adecuación de canales, mano de obra y comprara abonos.
Espera aumentar sus cultivos, mejorar sus ventas y de tal manera sus ganancias.

Sabe que de la mano de Interactuar y los colaboradores del portal Kiva sus sueños se cumplirán.
texts.en:
Jose is 45 years old, hard-working and humble. He has worked in the fields since he was a boy. Thanks to this trade, today Jose has been able to move forward with his family and to give them financial stability.

Jose's aim is to continue working and to improve his home, which is quite old and not in great condition.

Jose is applying for a loan in order to invest in creating drains, to pay labourers, and to buy manure.

Jose hopes to increase his yield and sales, and thus earn higher profits.

Jose knows that, with the help of Interactuar and those at Kiva, he will achieve his dreams.

loans.use: to invest in creating channels for irrigation, to pay labourers, and to buy manure.

loans.name: Voahanginirina

texts.fr: Voahanginirina remercie beaucoup tous les prêteurs qui l'ont donné un coup de pousse lors de son précédent prêt. Grâce à vous, la motivation d'avancer et de continuer à lutter devient très forte. Le désire de se développer et de s'améliorer augmente de pus en plus. Les deux époux continuent à se soutenir mutuellement. La plupart du temps, Madame tient le magasin et son mari assure l'approvisionnement actuellement , à part le suivi des cultures à la campagne. Le prêt va être utilisé pour renouveler et augmenter les stocks de riz car le prix va augmenter surtout pendant la saison d'été.
texts.en: Voahanginirina sends her heartfelt thanks to all the lenders who gave her a helping hand with her previous loan. Thanks to you, she has become very motivated in her desire to move forward and continue to struggle for improvement. The desire to expand and make improvements is increasing. The husband and wife team continues to provide mutual support. Most of the time Madame runs the shop and her husband takes care of the stock, except when the cultures in the country need attention. They will use the loan to increase the stock of rice because the price will go up especially during the summer season.

loans.use: to buy 40 sacks of rice, 50 kg of wheat flour and 75 kg of malagasy rice flour.

loans.name: L’Abondance Group

texts.fr: Angelanie est commerçante qui s’entraide avec son mari, présidente du groupe de crédits «L’Abondance», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, âgée de 43 ans, mère de 12 enfants dont 8 étudient et 4 autres sont mariés. Elle est vendeuse des friperies dans le centre-ville depuis 21 ans. Elle va s’approvisionner en sacs usagés(Cartables). Elle commença son business avec le capital reçu de son mari. Elle souhaite acheter une parcelle, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au final, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en: Angelanie is a saleswoman who helps her husband. She is president of the credit group L'Abondance, and a client of the IMF Hekima. She is 43 and has 12 children, of whom eight attend school and the other four are married. She has been selling secondhand clothing in the town centre for 21 years. She plans to stock up on used school bags. She started her business with capital that her husband gave her. She would like to buy a plot of land, send her children to school and feed them. Finally, she thanks Hekima for their support for non-bankable business owners.

loans.use: to stock up on secondhand satchels.

loans.name: Gilberte Edwige Irmine

texts.fr:
Gilberte  est très satisfaite de l'appui que vous (les prêteurs kiva) lui avez accordé lors du prêt précédent qu'elle vient de terminer et de ce fait vous remercie de tout son cœur. Grâce à vous l'activité se développe petit à petit, et la motivation d'avancer et de s'améliorer croît de plus en plus. 
Elle voudrait encore développer et étendre son affaire et demande un autre crédit et espère que vous allez encore l'aider pour qu'elle puisse réaliser son rêve d'avoir une meilleure condition de vie, et de faire  réussir ses enfants dans leurs études.
texts.en:
Gilberte is very happy with the support that you (the Kiva lenders) gave by granting her a previous loan that she has just finished, and wishes to thank you from the bottom of her heart. Thanks to you, her business is developing little by little, and she is increasingly motivated to move forward and improve.
She would like to continue to expand and develop her business and requests a new loan. She is hoping that you will assist her once again so that she can bring her dream of having better living conditions and children that succeed in their studies, to reality.

loans.use: to buy wood, foam, nails, glue and fabric for her furniture making business,

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy seeds, fertilizer, and other things.

loans.name: Mila Fe

texts.en:
Mila Fe is 41 years old and married with four children who are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

Mila Fe has been running a general store in the Philippines for ten years. She has requested a 29,500 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF to buy additional stock to sell, such as rice, soft drinks and biscuits.

In the future Mila Fe would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional stock such as rice, softdrinks, biscuits, etc. to sell.

loans.name: Vicente

texts.es:
El Sr. Vicente es de la ciudad de Coronel Oviedo, tiene una casa de bebidas y autoservice en la ciudad, comenta que  inició sus actividades en el año 2010 con un pequeño local de venta de bebidas, comenta que con mucho sacrificio fue ampliando su negocio; mediante su buen trato, y cordialidad con su clientela, pero resalta que debió afrontar varios desafíos económicos y personales para poder alcanzar su propósito.
Su anhelo es ir ampliando su bodega y autoservice, para de esa manera incrementar sus ingresos.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de bebidas variadas para poder surtir su negocio y de esa forma poder seguir con sus ventas.
texts.en:
Vicente is from the city of Coronel Oviedo, he has a store of drinks and self-service in the city, he says that he began his businesses in the year 2010 with a little retail space for drinks. He says that with a lot of sacrifice, he expanded his business through his good treatment, friendliness with the customers, but what stands out is that he had to face several economic and personal challenges to be able to reach his goal.

His desire is to expand his store and self-service so, in this way, to increase his income.

He asks for this loan to be able to invest it in the purchase of a variety of drinks to be able to stock his business and in this way to be able to continue with his sales.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of drinks to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase natural medicines to sell.

loans.name: Arturo

texts.es:
El señor  Arturo tiene 26 años, vive en la ciudad de Itá, está casado y junto con su esposa se esfuerzan y se ayudan. Él tiene una Despensa bien surtida  desde hace varios años con una clientela buena y bien formada. 
Posee gran cantidad de productos y con ello ayuda a su familia para poder tener una vida digna y sin privaciones como las que él tuvo que pasar.
Pide este préstamo para poder invertirlo en la compra de frutas, verduras, embutidos, carnes y otros, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo y cumpliendo con el pedido de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Arturo is 26 years old, lives in the city of Itá, is married, and with his wife works hard, helping each other. He has had a well-stocked general store for some years with a good and established customer base.

He has a great quantity of products and with them helps his family to be able to have a dignified life without lacking things like he had to experience.

He asks for this loan to be able to invest it in the purchase of fruits, vegetables, cold cuts, meat, and more, in such a way as to be able to continue with his sales as he has been doing and meeting the requests of his customers.

loans.use: to purchase fruits, vegetables, cold cuts, meat, and more.

loans.name: Carol

texts.en:
Carol is 45 years old and married with one child. She works hard to provide for her family, running a general store in the Philippines. She has requested a 29,500 Philippines pesos (PHP) loan through NWTF in order to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell.

Carol has been in this business for 16 years and has previously received funds through Kiva. She aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her family home.

loans.use: to buy additional stocks of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Emmanuel Group

texts.es:
El grupo llamado Emmanuel está en su tercer ciclo del programa de comités, están dentro del programa de eliminación de la pobreza, donde todas se ayudan para poder salir adelante. Ellas son mujeres jefas de familia que se esfuerzan por sus seres queridos.
Una de las integrantes del grupo es la Sra. Carmelina, ella es la presidenta del grupo, una mujer muy positiva que siempre trata de dar el ejemplo a sus compañeras. Tiene una pequeña despensa en la que todos los días trabaja desde muy temprano, hasta tarde en la noche. Ella es una persona muy trabajadora y emprendedora que quiere ayudar a su familia por medio de su trabajo.
Pide este préstamo para poder comprar insumos para su despensa, como ser verduras, carne, frutas, lácteos, panificados y otros, de manera a poder seguir con sus ventas como lo viene haciendo, y agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar cada día.
texts.en:
The group called Emmanuel is in its third loan cycle in the committee program, they are in the poverty elimination program where they all help each other to be able to get ahead. They are female heads of household who work hard for their loved ones.

One of the members of the group is Carmelina, she is the president of the group, a very positive woman who always tries to be an example for her group. She has a small store in which she works every day from very early to late at night. She is a very hard-working and enterprising person who wants to help her family through her work.

She asks for this loan to be able to purchase supplies for her store, such as vegetables, meat, fruit, dairy products, baked goods, and more, to be able to continue with her sales as she has been doing, and she is grateful for the opportunity that she is getting to be able to improve each day.

loans.use: to purchase supplies for her store such as vegetables, meat, fruit, dairy products, baked goods, and more.

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a hardworking entrepreneur with three children who earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. She is borrowing 27,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Mercy supplements her income with earnings from farming sugar cane. She dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies for her pigs.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a married man with four children who describes himself as optimistic. He operates a retail business selling cereals, which he has been involved in for eight years. His business is located in a market and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge as inadequate working capital.

David will use the 50,000 Kenyan shillings (KES) loan to buy more stock of cereals and build a store house for it. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cereals and build a store house for it.

loans.name: Berta

texts.es:
La Sra. Berta es del Chaco, es dueña de la Elastiquería ubicado en una zona estratégica, realiza este trabajo desde el año 1998, cabe destacar que es la única elastiquería de zona con una ubicación de fácil acceso.
Sus principales clientes son: los camiones de la diferentes empresas de la ciudad y ciudades aledañas, es reconocido por los buenos trabajos realizados. Solicita el crédito para compra de elásticos para poder seguir dando un buen servicio.
texts.en:
Berta is from Chaco.

She owns a suspension repair business located in a strategic area. She has done this work since 1988. It's worth emphasizing that it's the only suspension repair shop in the area, and it's easy to get to. Her main customers are trucks from various businesses in town and the nearby cities. She's known for her good work.

Berta's requesting the loan to buy belts so she can continue to provide good service.

loans.use: to buy belts for her suspension repair business

loans.name: Ricardo Jr.

texts.en:
Ricardo is a 55-year-old man who raised his family through buying and selling dried fish. He has been doing this business for almost 20 years. 

He is asking a loan for additional capital to buy more dried fish to sell to enhance his livelihood. 

Ricardo is a married man and a father of nine adult children. He dreams in the future to improve his business for sustainability. 

He and his family live in the town of Ajuy in Iloilo, Philippines.

loans.use: to buy dried fish.

loans.name: Jose

texts.es:
El Sr. Jose tiene un estudio jurídico en la ciudad de Pilar con años de trayectoria y una gran clientela, está casado tiene un hijo por quien está luchando para poder dar a su familia una vida digna.
Es una persona  muy trabajadora y emprendedora. El motivo del préstamo es para invertir en su oficina con la compra de muebles y equipos para mayor comodidad de su clientela. Agradece por la oportunidad que recibe de poder mejorar su servicio para sus clientes y de esa forma poder seguir con su buen servicio.
texts.en:
José has a law office in the city of Pilar with years of experience and a good clientele. He's married and has a child for whom he's striving, so he can give his family a decent life. He's a very hardworking and enterprising person.

The goal of the loan is to invest in his office with a purchase of furniture and equipment to provide his clients greater comfort.

José is grateful for this opportunity to be able to improve his customer service and, as a result, continue providing a good service.

loans.use: to buy furniture and equipment for his law office

loans.name: Merah

texts.en:
Merah is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children.

She has a nipa roofing business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 26,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy materials needed for her nipa roofing business.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like a general store.

Merah dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy materials needed for her nipa roofing business.

loans.name: Gladys

texts.en:
Gladys is a married woman. She has three children. 

She operates a retail business where she offers outside catering services. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her primary customers are locals. 

She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more chairs for outside catering services. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more chairs for outside catering services.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself as reliable. 

She operates a beauty salon where she offers beauty services. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge as inadequate working capital. 

She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy beauty salon equipment. 

This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy beauty salon equipment.

loans.name: Violeta

texts.en:
Violeta works hard to support her family. Violeta is married and has a making hollow blocks business in the Philippines. Violeta has been in this business for 11 years now.

She requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional materials needed for hollow blocks like cement and sand and gravel.

In the future, Violeta would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase additional materials needed for hollow blocks like cement and sand and gravel.

loans.name: Lalaine

texts.en:
Lalaine is 52 years old, married, and has three children.

Lalaine works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines.She has been in this business for 20 years and has previously received funds through Kiva.

Lalaine requested a PHP 30,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase additional groceries to sell.

Lalaine aspires to save enough money to expand her business and build a home for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional groceries to sell.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
Elizabeth is 33 years old, married and has five children. Four of her children are enrolled in school.

Elizabeth is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She has been raising pigs for eight years now and has borrowed 15 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

Elizabeth requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

In the future, Elizabeth would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her pigs.

loans.name: Tuimizane B Group

texts.fr: Muluziniere est commerçante, membre de la banque communautaire «Tuimizane B», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, âgée de 40 ans, divorcée, mère de 6 enfants dont 5 étudient et 1 est encore gosse. Elle est vendeuse des souliers usagés dans un marché de la ville depuis 15 ans. Elle va s’approvisionner en 4 ballons de souliers. Elle commença son business avec le capital reçu de son ancien mari. Elle souhaite construire une maison, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au final, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en: Muluziniere is a saleswoman. She is a member of the Tuimizane B community bank and a client of the IMF Hekima. She is 40 and divorced with six children, of whom five attend school and one is still a toddler. She has been selling secondhand shoes at the town market for 15 years. She plans to stock up with four bundles of shoes. She started her business with capital that her ex-husband gave her. She would like to build a house, send her children to school and feed them. Finally, she thanks Hekima for their support for non-bankable business owners.

loans.use: to stock up with four bundles of shoes.

loans.name: Rolinda

texts.en:
Rolinda works hard to support her family. Rolinda is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for six years now.

Rolinda requested a PHP 24,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional ingredients like chicken, flour, cooking oil, spices, etc.

In the future, Rolinda would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like chicken, flour, cooking oil, spices, etc.

loans.name: Emma

texts.en:
Emma is 66 years old, married and has two children.

Emma is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Emma requested a PHP 23,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

Emma has been raising pigs for seven years now and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Emma would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy medicines and vaccines for her pigs.

loans.name: Caroline

texts.en:
Caroline is a married woman. She has eight children. 

She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her primary customers are ladies. She describes her biggest business challenge as low stock. 

She will use the KES 20,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She repaid the previous loan  successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes.

loans.name: Yakeny Del Carmen

texts.es:
Desde muy pequeña, Yakeny ayudaba a su papá en los cultivos de frijoles y maíz, aprendizaje y ejemplo que le sirvió de mucha ayuda para ser la gran productora agrícola que es actualmente. A sus 33 años de edad es madre de dos menores de edad, quienes desea verlos convertidos en grandes profesionales, pues ella no tuvo la oportunidad de terminar su primaria. Además cuenta con el apoyo de su esposo, quien trabaja como jardinero en la capital del país. 
No fue hasta diez años atrás que ella decidió unirse con su esposo para emprender por si sola en la siembra de maíz y frijol, ahora hasta cuenta con unas cuantas vacas que también sirven para los ingresos del hogar. En estos momentos Yakeny quiere invertir en su nueva cosecha, pero no quiere vender ninguna de sus vacas, por lo que solicita un préstamo para comprar abono para el ciclo de postrera de frijol y también para comprar una vaquilla para desarrollo. Esto le permitirá crecer en su negocio y así ahorrar para llegar a cerrar con malla su terreno.
texts.en:
Yakeny helped her father with the bean and corn crops from a very young age. This training and his example were a big help to her in becoming the big agricultural producer she is now.

At the age of 33, she's the mother of two young children whom she wants to see become professionals, because she didn't have the opportunity to finish elementary school. She also has the support of her husband, who works as a gardener in the capital. It wasn't until ten years ago that she decided to work with her husband to start growing corn and beans on her own. Now she even has a few cows that also serve as household income.

At the moment Yakeny wants to invest in her next harvest, but she doesn't want to sell any of her cows. As a result she's requesting a loan to buy soil amendments for the last bean harvest and also to buy a heifer to raise. This will allow her to grow her business and consequently save money so she can fence in her plot of land.

loans.use: to buy soil amendments and a heifer

loans.name: Rosanna

texts.en:
Rosanna is 40 years old, married, and has two children who are in school. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 28,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional inventory like sardines, noodles, sugar, chips, bread, etc.

Rosanna has been in this business for 10 years.

In the future she would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase inventory like sardines, noodles, sugar, chips, bread, etc.

loans.name: Anibal

texts.es:
Anibal con 69 años de edad, vive en casa propia de material rústico, junto a su esposa y sus 02 nietos, en la provincia de Callayuc que se encuentra ubicada en la región de Cajamarca, sierra norte del Perú. La comunidad donde vive los habitantes se dedican a la agricultura, ganadería y comercio.

Anibal se dedica a sembrar café variedad catimore, cuenta con experiencia en el negocio y con muy buenas referencias personales y laborales en la zona. El préstamo lo utilizará para invertir en la compra de abono y fertilizantes para el mantenimiento de su terreno cultivable, esta inversión le permitirá ofrecer un café de mejor calidad a sus clientes lo que le generará ganancias para mejorar su condición económica y por ende invertir en mejores condiciones de vida.

Anibal es socio recurrente de Edpyme Alternativa, ha manejado un crédito el cuál lo a cancelado de forma puntual.
texts.en:
Aníbal, 69 years old, lives in a house of his own made of rustic materials with his wife and his two grandchildren in the Callayuc province which is located in the Cajamarca region, Northern Sierra of Peru. In the community where he lives, people work in agriculture, livestock, and trade.

Aníbal makes a living growing the Catimor variety of coffee. He has experience in the business and very good personal and work references in the area. He will use the loan to invest in the purchase of manure and fertilizers for the maintenance of his arable land. This investment will allow him to offer a better quality of coffee to his customers, which will generate him income to improve his financial condition and thus invest in better life conditions.

Aníbal is a recurrent partner of Edpyme Alternativa. He has used a loan which he has canceled in a timely manner.

loans.use: to invest in manure and fertilizers to maintain his cropland.

loans.name: Pedro Anibal

texts.es:
En las áreas rurales, es normal ver a un niño trabajando en el campo, ayudando en la cosecha. Pedro, es uno de esos hombres que de niño tuvo que cambiar sus estudios por ayudar a su familia y aprender a convertirse agricultor con trabajos pequeños. No fue hasta hace veinte años, cuando este emprendedor decidió formar su hogar e iniciar con su propia cosecha de frijoles y de maíz. Ahora, a sus 43 años de edad está casado y es padre de tres hijos, de los cuales está a cargo y quienes apoyan año con año en la cosecha.
Pedro es un hombre trabajador que piensa constantemente en garantizar la alimentación de su familia todo el año, por lo que en verano viaja a Costa Rica en busca de otros ingresos. Por otro lado, aprovechando que se acerca la próxima cosecha, solicita un préstamo para comprar abono, urea, insecticida, refrescantes, veneno para plagas y para pagar 25 días a los trabajadores de la siembra. Con esto podrá asegurar una producción de calidad y así empezar ahorrar con esos ingresos para comprar más terreno.
texts.en:
In the rural areas it is normal to see a child working in the field, helping with the harvest. Pedro is one of these men who from a young age had to exchange his studies for helping his family, and learned to become a farmer with small tasks. It wasn't until he was 20 years old this entrepreneur decided to form his own household and start his own harvest of beans and corn. Now, at 43 years of age, he is married and the father of three children, who are in his care and help him year after year with the harvest.

Pedro is a hardworking man who is constantly thinking of how to provide for his family for the entire year. For this reason, he travels to Costa Rica in the summer in search for additional income. Furthermore, to take advantage of the next approaching harvest, he is requesting a loan to buy fertilizer, urea, insecticide, and compost, as well as to protect his plants from disease and to pay his workers during the 25 day sowing season.

With this he will be able to assure a quality harvest and so begin to save in order to buy more land.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies and to pay his workers.

loans.name: Luis Mateo

texts.es:
De lunes a sábado, se mira por la calles caminar a Luis, un joven, ofreciendo relojes, protectores de celulares, control remoto, entre otras mercancía personales. A sus 43 años, lleva más de 18 años vendiendo de forma ambulante al principio discos musicales y ahora una variedad muy significativa de materiales, que le han permitido para construir su propia casa, junto con su esposa y sus cuatro hijos. 
Luis siempre sueña con extender su inventario, por lo que solicita un préstamo para comprar carteras, reloj, billeteras, focos, entre otras mercancía de alta demanda por sus distintos clientes. Esto le permitirá tener una gran variedad de productos para vender y así obtener mayores ganancias.  En sus planes está ahorrar y así poder establecer en su propia casa una pequeña pulpería para tener otros ingresos para él y para su familia.
texts.en:
From Monday through Saturday, Luis, a young man, can be found walking through the town selling watches, phone covers, remote controls, and other merchandise. At 43 years of age, he has more than 18 years of experience as a traveling salesman, first selling music CDs and now a wide variety of goods. This has allowed him to build his own home, with his wife and their four children.

Luis is always dreaming of expanding his inventory, for which reason he is requesting a loan. He would like to buy purses, watches, wallets, flashlights, and other merchandise that is in high demand by his customers. This would allow him to have a wider variety of products to sell and in this way obtain a greater income. His plans are to save and so be able to set up a small general store in his home to have another income for him and his family.

loans.use: to buy purses, watches, wallets, flashlights and other goods to sell.

loans.name: Faith

texts.en: Faith is a Kiva borrower. She has 5 children. She describes herself to be loving. She operates a retail business where she sells rubber stamps. She has been involved in this business for 8 years. Her primary customers are office people. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low stock of materials for making stamps. She will use the Kes 100,000 loan to buy more stock of materials for making rubber stamps. Her business goal is to have more business outlets within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of materials for making rubber stamps.

loans.name: Arevik

texts.en:
Arevik is from Hovtashen village where she lives with her husband and three sons.
Arevik and her family are involved in farming activities. They keep two cows, calves, and hens. In the greenhouse near their house, Arevik also cultivates peppers and sales the gathered harvest in local markets.

She has applied for this loan to ask lenders help to enlarge their livestock by two cows and calf.
Arevik took a loan from a local financial institution before and was unable to repay it on time, due to her family's weak financial situation and her unemployment. But after years of tireless work, she has been able own a farm, which is profitable enough to cover monthly payments.

Now, Arevik has been approved for a loan, within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products. This loan is very important, for Arevik to enlarge her farm and to be able to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to pay for two cows and a calf

loans.name: Farooqa

texts.en:
When Farooqa decided to start a school in 2010 she was met with many hurdles especially when it came to capital investment. However, she never gave up struggling and is now providing education to over 300 students in her low cost private school.

Recently she requested a loan worth 120,000 PKR for the purpose of construction and furniture purchase. This investment will allow me to provide a better environment to her students as well as teachers. Committed to making education accessible Farooqa wants to expand her school in future and make it an ideal place to learn

loans.use: for the purpose of construction and furniture purchase for her low cost school, which will also be expanded.

loans.name: Armenuhi

texts.en:
Armenuhi and his husband are farmers with many years of experience. They live in Voskevan village in Tavush region with two children, who support their parents with farming works.
Armenuhi's family farm includes livestock (cows, calves, pigs, piglets, hens) and also vegetables and fruit variety (haricot, potato, tomato, plum, pomegranate, grape, walnut and apple).
Her husband takes the harvest to local open markets and sells it, and this is where family's income is formed.

Armenuhi has now applied for this loan to purchase forage for feeding the livestock and to cover the transportation costs. This is very important for their farm in the winter. Armenuhi took a loan from a local financial institution before and was unable to repay it, due to her family's weak financial situation and her unemployment. But after years of tireless work, she has been able to own a farm, which is profitable enough to cover monthly payments.

Now, Armenuhi has been approved for a loan, within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for forage for feeding the livestock and cover the transportation costs .

loans.name: Saret

texts.en:
Saret, a 50 years old widow, who runs a grocery shop. Her 4 children are adults. Sret has no burden anymore; however, she still is keeping her business. Saret's grocery shop has many products; therefore, she needs to get up early to prepare her shop before the sun rises.

She does not have electricity. Currently, she uses a car battery to substance her business energy; however, a car battery is not reliable. It has a short life span and is easily damaged. Sometime it runs out during night time.

After getting good recommendation from neighbor that uses solar home systems, Saret decided to apply for Kiva loan to buy solar home systems. She believes this decision will improve her energy to run business and also save utility fee.

loans.use: to pay for solar home system

location.town: Yeav Village, Kampong Cham Commune, Sambo District

loans.name: Irshad

texts.en:
Irshad manages a low cost private school that was founded 14 years ago but now some classes need to be revamped. This has lead to a need for more furniture in classrooms and computers in the lab as well as repair and maintenance in the school.

To fulfill this purpose she has requested for a loan worth 110,000 PKR. Currently there are 107 students in the school 47% out of which are females. She plans to scale up the school to class 9th and 10th in the near future and is adamant on developing it further. She is shown in the photo with her husband.

loans.use: to buy more furniture in classrooms and computers in the lab, as well as for repair and maintenance in the school, which has a 47% female attendance..

loans.name: Hera Devi

texts.en:
Hera Devi, 50 years old, is married and has 2 children. Many years ago, She established her grocery shop business. Working 7 days a week and 12 hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid 4 loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy grocery goods. In the future, Gyanu plans to uplift her family's economic condition. She thanks you for your support.

In the Kathmandu Valley, the small grocery store, called a pasal, is an important part of the local economy. Fresh produce, milk, and staples such as rice, lentils, and flour are purchased daily for cooking in the home. Owners of small grocery stores use Kiva loans to increase their purchasing power and profit margins. By keeping inventory strong and purchasing in larger amounts, owners of these small stores are able to increase profitability. While a typical pasal might be no more than 100 sq. feet, they are always full of bargaining customers, incoming produce, and shrewd businesswomen.

loans.use: to buy grocery goods

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a married woman with six children. She describes herself as focused. She operates a retail business where she sells vegetables.

She has been involved in this business for three years. Her primary customers are locals. She says that her biggest business challenge is inadequate working capital.

This is Jane's second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She successfully repaid her previous loan. She will use this KES 15,000 loan to buy more vegetables to sell.

Jane hopes that in the future she will have a stable business.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell

loans.name: Peter

texts.en: Peter is a married man. He has 2 children. He describes himself to be reliable. He operates a retail business where he sells sugar,flour,soda, bread, milk and other items. He has been involved in this business for 6 years. His primary customers are regular. He describes his biggest business challenge to be low capital. He will use the Kes 90,000 loan to buy more stock of flour, sugar,bread, soda,soap and other items. His business goal is to have a wholesale business  within 5 years. This is his  third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of flour, sugar, bread, soda, soap and other items.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more clothing to sell

loans.name: Jona Fe

texts.en:
Jona Fe is 32 years old, married and has three children, two of whom are in school.

She is in the agricultural business raising pigs in the Philippines. Jona Fe requested a PHP 10,400 loan through NWTF to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

Jona Fe has been raising pigs for five years now and has borrowed ten times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Jona Fe would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pig.

loans.name: Gregorio

texts.es:
Gregorio, de 71 años de edad, está acompañado y vive con su pareja, juntos tuvieron 5 hijos, pero todos emigraron para Estados Unidos en busca de su superación. 

Gregorio, se dedica a la crianza de cerdos, gallinas y cabras, él criá estos animalitos para poder venderlos y también para consumo; pero aparte de eso también se dedica al cultivo de maíz y frijol para su sustento.- Toda la vida se dedicó a eso y fue gracias a ello que ha podido siempre salir adelante. 

Gregorio, necesita el préstamo para comprar insumos agrícolas y pagar mano de obra para trabajar en lo que resta de las tareas de la milpa. 

Sus deseos son, poder seguir trabajando hasta donde Dios se lo permita.
texts.en: Gregorio is 71 years old. He lives with his common law wife, they had 5 children but all of them emigrated to the US in search of a better life. Gregorio works raising pigs, chickens, and goats. He raises them to sell them and also for his own consumption. In addition, he works growing corn and beans for consumption. He worked in this area all of his life and thanks to this he has been able to get ahead.  Gregorio needs a loan to buy agricultural products and to pay for labor to work on the remaining field tasks, His wish is to continue working, God willing.

loans.use: To buy agricultural products and to pay for labor to work on remaining field tasks.

loans.name: Blasio

texts.en:
Blasio is a married man, and he has one child. He describes himself to be committed.

He operates a garage where he repairs motor vehicles. Blasio has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a good area. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

Blasio will use the KES 60,000 loan to buy motor vehicle repair tools and other equipment.

This is Blasio's third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy motor vehicle repair tools and other equipment.

loans.name: Rosenia

texts.en:
Rosenia is 40 years old and married with two children who are both in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Rosenia has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. Rosenia requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more stock of rice to sell.

Rosenia has been in this business for four years. In the future, Rosenia would like to save enough money to expand her business and support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of rice to sell.

loans.name: Anush

texts.en:
Anush lives with her husband in Koghb village of Tavush region. Their son and daughter live and work in a neighbouring town. Anush herself is a teacher working in the local village school. After her work at school, her time is devoted to their family farm. She cultivates wheat, potato and tomato, as well as grows large variety of fruit trees (cherry, plum, apple, walnut, pear). Anush husband help her to sell the gathered harvest and also keep livestock of two cows and calves.

Anush asks this loan to invest on her farm. She plans to purchase a cow, calf and ox, as well as some forage for feeding the livestock.

She took a loan from a local financial institution before and was unable to repay it, due to her family's weak financial situation and her unemployment. But after years of tireless work, she has been able to find a good job and owns a farm, which is profitable enough to cover monthly payments. Now, Anush has been approved for a loan, within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products. This loan is very important, for Anush to invest in her farm and develop it.

loans.use: to pay for a cow, calf and ox, as well as some forage for feeding the livestock

loans.name: Raheela
