texts.en: Two years ago Raheela started a small school with a handful of students. Today her school has 75 students 53% of which are females. Raheela believes in equality for both male and female and is eager to take her school forward to bridge these gaps in the community. She has requested for a loan worth Rs 60,000 so that she can purchase books and stationary for students. These items are difficult to purchase in the community where we live, says Raheela. Her aim is to put parents at ease as they have to travel long distances to the main city area to make these purchases.

loans.use: to purchase books and stationary for students at her school, which is 53% female

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Mary Ann works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from farming rice. Mary Ann is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to purchase an additional bundle of fishing net for her fishing business.

Mary Ann has been sustaining her business activities through her past nine loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase an additional bundle of fishing net.

loans.name: Sakeena

texts.en:
Sakeena is 50 years old lady and a responsible mother of 3 children. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan. Her son has been running his own auto repair business for past 1 years. Sakeena's son needs to purchase different types of merchandises e.g tools, machinery and auto spare parts etc for his business purpose. But due to insufficient financial means her son is unable to purchase these merchandises.

To fulfill the need of her son Sakeena has applied for Kiva loan from BRAC Pakistan. With the help of this loan she will help her son to buy this merchandise. That will be good for him to earn more income and this income will support him to fulfill his family's needs.
Sakeena is very Thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to increase her husband's auto repair business.

loans.name: Jadiel

texts.en:
Jadiel is a married man with 3 children. He describes himself to be industrious. He operates a retail business where he sells sugar,flour, bread, milk and other items. He has been involved in this business for 2 years. His primary customers are regular.

He will use the Kes 30,000 loan to buy more stock of flour, sugar,bread, soap and other items. His business goal is to have a supermarket within 5 years. He hopes that in the future, he will sustain his family with proceeds from the business. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of flour, sugar,bread, soap and other items

loans.name: Maribeth

texts.en:
Maribeth is a hardworking woman entrepreneur.

She has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 20,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Maribeth successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Maribeth dreams that one day she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: María Auxiliadora

texts.es: María es una microempresaria de 31 años de edad que emprendió  en compañía de su cónyuge su propio negocio en el sector de los alimentos; gracias al know-how de su esposo un panadero con amplia experiencia, la cual logró adquirir en sus anteriores empleos, pudieron hacer realidad su proyecto de negocio en el año 2010, una panadería y repostería que diariamente recibe a los habitantes del sector donde residen en Baranoa un municipio del Atlántico, para degustar de pastelillos y deditos de hojaldre, panes, tortas, fritos y jugos de frutas, todos los días a partir de las 8 a.m. hasta las 8 p.m.  Con esta actividad ellos han aportado a sus tres hijos menores de edad, bienestar y una mejor calidad de vida, por eso es tan importante para ellos continuar en el negocio más consolidado y visionándose como un negocio mucho más competitivo.   En la actualidad María está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que invertirá en materias primas y surtido de bebidas y mecatos.  Con esta inversión pretenden mejorar el surtido de sus productos y generar más ventas.  Su meta familiar es comprar una casa.
texts.en: María is a 31 year old micro-business woman. She and her spouse started a food business together. Thanks to her husband's know-how, as he is a very experienced baker, and his previous employees he was able to acquire, they were able to make their business project a reality in 2010. It is a bread and pastry bakery that serves the residents of the area where they live every day. They live in Baranoa, a town in Atlántico. The customers come to enjoy their cakes and puff pastries, breads, tortes, fried foods and fruit juices every day from 8 a.m. until 8 p.m. With this activity, they have contributed to the well being and quality of life of their three minor children. That is why it is important for them to continue with the business, making it more consolidated and envisioning it as more competitive. Right now, María is applying for her first Kiva loan through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will invest it in raw materials and a variety of beverages and snacks. With this investment, the intend to improve the selection of their products and generate more sales. The family goal is to buy a house.

loans.use: to invest in raw materials and a variety of beverages and snacks.

loans.name: Rosa Evangelina

texts.es: Rosa de 31 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus cinco hijos, ella se dedica a la crianza de cerdos desde hace 3 años inicio con capital propio, comercialioza sus prodcutos en los pueblos aledaños y con lo que obtiee de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas cerdos para por mayor para continuar con su trabajo y asi tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en: Rosa is 31 years old and lives in her own home with her five children. She has been raising pigs for 3 years, a business she began with her own capital. She sells her products in the neighboring towns and with the income she is able to pay her some of her household expenses. She is seeking a loan to buy more pigs at wholesale in order to continue her work and in this way have greater economic resources.

loans.use: to buy more pigs at wholesale.

loans.name: Reina Margarita

texts.es: Con 39 años de edad, Reina vive al lado de su esposo y sus tres hijos de 9, 16 y 19 años de edad. Reina es una mujer muy trabajadora y emprendedora que, en busca de sostener la economía del hogar hornea una gran variedad de pan dulce y lo distribuye en su comunidad y en las comunidades aledañas. Así también se dedica a la elaboración de prendas de vestir, actividad que realiza desde hace varios años. Reina en busca de mejorar su calidad de vida solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina, madera, clavos y gastos de mano de obra para terminar de reparar el techo de su vivienda. Reina muy agradecida con el crédito anterior, ya que con ello pudo mejorar buena parte del techo de su casa.
texts.en: At 39 years old, Reina lives with her husband and their three children, aged 9, 16 and 19. Reina is a very hardworking and enterprising woman. Seeking to support her home, she bakes a wide variety of sweet breads and distributes it in her and in nearby communities. She also makes clothing to sell, which she has done for several years. Seeking to improve her quality of life, Reina is asking for a loan from FUSAI to invest in sheeting, wood, nails and labor to finish repairing the roof on her home. Reina is very grateful for the previous loan, since with it she was able to improve a large portion of the roof on her home.

loans.use: to invest in sheeting, wood, nails and labor to finish repairing the roof on her home.

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is a Kiva borrower. He has 1 child. He describes himself to be ambitious.

He operates a garage where he repairs motor vehicles. He has been involved in this business for 3 years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. He will use the 30,000 KES loan to buy motor vehicle repair tools and other equipment.

In the future, he hopes to open an engineering firm.

This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was successfully repaid.

loans.use: to buy motor vehicle repair tools and other equipment.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther is a Kiva borrower. She has 3 children. She describes herself to be focused. She operates a farm where she grows vegetables. She has been involved in this business for 6 years. Her business is located in a fertile area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low capital. She will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy farm inputs. Her business goal is to have a large scale business within 5 years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank. Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs.

loans.name: Shindess

texts.en:
Shindess is a married woman with 5 children. She describes herself to be determined. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 7 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are ladies.

She describes her biggest business challenge to be high cost of transport. She will use the Kes 95,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. She hopes that in the future, she will be rich. This is her fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to educate her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes.

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie works hard to support her family. She is married and has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She requested a 20,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy materials like fishing net, gasoline, etc.

Julie has been in this business for 11 years now.

She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy materials like fishing net, gasoline, etc.

loans.name: María Pedrina

texts.es:
Pedrina, de 64 años de edad, es una mujer que desarrolla muchas ocupaciones a pesar de su avanzada edad, está casada y vive con su esposo, sus hijos viven en sus propias casas porque todos son adultos. 

Pedrina, tiene una tienda en su casa y ella es la encargada de atenderla, pero además de eso también tiene un pequeño comedor, en el cual vende desayunos y almuerzos, para los trabajadores del taller que está cerca de su casa. 

Pedrina, necesita el préstamo para comprar más productos para la tienda como detergentes, pan, arroz, papel higiénico, entre otros productos.- De esa manera espera sutir más su tienda y ofrecer otro tipo de productos a sus clientes.  

Sus sueños son, seguir trabajando en sus negocios y mantener su tiendita, para dejarsela como herencia a sus hijos y a sus nietos.
texts.en:
Pedrina is 64 years old. She is a woman who grows in many jobs in spite of her advanced age. She is married and lives with her husband. Her children live in their own homes as they are all adults.

Pedrina has a store in her home. There she sells breakfasts and lunches to the workers whose factory is near her home. Pedrina needs a loan to buy more products for the store such as detergents, bread, rice, toilet paper, and other products. In this way she hopes to better stock her store and offer other kinds of products to her customers.

Her dreams are to continue working her businesses and and maintain her little store in order to leave an inheritance to her children and grandchildren.

loans.use: to buy more products for the store such as detergents, bread, rice, toilet paper, and other products.

loans.name: Delmy Cecilia

texts.es:
Delmy, de 24 años de edad, es una mujer muy trabajadora, estudio hasta noveno grado, pero eso no le ha impedido salir adelante, ella no tiene hijos, aún está en la espera de su primer bebe que muy pronto nacerá y ella vive junto a su esposo. 

Delmy, ella trabaja con un salón de belleza, ella lo administra desde hace varios años, gracias a su negocio ha podido salir adelante y la llegada de su hijo los motiva a trabajar con más animo. 

Delmy, necesita el préstamo para cambiarse de local y pagar el nuevo local, ella necesita un lugar más amplio, porque su clientela va en aumento y necesita más espacio para poder atender mejor.

Los planes de Delmy, son poder ubicarse en un mejor lugar para atender a sus clientes y también que su vida mejore para darle todo lo mejor a su bebe.
texts.en:
Delmy is 24 years old and is a hard-working woman. She completed only through 9th grade, but this hasn't hindered her success. She doesn't have any children, though she is expecting her first child who will be born soon. She lives with her husband.

Delmy has a beauty salon which she has run for several years. Thanks to her business she has been able to get ahead, and the arrival of her child motivates them to work even harder. Delmy needs a loan to change her business locale and pay for the new locale. She needs a bigger space because her clientele is increasing and she needs more space in order to serve them better.

Delmy's plans are to be able to locate her self in a better place to serve her clients and also that her life improve in order to give the best to her baby.

loans.use: to change her business locale and pay for the new locale.

loans.name: Naila

texts.en:
Naila is 38 years old woman. She lives in Rawalpindi, Pakistan, with her one son and one daughter, who are in school. Her husband has been running her own business of clothes selling for 2 years and needs to purchase different types of clothes in bulk for reselling purposes. Due to insufficient financial means her husband is unable to purchase these clothes.

Therefore Naila is applying for Kiva loan from its field partner BRAC Pakistan, so that she can assist her husband to purchase these clothes in bulk. Her husband can also increase the size of his business and earn maximum profit with the help of this loan amount.
Naila is very thankful to Kiva and BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to buy more clothing for sale to increase her husband's business.

loans.name: Dinora Emelina

texts.es: Con 31 años de edad, Dinora vive al lado de su esposo y sus tres hijos de 8 años, 12 años y 15 años de edad. Dinora es una persona muy trabajadora, ella se gana la vida prestando sus servicios como jornalera en una finca, actividad que le permite tener un ingreso económico para las necesidades básicas del hogar, así también los fines de semana vende tamales de gallina, los cuales los distribuye de forma ambulante en su vivienda y en las viviendas cercanas, lo que le permite tener un ingreso extra además de su labor en la finca. Dinora desea reparar el techo de la cocina de su vivienda para lo cual solicita a FUSAI un crédito para invertir en: lámina, clavos, madera y gastos de la mano de obra. Dinora muy agradecida por el crédito anterior, ya que con ello pudo cambiar el techo de su vivienda y de esta manera estar más tranquila y segura por la época de lluvias.
texts.en:
Dinora, 31, lives with her husband and their 3 children aged 8, 12, and 15.  She is a very hardworking person who earns a living by working as a farmhand.  This activity enables her to generate income for the basic needs of the household.  In addition to this, she also works on the weekends selling chicken tamales, which she sells from her house and to nearby homes.  This gives her some income in addition to her earnings working on the farm. 

Dinora wants to repair the roof of her kitchen.  To do this, she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in sheets of corrugated roofing material, nails, and wood, and to pay for labor.  Dinora is very grateful for her previous loan, as she was able to put a new roof on her home, making it a more tranquil and secure place during the rainy season.

loans.use: to put a new roof on her kitchen

loans.name: Hassan

texts.en:
Hassan is a 45-year-old married father of three children, who has been employed in a bakery since 1994, and he works double shifts to make sure he can cover his family's living needs. He is his family's sole earner and works hard to make sure they are having what they need.
Today, and since he has a limited monthly salary, Hassan is acquiring a loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to pay for his children school tuition fees.
He is working hard that one day he can make his dream of opening his own bakery come true and develop his family's living.

loans.use: to pay for his children's school tuition fees.

loans.name: Juan Alberto

texts.es: Con 41 años de edad, Juan habita al lado de su compañera de  vida y al lado de sus hijos de 12 años, 13 años y 14 años. Juan labora en una comercial de venta de electrodomésticos, empleo con el cual mantiene la economía del hogar. Además Juan desempeña la labor de albañil independiente y de esta forma maximizar los ingresos económicos. Juan desea cambiar el techo de su vivienda debido a que se encuentra muy deteriorado y no cuenta con los fondos necesarios para realizar esta reparación, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina, madera y clavos para cambiar el techo de su vivienda. Juan se siente muy agradecida con el crédito anterior ya que con ello logro instalar el agua potable en su vivienda.
texts.en: At 41 years old, Juan lives with his life's companion and their children, aged 12, 13 and 14. Juan works at a store, selling appliances, a job with which he supports the home. In addition, Juan works as an independent bricklayer in order to maximize his income. Juan wants to change the roof on his home because it is in very poor condition and he doesn't have the necessary funds to make the repairs. That is why he is asking for a loan from FUSAI to invest in sheeting, wood and nails to change the roof on his home. Juan feels very grateful for the previous loan because with it he was able to get potable water in his home.

loans.use: to invest in sheeting, wood and nails to change the roof on his house.

loans.name: Wilson

texts.en:
Wilson is an owner of a Machine Shop in San Miguel, Bohol. He is 51 years old, a married man with two dependents ages nine and eighteen. Aside from his machine shop business, he also invest in rice farming business. He is asking for a loan of PHP10000 to buy fertilizer, rice seedlings, and pay for labor and tractor for his farm. 

Wilson is optimistic on the result of all his hard work. His income will be for the education of his children, family daily consumption and reinvestment in the same business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, rice seedlings, and pay for labor and tractor

loans.name: Juan Carlos

texts.es: Juan de 39 años de edad vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el se dedica a la venta de golosinas y tambien a la venta de jugos, aguas, gaseosas, etc. vende de manera ambulante por las diferentes colonias que se encuentran cerca de su casa, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el está solicitando nuevamente un crédito para la compra de mas mercadería por mayor para poder seguir con su negocio y asi tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en:
Juan is 39 and lives in his own house with his family.  He has a business selling snacks and beverages, including juices, water, soft drinks, etc.  He sells on the street in the various neighborhoods near his home.  With the earnings he obtains, he manages to cover some of the household expenses.  

Juan is requesting a new loan to buy more merchandise at wholesale so that he can continue with his business and increase his income.

loans.use: to buy beverages at wholesale

loans.name: Rose

texts.en:
Rose is a married woman. She has 3 children. She describes herself to be polite.

She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, salt, cooking fat, flour and other items. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the 70,000 KES loan to buy more stock of sugar, salt, cooking fat, flour, soap and other items.

This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loans were successfully repaid.

She will use the anticipated profits to purchase additional stock.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, salt, cooking fat, flour, soap and other items.

loans.name: Mercedita

texts.en:
Mercedita is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with eight children. She has a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 16,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like fattening pigs and rice retailing businesses. Mercedita's dream is to one daybe able to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Saleema

texts.en: Day by day increasing expenditures but not having ability to meet them compelled Saleema to initiate her own business selling animals. She is 50 years old, married woman doing a business of animals’ purchase and sale with the help of her husband for many years. Her business has provided her family with a decent life. She is a mother of 6 children. She is working very hard for providing her family with the basic necessities of life. She has requested a loan of 40000 PKR. She intends to utilize this loan amount  to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater more customers. She is confident that she can further expand her business with the help of future loans

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater more customers

loans.name: Rizwana

texts.en:
Rizwana is 38 years old vigorous, married woman and mother of 4 children. She has had a business of hand-embroidery for many years. She knows the art of making beautiful embroidery patterns with beads and pearls. She is zealous about her work, and client demand is strong. But business challenges, combined with family expenditures, frustrate her nearly every day. Her husband does not earn enough to support his family well alone. Rizwana ’s embroidery patterns are very popular on her street and she is the best earning resource in her household.

She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of 60000 PKR, to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities to meet the increasing demand time after time. She hopes to gain more profits for fulfilling her dream of opening her own shop in the market to display her work.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities to meet the increasing demand time after time

loans.name: Zarina

texts.en:
Like many women it was financial constraints that played a potent factor in encouraging our client Zarina to approach Kashf Foundation in search for a loan.

Zarina is a 27 years old married woman and a mother of 2 children. In order to support her husband in taking care of the family she began the business of milk selling. She is known in her town for providing good quality milk. She owns buffaloes for milking. She is happily supporting her family with the income generated. She has requested for a loan of 50000 PKR to purchase another buffalo to inflate her sales for generating more income to cover her daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales for generating more income to cover her daily expenses.

loans.name: Rabia

texts.en: Rabia  is 31 years old, married woman and a mother of 5 children. She is doing business of tailoring for many years to support her husband. She accepted the fact that if her husband works alone for their family, they will not be able to meet the expenses of household with the educational needs of children. That is why she started tailoring at home to support her family well. She, together with her husband, manages their household while operating a business. At this time, she is working hard to continually provide income for their everyday expenses. Now she has requested for a loan of 45000 PKR  to purchase more reels of threads, packs of buttons, ribbons and laces for meeting the orders on time. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. Rabia  hopes to grow her business and dreams of providing better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to purchase more reels of threads, packs of buttons, ribbons and laces for meeting the orders on time

loans.name: Vania Maritza

texts.es: Vania de 30 años de edad, vive al lado de su compañero de vida y de sus hijos de 8 y 5 años de edad. Vania con mucho esfuerzo lucha por que a sus hijos no les falte nada y puedan crecer con todo lo necesario en su vida. Vania se dedica a vender productos de belleza por catálogo y así también posee una tienda en la que vende productos básicos del hogar y de esta manera obtiene los ingresos necesarios para cubrir sus necesidades básicas y las de sus hijos. Así también el compañero de vida de Vania ayuda con los gastos del hogar gracias a que presta sus servicios en una empresa cercana. En busca de mejorar su calidad de vida, Vania decide solicitar un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina, clavos y pago de mano de obra, ya que desea mejorar el techo de su vivienda pues debido al pasar del tiempo se ha deteriorado y necesita mantenimiento. Especialmente el área en donde tiene instalada la tienda.
texts.en: Vania is 30 years old. She lives with her life's companion and their children, aged 8 and 5. With a lot of hard work, Vania has fought for her children to lack for nothing and grow up with everything they need in life. Vania sells beauty products by catalog and she also has a store where she sells staple household products. This is how she obtains the income she needs to cover her and her children's basic needs. Vania's life's companion also helps with the household expenses, thanks to the services he offers to a nearby business. Seeking to improve her quality of life, Vania has decided to ask for a loan from FUSAI to invest in sheeting, nails, and labor. She wants to improve the roof on her home, because over time it has deteriorated and it needs maintenance, especially the area where she has the store.

loans.use: to invest in sheeting, nails and labor to improve the roof on her home.

loans.name: Rosemary

texts.en: Rosemary is a married woman. She describes herself to be loving. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient funds. She will use the Kes 50,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Ruth

texts.en: Ruth and her family lives in the town of Ajuy in Iloilo, Philippines. She is married and has five adult children. Her husband works hard as a fisherman while Ruth sells the fish caught by her husband. She also sells dried fish aside from selling fresh fish. Ruth and her husband work together to provide their daily expenses. They also wish to save money for the future. Ruth is a 51-year-old woman who dreams to improve their means of living. She wants to enhance their livelihood. As for now, she is asking a loan to buy additional fresh fish and dried fish to sell.

loans.use: to buy fresh fish and dried fish to sell

loans.name: Emily

texts.en: Emily is a married woman. She has 3 children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a carpentry business where she sells furniture. She has been involved in this business for 4 years. Her primary customers are regular. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy carpentry materials. She hopes that in the future, he will improve heis living standards. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy carpentry materials

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a married woman, and she has one child. She describes herself to be committed.

Esther operates a beauty salon where she offers beauty services. She has been involved in this business for four years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are ladies. She describes her biggest business challenge to be the high cost of materials.

Esther will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stock of beauty products for salon use. She hopes that in the future she will be financially stable. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of beauty products.

loans.name: Susan

texts.en: Susan is a married woman. She has 4 children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sells charcoal. She has been involved in this business for 8 years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be insufficient working capital. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of charcoal. Her business goal is to she will have a wholesale business within 5 years. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.Previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of charcoal.

loans.name: Vilma

texts.en:
Vilma is married and works hard to support her family. She has a general store business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 25,000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional products like rice, sugar, soap, etc. to sell.

Vilma has been in this business for 31 years now. She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested this additional loan to further build her business.

In the future, Vilma would like to save enough to provide financial security for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like rice, sugar, soap, etc. to sell

loans.name: Matilde

texts.en:
Matilde is 61 years old and married with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur who has a rice retailing business in the Philippines. 

She has requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to buy additional rice to sell.

Matilde has been in this business for 13 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy additional rice to sell

loans.name: Delia

texts.en:
Delia is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with five children.

She earns a living by farming rice in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 12,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Delia supplements this income with earnings from her food vending and buy-and-sell charcoal businesses.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now Delia has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Delia dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilzers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Jocelyn

texts.en:
Jocelyn is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with six children.

She has a clothing retail business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 27,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy more clothing to sell.

Jocelyn industriously earns additional income through other business ventures such as a general store.

Jocelyn dreams that one day she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more clothing to sell.

loans.name: Evelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Evelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs and buy and sell dried fish. Evelyn is borrowing PHP 28000 through NWTF to purchase additional fishing nets for her fishing business.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Evelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past 21 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional fishing nets.

loans.name: Tujenge Group

texts.fr: Pacifique est commerçante, membre de la banque villageoise «Tujenge», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, âgée de 26 ans,  femme célibataire, mère d’un enfant qui étudie. Elle est vendeuse des souliers usagés dans un marché de la ville depuis 3 ans. Elle va s’approvisionner en 15 paires de souliers. Elle commença son business avec le capital reçu d’un crédit. Elle souhaite , scolariser et nourrir son enfant. Au final, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables. Nous tenons à signaler que certaines clientes portent leurs bébés.
texts.en:
Pacifique is a small-scale retailer and member of the Banc Villageois called «Tujenge». She is a client of MFI Hekima, aged 26, a single woman and mother of one child who is enrolled in school.

Pacifique has been selling used shoes in a town market for three years. She is going to stock up by buying 15 pairs of shoes. She began her business with the working capital received from a loan.

Pacifique wishes to pay school fees and feed her child. In closing, she thanks Hekima for the support it gives to entrepreneurs who are not served by the traditional banking system.

It is worth noting that some Hekima clients are carrying their babies.

loans.use: to buy 15 pairs of used shoes to stock for resale.

loans.name: Sheeman

texts.en:
Sheeman was living a tough life some years ago; it was very difficult to bear her household expenditures so now she is running a milk selling business. She is 53 years old, married woman. She has buffaloes for milking purposes. She sells the milk in her area. Her business is doing well enough to pay for her family’s expenses. She is a dedicated mother and wants the best for her children.

She has taken many loans from Kashf Foundation. Now, she has requested for a loan of 60000 PKR to purchase one more buffalo for increasing milk sales to earn a good amount of income to fulfill her dream of providing better living conditions to her children.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo for increasing milk sales to earn good amount of income to fulfill her dream of providing better living conditions to her children

loans.name: Juan Antonio

texts.es:
Hace 24 años atrás, Juan miró el negocio de la venta de piedras canteras como una excelente forma de generar ingresos para él y para su familia, que se conforma de cuatro personas a cargo, su pareja y sus tres hijos, de manera que decidió hacer un préstamo e iniciar como comerciante de este material de construcción. Ahora a sus 49 años de edad, ya posee su propia casa, un carro y ha podido sacar adelante a su familia con estos ingresos. Además genera empleo a otras dos personas que le ayudan en la venta.
Lo que comenzó con unas cuantas piedras, ahora son grandes filas las que decoran el frente de su hogar. Razón por la cual Juan decidió solicitar un préstamo para seguir invirtiendo en su negocio y así comprar mayor cantidad de piedra cantera y así poder tener suficientes para vender y obtener más ingresos. En un futuro sueña con comprar un camión pequeño, con los ahorros obtenidos gracias a su negocio.
texts.en:
Twenty-four years ago, Juan saw his business selling quarry stone as an excellent way to earn income for himself and his family. He's responsible for four people: his wife and three children. He decided to ask for a loan and start selling this construction material. Now he's 49 years old and he has his own house and car, and he has managed to get his family ahead with this income. He also employs two other people who help him make sales.

He started with a few stones and now has big rows that decorate the front of his home. For that reason Juan decided to ask for a loan to keep investing in his business and buy a large quantity of quarry stone to have enough to sell and earn more income.

He dreams of buying a small truck in the future with the savings he earns from his business.

loans.use: to buy a large quantity of quarry stone

loans.name: Ana Alejandra

texts.es: Ana de estado civil  casada,  tiene  26 años de edad, con dos hijos, Melany de seis años que va a la escuela en su localidad y Jordán de dos años de edad que todavía está en su casa, desde hace siete  años todos los días a partir de las cinco de la mañana se levanta a ordeñar a sus dos  vacas para luego esperar al comprador de la leche que le paga quincenalmente,  y así aporta al  hogar,  ya que no les alcanza  con los ingresos de su esposo que trabaja como jornalero por  temporadas.Ana necesita el dinero para comprar otra vaca lechera, ya que con el incremento de la producción de leche  le ayudaría a su esposo a cubrir los gastos de alimentación y  educación de sus hijos.
texts.en: Ana is married and 26 years old. She has two children: Melany, age 6, who attends the local school and Jordan, age 2, who stays at home. For seven years every day at 5 AM she gets up to milk her two cows and then wait for the milk buyer, to whom she gives the milk. The buyer pays her every 15 days. In this way she supports her home, as her husband's income as a seasonal laborer doesn't meet all the household expenses. Ana needs the loan money in order to buy another milk cow, because with the increased milk production it will help her husband cover the expenses to feed and educate their children.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Sandra Esmeralda

texts.es: Sandra de 23 años de edad es una persona muy trabajadora quien se dedica a la compra y venta de frutas y verduras. Trabajo que realiza ayudar con la economía del hogar y así también para mejorar su calidad de vida. Sandra vive al lado de su compañero de vida quien se gana la vida de la agricultura, y de esta manera ayuda económicamente en su hogar. En vista de las necesidades que existen en su vivienda, Sandra solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: láminas, madera, clavos y pago de mano de obra para el cambio del techo de su vivienda, ya que se encuentra deteriorado y es una gran necesidad debido a la época de lluvia.
texts.en: Sandra is 23 years old, hard-working, and has a business buying and selling fruits and vegetables. She works to help with her household's income and also to improve her quality of life. She lives with her husband who works as a farmer, and in this way helps support their home. In light of their home's needs, Sandra seeks a loan from FUSAI to invest in: steel laminate, wood, nails, and pay for labor to change the roof of her home, as it is deteriorating and it is a great need due to the rainy season.

loans.use: to invest in: steel laminate, wood, nails, and pay for labor to change the roof of her home.

loans.name: Karla Josefina

texts.es: Karla de 21 años de edad, ha vivido toda su vida en vivienda propia, ella vive con su hija y su compañero de vida. Karla tiene un pequeño negocio de compra y venta de ropa nueva, negocio que mantiene con mucho esfuerzo para satisfacer las necesidades básicas de su familia, también su compañero de vida presta sus servicios de mecánico para así poder aportar una ayuda económica a su hogar. Karla en busca de mejorar su calidad de vida decide solicitar un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: camisas, faldas, blusas, pantalones para su negocio para ofrecer mayor variedad y estilo en sus productos  y así maximizar sus ingresos económicos y de esta forma mejorar la calidad de vida de ella y de su familia.
texts.en: Karla is 21 years old. She has lived her entire live in her own home. She lives with her daughter and husband. Karla has a small business buying and selling new clothing, a business she maintains with great effort in order to support her family's basic needs. Her husband works as a mechanic and in this way helps to support their home. Karla seeks a better quality of life so she decided to seek a loan from FUSAI in order to buy shirts, skirts, blouses, and pants for her business.Thus she will offer a greater variety and style of products resulting in maximizing her income, resulting in a better quality of life for her and her family.

loans.use: to buy shirts, skirts, blouses, and pants for her business.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en: Samuel is a single man. He describes himself to be industrious. He operates a transport business where he transports customers using his motorcycle. He has been involved in this business for 2 years. His primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be poor roads. He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to repair, maintain his motorcycle. He hopes that in the future, he will have a prosperous business. This is his first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to repair, maintain his motorcycle.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a married woman, and she has two children. She describes herself to be risk-taker.

Esther operates a retail business where she sells sugar, flour, bread, soap and other items. She has been involved in this business for eight years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

Esther will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, bread, flour, soap and other items. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, bread, flour, soap and other items.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Mary is a single woman with 2 children. She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for 3 years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be transport.

She will use the Kes 60,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to be an importer of clothes within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will have a stable business. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to purchase additional stock

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Lucy

texts.en: Lucy is a married woman. She has 2 children. She operates a retail business where she offers printing , photocopy photography services and also sells picture frames. She has been involved in this business for 5 years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate capital. She will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy more stock of printing papers and other stationery. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of printing papers and other stationery

loans.name: Doneyeang Group

texts.en: Cheuang’s village sources much of their drinking water from local wells, streams, and collected rainwater.  These sources of water are not safe to drink without treatment by boiling.  Cheuang and his group are excited that the filter was available on a payment plan that made it much more affordable.  Treating drinking water requires cash and time, which now he can shift to other pursuits.  Cheuang and his village also understand the impact unsafe drinking water has on their family’s budgets. The filter is guaranteed for 2 years; within this 2 years filter users, like Cheuang’s family, identify a substantial decrease in illness and associated medical costs.

loans.use: to purchase TerraClear water filters so they can have access to safe drinking water.

loans.name: Samreen

texts.en:
It was hard for Samreen to manage her household expenses with the small income of her husband. Samreen is 38 years old, a married woman. Some years ago she started her business selling animals in her community. Her husband fully supports and assists her with her work.

Now, she has requested for a loan of 45000 PKR. She wants to use this loan amount to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market. She has gained great confidence in the business as she has learned how to deal with other individuals within the business, allowing her to feel empowered.

loans.use: to purchase more cattle for reselling in the market and which gives her empowerment

loans.name: Dora Alicia

texts.es: Dora de 35 años de edad vive al lado de su compañero de vida y de sus dos hijos un hijo de 9 años y una hija de 16 años. Ella se gana la vida con los negocios que maneja en su comunidad, entre estos están la venta de pupusas y tortillas. Gracias a estos negocios Dora puede sacar adelante a su familia y así también con la ayuda de su esposo quien la apoya económicamente para los gastos del hogar. Dora solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: ladrillo, cemento, arena, hierro y pago de mano de obra para la construcción de una pared en su vivienda ya que en una parte de la vivienda con láminas ha hecho una división.
texts.en: Dora is 35 years old and lives with her husband and two children ages 9 and 16. She earns a living with businesses she has in her community, among them is selling pupusas and tortillas. Thanks to these businesses Dora can support her family and with the help of her husband he too supports the family's household expenses. Dora seeks a loan with FUSAI to invest in brick, cement, sand, iron, and pay for labor to build a wall at her home as in one part of her home they have dividing walls of steel laminate.

loans.use: to invest in brick, cement, sand, iron, and pay for labor to build a wall at her home.

loans.name: Josphine

texts.en:
Josphine is a married woman. She has 6 children. She describes herself to be patient. She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, rice, milk, cooking oil and other items. She has been involved in this business for 8 years. Her business is located in a busy area and her primary customers are locals.

She will use the Kes 80,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, bread, flour, cooking oil and other items. Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within 5 years. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children to university level.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, bread, flour, cooking oil and other items.

loans.name: Arlene

texts.en:
Arlene is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with five children.

She has a fruit vending in the Philippines and requested a PHP 29,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fruit to sell in her food stall.

Arlene successfully paid back her previous loan and is now requesting a new loan to further build her business.

Arlene dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fruit to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Jair Ediel

texts.es: Jair de 31 años es residente en Chía un municipio de Cundinamarca y durante años ha estado dedicado a la construcción de viviendas, actividad que aprendió de su hermano mayor un maestro de construcción a quien decidió seguirle los pasos.  En la actualidad Jair ofrece servicios con el respaldo de una constructora y diariamente recibe solicitudes de clientes para cotizar trabajos a los cuales inmediatamente les atiende y en cuanto se fija la fecha y se estipula el contrato inicia la obra.  Como su actividad la desempeña en varios sectores del municipio el transporte juega un papel muy importante para la agilidad del servicio es por ello que está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que invertirán en la compra de una motocicleta con la que podrá realizar trabajos de plomería y acabados sin contratiempos, así como un ahorro significativo en sus desplazamientos.  Jair es padre de un hijo a quien le otorga bienestar y desea comprar una vivienda para mejorar sus condiciones de vida.
texts.en: Jair is 31 years old, lives in Chia in the Cundinamarca municipality. He has worked in home building for some years, work he learned from his older brother who is a master craftsman, and he decided to follow in his brother's footsteps.  Today Jair offers his construction services and daily receives client requests for jobs to which he responds immediately, determining a date, stipulating a contract for beginning the work. His work demands various kinds of transportation, and transportation plays an important role in providing agile service. Therefore he seeks his first Kiva loan through Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo to invest in buying a motorcycle with which he can do plumbing jobs and finish work without delay, thus saving a significant amount of costs. Jair is the father of one son whom he supports and wishes to buy a home in order to improve his living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to use in his construction business.

loans.name: Amina

texts.en:
Amina is a married woman. She has seven children. She operates a retail business where she sells tomatoes, onions, flour and other items. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

Amina will use this 20,000 Kenyan shilling loan to buy more stock of tomatoes, onions and other items. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She will use the anticipated profits to purchase additional stock.

loans.use: to buy more stock of tomatoes, onions and other items

loans.name: Sushila

texts.en:
Sushila is 34 years old. She is married and has one child. Many years ago, she established her produce and vegetable sales business. Working seven days a week and eight hours a day, she supports her family. She has already received and successfully repaid six loans from Patan BPW and used her most recent to buy pesticides and seeds. In the future, Sushila plans to uplift the economic condition of her family. She thanks you for your support.

Over 70% of Nepal's economy is agricultural. Typically, Nepali households grow crops on small plots of terraced land. Rice (bhat), lentils (daal), and vegetables (thakari) are the staples of the Nepali diet. With a Kiva loan, BPW's borrowers are able to purchase greater amounts of seed and fertilizer. With more seeds and fertilizer, a borrower is able to grow cash crops to be sold in the local market. Such crops allow households to move beyond subsistence and provide much-needed cash income throughout the year.

loans.use: to buy pesticides and seeds

loans.name: Jose Miguel

texts.es:
José es un hombre soltero de 40 años de edad que toda la vida se ha caracterizado por ser agricultor, pero debido a las largas temporadas de sequía dicha profesión se ha venido decayendo por lo tanto busco otras alternativas para generar ingresos y no aguantar hambre, como lo es la cría de cerdos, negocio al que quiere ponerle todo su empeño y hacerlo crecer, esperando que este sea de abastó para cubrir sus necesidades básicas y con la ayuda del cultivo pagar mínimamente la cuota del crédito, mientras regresa la lluvia a Córdoba.
Por ello José necesita una poyo económico para la compra de cerdos y alimento de engorde, espera consolidarse en el mercado, ser una persona competitiva y solo le queda trabajar muy fuerte por mantener sus terrenos que con tanto esfuerzo y años de trabajo construyo.
Anímate! Un préstamo hará la diferencia, un préstamo será suficiente para que este hombre tenga las herramientas para labrar su propio futuro.
texts.en:
José is a single, 40 year old man. All his life he has been known as a farmer, but due to the long seasons of drought, his profession is in decline. For that reason, he sought other alternative ways to generate income and not suffer from hunger, such as raising pigs. He wants to put all his effort into this business and make it grow. He hopes it will suffice to cover his basic needs, and that with help from his farming he will be able to make the loan payments, until the rain returns to Córdoba.

For this reason José needs economic support to buy pigs and nutritional feed. He hopes to get set up in the market and be a competitive person. All that will remain then is for him to work very hard to keep the land he obtained after so much effort and years of work.

"Go for it! A loan will make the difference. A loan will be enough for this man to have the tools to shape his own future."

loans.use: to set up a business raising pigs.  He seeks economic support in the crisis of drought that affects his area.

loans.name: Sakina

texts.en: Day by day increasing expenditures but not having ability to meet them compelled Sakina to initiate her own business selling animals. She is 52 years old, married woman doing a business of animals’ purchase and sale with the help of her husband for many years. Her business has provided her family with a decent life. She is a mother of 2 children. She is working very hard for providing her family with the basic necessities of life. She has requested a loan of 40000 PKR. She intends to utilize this loan amount  to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater more customers. She is confident that she can further expand her business with the help of future loans

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater more customers

loans.name: Pathani

texts.en:
Pathani is 61 years old vigorous, married woman with 4 children. She has had a business of hand-embroidery for many years. She knows the art of making beautiful embroidery patterns with beads and pearls. She is zealous about her work and client demand is strong. But business challenges, combined with family expenditures, frustrate her nearly every day. Her husband does not earn enough to support his family well alone. Pathani’s embroidery patterns are very popular on her street and she is the best earning resource in her household.

She wants to grow her business so she requested a loan of 40000 PKR, to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities to meet the increasing demand time after time. She hopes to gain more profits for fulfilling her dream of opening her own shop in the market to display her work.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as thread, sequins and pearls in large quantities to meet the increasing demand time after time

loans.name: Sandra Liliana

texts.es:
Sandra es una hermosa joven de 30 años de edad que quiere cumplir un sueño, el cual es, montar un consultorio de masajes y limpieza facial, y ahora es el momento de realizarlo pero para ello necesita un apoyo económico que tú puedes brindárselo, el cual usara para la compra del equipo restante y los insumos para realizar los masajes, pues ya tiene parte del local montado.
Ella es madre de 2 hijos menores de edad, su mayor sueño es triunfar en esta profesión y darles a sus hijos todo lo que no pudo tener en un pasado.
texts.en:
Sandra is a beautiful 30-year-old young woman who wants to achieve a dream, which is to set up a massage and facial cleaning parlour. Now is the time to do this, but for this she needs economic help that you can provide. This help will be used to purchase the remaining equipment and the massage supplies, as she already has part of the shop set up.

She is a mother of two underage children. Her biggest dream is to triumph in this profession and to give her children everything that she could not have herself.

loans.use: to complete her funding to set up a massage and body beauty parlour

loans.name: Wilfred

texts.en:
Wilfred is a 52-year-old man, married and blessed with four children. He joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in the year 2014 to benefit from trainings, especially enterprise development and financial management.

He practices vegetable and dairy farming. He also operates an electronic shop to supplement his income. He is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy fertilizers and manure to increase farming production. This will help him to earn more income to meet his family's basic needs, especially food and clothing.

He is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the financial support. He promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and manure to increase farming production

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Jane. She is 54 years old, married, and blessed with three children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2014. She is a mixed farmer who grows maize and potatoes, and rears sheep. Prior to joining Hand in Hand Eastern Africa, she was doing maize and potato farming. However, after undergoing Hand in Hand Eastern Africa’s training on enterprise development and financial management, she has diversified to dairy farming.

She is borrowing from Kiva to buy fertilizer and seeds that will help increase her farm production and earn her more income from the sale of potatoes and maize to her customers. She hopes this extra income will enable her to provide for her family's needs such as food, shelter, and school fees for her children.

She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders and promises to repay her loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seeds that will help increase farm production

loans.name: Miguel Jose

texts.es:
Miguel es un joven de 21 años de edad el cual heredó un negocio de cría de cerdos, fue criado en las zonas rurales de Córdoba. 
Miguel es muy entusiasta, quiere hacer bien las cosas, trabajar para apoyar económicamente a su familia y salir adelante, demostrar que ya es todo un hombre y que puede hacerse cargo del hogar.
Aunque a este joven le sobran las ganas de trabajar, tiene un pequeño inconveniente, le falta de capital, y ya que nunca ha tenido experiencia crediticia, pero la corporación Interactuar está dispuesto a tenderle la mano y confiar en su proyecto y apoyarlo para que salga adelante.
Por ello con mucho entusiasmo y expectativa, miguel quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de cerdos y materiales para reparar las cocheras que se encuentran en muy mal estado.
texts.en:
Miguel is a young man, just 21 years old, who inherited a business raising pigs. He was born in the rural zones of Cordoba.

Miguel is very enthusiastic and wishes to make things better. He works to help his family economically and to get ahead, demonstrating that he is already a man who can take charge of the home.

Although this young man possesses substantial urge to work, there is one small inconvenience, a lack of capital. And although he has no prior experience with loans, the Interactuar corporation has decideded to offer him a hand, demonstrating confidence in his project, and to help him so that he can advance.

To do that with much enthusiasm and expectation, Miguel wishes to request a loan for purchasing pigs and the materials needed to repair his pig pens, which are presently in very poor condition.

loans.use: buy pigs and materials for repairing his pig pens, which are presently in very bad condition.

loans.name: Everline

texts.en:
Everline is a married woman. She has five children with ages ranging from 4 years to 16 years. She describes herself as honest. She operates a chemist. She has been involved in this business for 12 years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

Everline will use this 95,000 Kenyan shilling loan to buy more stock of medicine. She hopes that she will create jobs in the future.

loans.use: to buy more stock of medicine to sell.

loans.name: Jose Gildardo

texts.es:
Gildardo es un joven de 19 años de edad, un joven entusiasta, lleno de energías, una persona que quiere progresar y salir adelante, a pesar de su corta edad ha demostrado tener grandes dotes empresariales.
Gildardo se dedica a la cría de ganado bovino y en el momento debido al bajo precio de venta de leche el negocio ha decaído mucho, pero él no quiere renunciar a esta profesión y busca los medios para sostenerse. 
En conclusión este joven necesita un apoyo económico para la compra de una vaca en periodo de gestación, con la que aumentara su producción considerablemente.
texts.en:
Gildardo, age 19, is an enthusiasastic young man who is full of energy. He is a person who wants to progress and to get ahead. In spite of his young age, he has shown that he has great business talents.

Gildardo raises cows. At the moment, due to the low price of milk, the business has fallen off a lot. However, he does not want to give up this profession and look for other means of support.

In conclusion, this young man needs financial support to buy a pregnant cow to considerably increase his production.

loans.use: to buy a pregnant cow to considerably increase his production.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en: Jackline is a Kiva borrower. She describes herself to be ambitious. She operates a dairy farm. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy a water tank and gutters to enable her to harvest and store rain water for domestic use. She hopes that in the future, she will have a healthy family. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a water tank and gutters to enable her to harvest and store rain water for domestic use.

loans.name: Jeniffer

texts.en:
Jeniffer is a married woman. She has two children. She operates a retail business where she sells cereals. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

Jeniffer will use this 30,000 Kenyan shilling loan to buy more stock of cereals. Her business goal is to have a wholesale business within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cereals.

loans.name: Luz Adriana

texts.es:
Adriana es una mujer del campo, una persona humilde, trabajadora, respetuosa, que valoro mucho a su familia y en especial a sus dos hijos de 16 y 7 años de edad, por los cuales trabaja y deja hasta la última gota de sudor en su negocio de cría de ganado.
Ya que su meta es mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia, asegurar un futuro próspero a sus hijos, una excelente educación, la señora Adriana quiere solicitar un apoyo económico para la compra de 5 terneros, comprar vacunas para los animales y alimento para una sana alimentación (de los animales).
Este apoyo ayudara a mejorar la producción y el volumen de trabajo de Adriana, anímate y apóyala.
texts.en:
Adriana is a woman from the country. She is a humble, hard-working, and respectful person. She values her family a lot, especially her two children, ages 16 and 7. It is for them that she works and puts her very last drop of sweat into her business of raising livestock.

Her goal is to improve her family's quality of life and to assure her children of a prosperous future and an excellent education.

Adriana wants to request financial support to buy five calves and vaccines and food for the animals so that they eat healthfully. This support will help to improve the production of Adrian's work. Go for it; support her.

loans.use: to buy five calves and vaccines and food to feed the animals healthfully.

loans.name: Luz Aida

texts.es:
Luz es una ama de casa de 33 años de edad, una persona humilde que quiere salir adelante y buscar una independencia económica, una persona que no renuncia a sus sueños y solo quiere brindarle el mejor futuro a sus hijos, por ello desde su hogar se dedica a la cría de cerdos y la fabricación de productos lácteos como el queso.
Su profesión nació de la necesidad,  del querer, de la auto-superación, por ello hoy se encuentra solicitando un apoyo financiero para comprar cerdos y alimento de engorde, pues quiere prepararse para la temporada de mayor venta que es en la época navideña, también comprara leche para la elaboración de quesos.
Con tu apoyo esta ama de casa puede convertirse en una empresaria independiente, anímate y apóyala.
texts.en:
Luz is a 33 year old housewife. She is a humble person who wants to get ahead and is looking for an independent economy. She is a person who has not let go of her dreams and only wants to provide a better future for her children. So she decided to raise pigs at her house and make dairy products like cheese.

Her profession was born out of need and the desire for self-improvement. Now she finds herself requesting financial assistance to buy pigs and feed to fatten them as she wants to prepare for the season of highest sales which is the Christmas season. She will also buy milk to make cheese.

With your help this housewife can become an independent businessperson. Go on and support her.

loans.use: to buy pigs and feed to fatten them and also buy milk to make cheese.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en:
Esther is a 57-year-old lady, married and blessed with six children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa so as to benefit from the trainings, especially enterprise development.

She practices mixed farming; dairy and crop farming. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy animal feed. This will enable her to increase milk production, hence earning more income to support family expenses with ease.

She is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the financial support.

loans.use: to buy animal feed to increase milk production, hence earning more income to support family expenses with ease.

loans.name: Jj Jhire Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “JJ JHIRE” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Virginia es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de ropa, venta de cosméticos, venta de abarrotes, tienda de barrio. 

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Virginia es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de ropa; da a conocer que este negocio lo inicio hace varios años, lo aprendió de su tía y con un capital con el que contaba decidió emprender este negocio. 

El crédito que ahora sacará será para el aumento de capital (compra de ropa por mayor) que adquirirá de las vendedoras de la ciudad de El Alto y posteriormente, lo comercializará en su espacio de venta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es soltera y tiene un hijo.

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación y el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal bank "JJ Jhire" will start the first cycle in Pro Mujer, as part of the Centro Focal de Santiago II, which has eight members and is managed by a board which has Virginia as the President. The businesses that the members of the community association run are varied and among them there are: clothing sales, cosmetic sales, groceries and a neighbourhood store.

The loan that they will take out will benefit small micro-business entrepreneurs of which Virginia is one. She says that it is the first time she has participated with Pro Mujer, joining through an invitation from a friend who is a client of the institution. She currently runs a business selling clothes and says that she started this business several years ago. She learned from her aunt and, with some money she had, she decided to start this business.

The loan she will take out now will be to the increase her stock (buying wholesale clothing), that she will acquire from the sellers in the city of El Alto, and then sell it through her sales space. This form of work allows her to generate resources to support her family financially, as she is a single mother with one child.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she says that she likes the training and the health facilities that the group offers.

loans.use: to buy wholesale clothing.

loans.name: Carlos Andres

texts.es:
Carlos es un joven de 19 años de edad, una persona que está iniciando su vida como emprendedor y comerciante, un hombre que tiene un único deseo, superarse y ayudarle mucho a su familia. 
A pesar de su juventud y su falta de experiencia, está dispuesto a dar todo de sí y mucho más para progresar y tener éxito en su trabajo como vendedor de productos de consumo y uso personal.
Pero todo este camino no lo puede recorrer solo y al ser tan joven no cuenta con mucho recursos para invertir en su negocio, por ello necesita un apoyo económico para la compra de surtido de productos de la marca amway, desea cambiar hábitos alimenticios en los hogares.
Este joven necesita tu ayuda, quiere demostrar a su familia que puede aportar dinero y pagar su propia educación.
texts.en:
Carlos, 19, is just starting out as a businessman and entrepreneur. He has one wish: to succeed, and to help out his family as much as he can.

In spite of his youth and lack of experience, he is ready to give it his all and more to get ahead and succeed in his work selling products for personal use.

But he cannot travel this road alone, and since he is so young he does not have much capital to invest in his business. That is why he needs financial support to purchase Amway products, he wants to change people's eating habits at home.

This young man needs your help. He wants to show his family that he can earn money and pay for his own education.

loans.use: to buy products for domestic use to help with household expenses and to pay for his education.

loans.name: Maria Lourdes

texts.es:
María es una persona muy dedicada al hogar y su familia, pero estas responsabilidades no la cohíben de trabajar y generar sus propios ingresos, por ello inicio independientemente con la venta de alimentos los cuales elabora en la cocina de su hogar. Con los ingresos que obtiene complementa la alimentación y los gastos restantes para mantener el hogar.
Ella se siente muy orgullosa de lo que ha logrado, está profesión no solo ayuda a mejorar su calidad de vida, sino que la mantiene activa y con mucha interacción, pero su objetivo es lograr llevar su profesión a un siguiente nivel, es por esto que solicita un apoyo económico para la compra de surtido de granos y alimento de la canasta familiar para la elaboración de alimentos, su intención es aumentar la cantidad y llegar a un mayor número de personas.
texts.en:
María is very devoted to her home and her family. However, these responsibilities do not keep her from working and generating her own income. She started independently selling food that she makes in the kitchen of her home. With the earnings that she gets she supplements the food and the remaining expenses to maintain her household.

She is very proud of what she has achieved. This profession not only helps to improve her quality of life, but it also keeps her active and provides her with a lot of interaction.

Her objective is to manage to take her profession to the next level. That is why she is requesting financial support to buy stock of grains and basic needs food products to make food. Her intention is to increase the quantity and to get to a greater number of people.

loans.use: to buy stock of basic needs products in order to make food.

loans.name: Elizabeth

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Elizabeth, thirty-five years old, with five children. Three of her children are in primary school and the other two are in high school. Elizabeth is married and lives with her five children.

She does crop farming. She is taking a loan to purchase farm inputs such as seeds and fertilizers. She hopes that her business will do well, thus gaining more income. This will enable her to be in a position to provide food and pay school fees for her children.

Elizabeth is grateful to Kiva and its lenders for the financial support and promises to pay promptly.

loans.use: to purchase farming inputs such as seeds and fertilizers. She hopes that her business will do well and thus gain more income.

loans.name: Beatrice

texts.en:
Beatrice is grateful to Kiva for the previous loan that enabled her to add stock to her cosmetic shop. This increased her income levels so that she used it to renovate her family house and provide better food for her family.

She also used the increased profits to start farming activities such as crop and dairy farming and she is now borrowing her second Kiva loan to buy farm inputs. This will enable her to further boost the farming business which will eventually generate income to meet family expenses such as food and clothing.

She is grateful to Kiva for the continued financial support.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs to boost farming activities for increased income to support family expenses such as food and clothing.

loans.name: Liliana

texts.es:
Liliana es una mujer perseverante, una guerrera de la vida, todo un ejemplo de mujer, a sus 41 años de edad es madre cabeza de familia de tres hijos, separada de su esposo, pero nunca le quedó grande el papel de padre y madre y todos los mantiene gracias a su negocio de confección a terceros el cual según ella “con la ayuda de Dios va creciendo”, se siente orgullosa por todo lo que ha logrado y no quiere descansar, por ello quiere solicitar un préstamo el cual invertirá en la compra de una motocicleta para transportar su mercancía, gracias a esta inversión dará un mejor servicio a sus clientes, también generara un empleo.
Su sueño es brindarles una excelente calidad de vida y de educación a sus hijos.
texts.en:
Liliana is a persistent woman, a warrior in life, and an example of a woman. At 41 years old, she is a mother, head of a family of three children. She is separated from her husband, but the role of both father and mother was never too big for her. She supports them all thanks to her dressmaking business, which according to her, "is growing with the help of God." She is proud of everything she has achieved and she does not want to stop. This is why she is asking for a loan which she will invest in the purchase of a motorcycle to transport her merchandise. Thanks to this investment she will give better service to her clients, and she will also create a job.
Her dream is to bring an excellent quality of life and education to her children.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to transport her merchandise.

loans.name: Yamileth

texts.es:
Yamileth es una empresaria de 41 años de edad, que básicamente ha estado dedicado a las labores domésticas, pero ahora solo tiene en mente salir adelante y buscar un mejor futuro para sus hijos, por ello hoy necesita de tu apoyo para iniciar un negocio de cría de aves, actividad que conoce muy bien puesto que desde pequeña estuvo en constante interacción con estos animales.
Ella es madre de dos hijos, tiene un hogar humilde, busca el apoyo porque quiere cambiar su realidad, tener un mejor futuro, no conformarse con lo que tiene, dejar de depender de otra persona y lo más importante tener capital para comprar sus propias cosas.
texts.en: Yamileth is a 41-year-old businesswoman, who has mainly been doing domestic work. Now she has only one thing in mind: to get ahead and provide a better future for her children. That is why she needs your support to start up a business raising poultry, an activity she knows very well because she has always been around animals ever since she was a little girl. She is the mother of two children, and has a humble home. She is seeking help because she wants to change her life, have a better future, not be satisfied with what she has, stop being dependent on another person, and, most importantly, to have enough money to make her own purchases.

loans.use: to start up a business raising poultry.

loans.name: Mujeres De Exito Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “MUJERES DE EXITO” iniciará el primer ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Focal de Santiago II, está compuesta por ocho  integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva donde la señora Carmen es la Presidenta. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos existen: venta de cosméticos, ferretería, venta de pan, venta de masitas, venta de comida, venta de ropa, venta de té y café.

El crédito que sacaran beneficiara a pequeñas microempresarias donde la señora Carmen es integrante, ella indica que es la primera vez que integra Pro Mujer, ingresando por la invitación de una amiga que es cliente de la institución. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de venta de cosméticos; da a conocer que este negocio lo aprendió de su amiga, ya que trabajaba con estos productos, ella le aconsejo en la forma de adquisición y forma de venta de los mismos. 

El crédito que ahora sacará es para el aumento de capital (compra de cosméticos por mayor) que adquirirá de vendedoras mayoristas de la ciudad de La Paz y posteriormente lo comercializará a pedido de la clienta. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar a su familia económicamente, ya que ella es casada y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gustan las capacitaciones y el área de salud que ofrece la institución.
texts.en:
The communal association "Mujeres de Exito" is starting their first cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Santiago II Center. It is comprised of eight members, and is directed by a board presided over by Carmen. The businesses the members of the association run are varied, and include: selling cosmetics, selling hardware, selling bread, selling pastries, selling food, selling clothing, and selling tea and coffee.

The loan they will receive will benefit small micro-entrepreneurs including Carmen; she says she just joined Pro Mujer, at the invitation of a friend who is a client of the institution. She has a business selling cosmetics, she learned this business from her friend who was already selling these products, and she advised her on how to purchase and sell them.

The loan they will take out now is for increasing capital (to buy cosmetics at wholesale) which she will purchase from wholesalers in La Paz, and then she will sell them to customers. This way of working lets her generate income to support her family financially, as she is married and has a child.

When asked what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replies that she likes the training programs and healthcare the institution offers.

loans.use: to purchase cosmetics at wholesale.

loans.name: Michael

texts.en: Michael is a married man. He has three children. He describes himself to be committed. He operates a carpentry shop where he makes furniture. His primary customers are locals. He will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of carpentry materials. He hopes that in the future he will expand his business. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of carpentry materials

loans.name: Vardanush

texts.en:
Vardanush lives in Hermon village of the Vayots Dzor region with her grownup son and daughter.

Like local people living in that rural region, Vardanush also raises livestock. She started in the livestock business after she got married, so that she could help her husband take care of the family. After her husband went for migrant work, Vardanush was left alone with the livestock and household work. Due to her hard work, she perfectly manages to keep livestock of two cows, four calves, 20 hens and 15 colonies of bees.
