Vardanush gets milk, prepares different dairy products and sells them in local markets. The loan will help her greatly to purchase one ox and forage for feeding the livestock to enlarge her livestock and sustain it. As this is Vardanush's first loan, it has been approved within the framework of the new joint initiative of Kiva and SEF. The first-chance-loan program provides loans to people who haven’t had access to credit products before because they have no credit history.

loans.use: to pay for one ox and forage for feeding the livestock

loans.name: Nelson Albeiro

texts.es:
Nelson es un hombre sonriente, alegre, una persona que vive y ama el campo, nació en las zonas rurales de Rionegro donde aprendió gracias a sus padres a cultivar, de allí fue evolucionando su pasión por el campo e hizo de esta pasión su trabajo y la manera de generar recursos para el sustento de su hogar.

Este empresario ha tenido varias dificultades todas en torno a los constantes cambios climáticos y los largos periodos de sequía que se han presentado, pero a pesar de todo sigue en pie con su profesión.

Hoy con mucho respeto y cordialidad, el señor Nelson solicita un apoyo económico para la compra de insumos agrícolas, principalmente riegos y abonos para sus campos, dichos insumos ayudaran al mantenimiento de sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Nelson is a happy, smiling man, a person who lives in and loves the country. He was born in the rural parts of Rionegro where he learned to farm thanks to his parents. It was here that his love for the country evolved and he made his work from this passion and his way to generate income for the sustenance of his household.

This businessman has had a variety of problems because of the constant climatic changes and the long periods of drought that have occured. But in spite of all this he is still practicing his profession.

Today with great respect and warmth, Nelson is requesting economic support to buy
agricultural inputs in particular irrigation and manure for his fields. These supplies will help him maintain his crops.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs in particular irrigation and manure for his fields.

loans.name: Marino De Jesus

texts.es:
Marino es un hombre soltero de 31 años de edad que se dedica a cultivar hortalizas, es un hombre muy responsable que entrega cuerpo y alma al trabajo, pues a pesar de no tener pareja o hijos, tiene que mantener su hogar.
Inicio su trabajo por gusto y vocación al trabajo independiente, los conocimientos los adquirió trabajando como ayudante en diferentes fincas, pero hace algunos años tomó la decisión de convertirse en independiente.
Ya que le negocio de la agricultura ha sido muy afectado por las largas temporadas de sequía, el señor Marino quiere explorar otras alternativas para generar ingresos, es por ello que quiere solicitar el apoyo económico de la maravillosa comunidad de Kiva y el cual invertirá en la compra de terneras.
Este préstamo ayudara a iniciar formalmente con la venta de ganado, como ya se había mencionado antes, es una alternativa para generar mayores ingresos y soportar las pérdidas que ha tenido en sus cultivos a causa del clima.
texts.en:
Marino is a single 31-year-old man that works growing vegetables. He is a very responsible man that puts his body and soul into his work. Despite not having a partner or children, he has to maintain his home.

He started his work because of a liking and calling for independent work. He gained knowledge working as a helper on different farms, but some years ago he made the decision to become independent.

Since the agricultural business has been very affected by long dry seasons, Marino wants to explore other alternatives to generate income. That is why he wants to request economic support from the wonderful Kiva community, which he will invest into buying calves.

This loan will help him to formally begin selling cattle, since as previously mentioned, it is an alternative way to generate better income and to bear the losses that he has had with his crops due to the climate.

loans.use: to buy calves to improve his production.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizer, and hence boost farming production for increased income to provide better food and education to her children.

loans.name: Cathrine

texts.en:
The person in the photo is Cathrine, thirty one years old, married and blessed with three children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa (HiH EA) in 2014.

She does maize, beans, and dairy farming. Having gone through HiH EA enterprise and financial training, she has been able to commercialize her business and earn more profit.
She is taking a Kiva loan to buy fertilizer, seeds, and animal feeds that will increase the quality of her yields and thus earn her more income.

With increased income, Cathrine will be able to meet family basic needs such as education and medical care. She is grateful to Kiva and its lenders and promises to repay promptly

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seeds, and animal feeds that will increase the quality of her yields and  thus earn her more income to cater for family needs.

loans.name: Luis Alberto

texts.es:
Luis es un hombre creativo, soñador, un hombre que con perseverancia y con positivismo ha salido adelante, nació en la pobreza, pero este nunca fue un pretexto para él.
Este gran hombre salió desde muy joven a trabajar con sus parientes en la construcción donde adquirió gran experiencia para convertirse en un oficial de obra.
Luis es padre de 2 hijos uno de 8 y la menor de 5, su propósito es mejorar las condiciones de su vivienda, asegurar un futuro para sus niños y construir una casa con sus propias manos.
En el momento Luis necesita un apoyo económico para la compra de herramienta de trabajo para la construcción y comprar repuesto para una máquina cortadora que le hace falta.
texts.en:
Luis is a creative and visionary man. He is a man who with perseverance and positivity has come out ahead. He was born in poverty, but this was never a pretext for him.

This great man went to work in construction with his parents when he was very young, where he acquired great experience to become a skilled worker.

Luis is the father of 2 children, one who is 8 years old and the younger one who is 5. His goal is to improve the conditions of his home, assure a future for his children, and build a house with his own hands.

At this time, Luis needs economic support to buy work tools for construction and spare parts that he needs for a cutting machine.

loans.use: to buy work tools for construction and replacement parts for a cutting machine.

loans.name: Elijah

texts.en:
Elijah is a married man. He has three children. He describes himself to be ambitious.

He operates a retail business where he sells sugar, soap, flour,milk, soap ,and other items. His primary customers are locals.

He will use the KES 60,000 loan to buy more stock of bread, flour, milk, sugar, and other items. This is his third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of bread, flour, milk, sugar, and other items.

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en:
Pauline is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be prayerful.

She operates a retail business where she sells clothes. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her primary customers are locals.

She will use the KES 10,000 loan to buy more stock of clothes. Her business goal is to own a big boutique within five years.

She hopes that in the future, she will be successful. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy more stock of clothes

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes, the lady appearing in the photograph, is fifty-one years old and married with two children.

Her economic activity is maize and beans farming. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in September 2014 and she has received trainings on enterprise development and financial planning which have equipped her with skills to effectively manage her enterprise.

She is taking a Kiva loan to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizer and pesticide. She hopes the loan will help boost her business and hence increase her income. She will therefore be able to support her family by proving basic needs.

Agnes is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the help and support and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: to purchase farm inputs such as fertilizer and pesticide. She hopes the loan will help boost her business and hence increase her income.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is a married woman. She has two children. She describes herself to be honest.

She operates a dairy farm where she sells milk. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy farm inputs. She hopes that in the future, she will be prosperous. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is a married woman. She has five children. She describes herself to be generous.

She operates a dairy farm where she sells milk. She has been involved in this business for five years.

She will use the KES 40,000 loan to buy another dairy cow. Her business goal is to have a milk processing plant within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will expand her business.

This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy another dairy cow.

loans.name: Revina

texts.en:
Revina is a divorced woman. She has six children. She describes herself to be honest.

She operates a retail business where she sells fruits and vegetables. She has been involved in this business for 15 years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be changes in season.

She will use the KES 60,000 loan to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children to university level. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Adijah

texts.en:
Adijah is a married woman. She has four children. She describes herself to be ambitious.

She operates a retail business where she sells beans, peas, and other cereals. She has been involved in this business for seven years. Her primary customers are locals. She will use the KES 60,000 loan to buy more stock of cereals.

This is her fifth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Her previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to purchase additional stock.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cereals

loans.name: Maria Elena

texts.es:
María Elena es una madre cabeza de familia, tiene dos hijos de 13 y 9 años, hombre y mujer respectivamente, se dedica principalmente a atender su hogar y a sus hijos, pero al igual tiene un negocio de cría de aves y cerdos el cual le genera el sustento para mantener su humilde hogar.
Su principal objetivo es criar a sus muchachos, brindarles una excelente educación y llevar el pan de cada día al hogar, por ello trabaja arduamente en su negocio.
María Elena tiene muy presente que se acerca la temporada navideña que es la época donde mayores ventas se presentan, por ello quiere solicitar un préstamo para la compra de concentrado (alimento de engorde) para cerdos y aves, quiere tener sus animales en óptimas condiciones para estas fechas especiales.
texts.en:
Maria Elena is a mother, head of household,  with two children aged 13 and 9 years, male and female respectively.  

She is mainly dedicated to taking care of her home and children, at the same time she has a poultry and pigs business, which generates sustenance to keep her humble home.

Her main objective is to raise her children, provide an excellent education and bring home the daily bread.  This is why she works so hard at her business.

Maria Elena is very aware of the approaching holiday season, which is the season when higher sales occur.  

She is requesting a loan for the purchase of feed (fattening food) for pigs and poultry because she wants her animals in optimal conditions for this special season.

loans.use: to purchase feed (fattening food) for pigs and poultry because she wants her animals in optimal conditions for this special season.

loans.name: Eva Ena

texts.es:
Eva es una mujer de 61 años de edad, madre de 3 hijos ya mayores de edad.
Ella trabaja por un gran propósito, junto con su esposo, vivir una vejez tranquila, sin pasar necesidades, es por este razón que pone tanto empeño en su trabajo.
Esta humilde mujer hoy quiere pedirles que al apoyen, que la ayuden a crecer, a volverse una gran empresaria y asegurar su futuro.
El dinero solicitado lo invertirá en la compra de alimento para engorde de pollos, aves y materiales para la construcción de un galpón para ubicar los nuevos animales.
texts.en:
Eva is a 61 year old woman. She is the mother of 3 grown children. Along with her husband, her goal is to have a tranquil old age that doesn't lack basic necessities. That is why she puts so much effort into her work.

This humble woman today asks for support and help to grow and become a great businesswoman with a secure future. The money will be used to buy feed to fatten her chickens, birds, and materials to build a new barn to locate the new animals.

loans.use: to buy feed to fatten her chickens, birds, and materials to build a new barn to locate the new animals.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en: Eunice is a married woman with four children. She describes herself as determined and honest. For 15 years she has operated a retail business where she sells clothes. Her business is located in a busy area, and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low inventory. She will use the 70,000 KES loan to buy more clothes to sell. Her business goal is to start selling shoes within five years. She hopes that in the future, she will have improved living standards. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more clothes to sell.

loans.name: Clara Rosa

texts.es:
Clara es una mujer que toda la vida se ha rebuscado la forma de generar el sustento para ella y su hijo menor de edad, ha realizado diferentes profesiones pero todas ellas temporales, en el momento se encuentra desempleada y cansada de esta situación decidió buscar ayuda para iniciar su propio negocio de cría de cerdos.
Es por este motivo que hoy llega a la comunidad Kiva buscando un apoyo económico que invertirá en la compra de cerdos, alimento de engorde y materiales para la construcción de una porqueriza.
Tu apoyo ayudara a una madre cabeza de familia a tener su propio negocio para buscar un mejor futuro para su familia.
texts.en:
Clara is a woman who has, throughout life, worked hard to find a way to generate a living for herself and her minor child.  

She has tried different professions but all of them temporary.  At this moment she finds herself unemployed and tired of this situation.  She has decided to seek help so that she can start her own business breeding pigs.

It is for this reason that today she reaches out to the Kiva community seeking financial support to invest in the purchase of pigs, fattening food and materials for the construction of a pigsty.

Your support will help a mother head of household to have her own business to seek a better future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase pigs, fattening food and materials for the construction of a pigsty.

loans.name: Gohar

texts.en: Gohar is from Talin town of Aragatsotn village. She lives with her husband and their 18-years-old daughter Anahit. Anahit is a student in Yerevan State University, in the History Department. Gohar and her husband work hard to sustain their family, but it is difficult for them to collect money for their daughter's university tuition. That's the reason Gohar has applied for this loan. By requesting the loan Gohar asks lenders to help her to pay Anahit's first semester's university tuition fee.

loans.use: to pay for her daughter's university tuition fee for the first semester

loans.name: Dorothy

texts.en:
Dorothy, the lady appearing in the photograph, is fifty-one years old, married and blessed with two children.

Her economic activity is maize and beans farming. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in September 2014 and has received trainings on enterprise development and financial planning which have equipped her with skills to effectively manage her enterprise.

She is taking a Kiva loan to buy seeds and fertilizer. She hopes the loan will help boost her business and hence increase her income. She will therefore be able to support her family and improve their living standards such as medical care and quality.

Dorothy is grateful to Kiva and their lenders for the help and support and promises to repay promptly.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizer that will help boost farming and thus provide more income.

loans.name: Esther

texts.en: Esther, 37, is married and blessed with four children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa to benefit from the training, especially enterprise development. She practices mixed farming where she rears poultry and farms maize, beans, potatoes and kale. She is borrowing the Kiva loan to purchase manure and fertilizers to enrich the soil to increase production. This will enable her to earn more income to provide better food and clothing to her children. She is happy and grateful to Kiva for the financial support. She promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy manure and fertilizer to boost farming production.

loans.name: Uaminifu Renové Group

texts.fr: Sikuli est commerçante, mariée à un enseignant, membre du groupe de crédits «Uaminifu Renové», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, âgée de 51 ans, mère de 6 enfants tous étudient. Elle est vendeuse des denrées alimentaires à son domicile dans une avenue de la ville depuis 2 ans. Elle va s’approvisionner en un sac de millets. Elle commença son business avec le fonds reçu de son mari. Elle souhaite accroitre son crédit, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au final, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en: Sikuli is a 51 year-old businesswoman who is married to a teacher, a member of the credit group "Uaminifu Renové, a client of IMF Hekima and a mother of 6 children who all go to school.  For two years, she has been selling food products at her home which is on a city avenue.  She will purchase one sack of millet.  She started her business with funds which she received from her husband.  She hopes to increase her credit and educate and feed her children.  Finally, she thanks Hekima for the support that they bring to entrepreneurs who cannot receive loans from banks.

loans.use: to purchase a sack of millet

loans.name: Rodrigo Manuel

texts.es:
Él es Rodrigo es un habitante de Córdoba, una zona muy afectada por la pobreza y la violencia, pero que tiene personas como él que con trabajo honesto buscan cambiar la realidad de su región.
A pesar de que Rodrigo tiene todo el entusiasmo por trabajar, no cuenta con el capital suficiente para levantar su profesión de cría de animales, por ello quiere acudir a una ayuda económica para la compra de cerdos, aves de corral para el levante y alimento para los mismos.
Rodrigue realiza todos estos esfuerzos solo con el propósito de cambiar su realidad y la de su familia que la conforman su pareja y sus dos hijos de 17 y 6 años de edad, hombre y mujer respectivamente.
texts.en: Rodrigo is from Córdoba, an area very affected by poverty and violence, but has people such as himself that through honest work try to change the reality of the region. Although Rodrigo has all the enthusiasm for work, he can't rely on sufficient capital to elevate his profession of raising livestock. He wants to acquire some financial support for the purchase of pigs and chickens and food for the animals. Rodrigo takes on all these efforts alone with the proposition of changing his and his family's reality which is comprised of his partner and two children ages 17 and 6, boy and girl respectively.

loans.use: purchase of pigs and chickens and food for the animals

loans.name: Angelmina

texts.es:
Angelmina cansada de solo ser una persona dedicada al hogar, de depender de otro para comprarse alguna cosa, optó por buscar ayuda y montar un negocio propio de cría de aves.
Esta decisión se debe a que se siente preocupada por no tener una actividad que le signifique ingresos, es por ello que acude  a la comunidad Kiva para solicitar recursos que la ayuden a iniciar con una profesión.
El dinero será destinado a la compra de aves, alimento de engorde y materiales para la construcción de un galpón.
Ella solo pide una ayuda, pondrá todas las ganas y entusiasmo no solo para generar los ingresos respectivos para pagar la cuota, todos sus esfuerzos van dirigidos hacia un horizonte, convertirse en una persona independiente.
texts.en:
Angelmina, tired of being a person who only works in the home, who depends on others in order to buy something for herself, decided to seek help and start her own business raising birds. She made this decision because she was worried that she didn't have work that brought in money. For that reason she looks to the Kiva community to seek resources that will help her start a profession.

The money will be used to buy birds, nutritional feed and materials to construct a barn. She only seeks help. She will put in all the effort and enthusiasm, not only to generate income to make the loan payments. All her efforts will be directed to a new opportunity, to convert herself into an independent person.

loans.use: to buy birds, nutritional feed and materials to construct a barn.

loans.name: Leiber Alberto

texts.es:
Él es Leiber, es un hombre solitario, responsable, emprendedor, muy serio y correcto en su trabajo, se dedica a la cría de cerdos, negocio que trabaja 6 días por semana con una intensidad de 15 horas diarias, un hombre que deja cuerpo y alma en cada día de trabajo, que hace denotar la pasión y cariño que tiene por su profesión, pues gracias a esta ha sabido mantenerse durante muchos años.
Leiber necesita un apoyo económico para la compra de alimento de engorde para cerdos, este hombre trabaja fuertemente porque tiene una meta trazada, comprar una vivienda y terreno propio.
Vamos! Anímate apoya este empresario, ayúdalo a alcanzar su sueño
texts.en:
This is Leiber. He is single, responsible, enterprising, very serious and detailed in his work. He has a business raising pigs, work he does 6 days of the week intensely for 15 hours per day. He puts his body and soul into the work every day, working with passion and care in his chosen profession. Thanks to this effort has have known how to support himself over many years.

Leiber needs your support to buy feed to fatten pigs; this man works hard because he has a goal to buy his own home and land. Let's support this businessman and help him achieve his dream!

loans.use: to buy feed to fatten pigs; this man works hard because he has a goal to buy his own home and land.

loans.name: Nellys Margot

texts.es:
Ella es Nellys es una mujer de 45 años de edad que busca a través del trabajo independiente un medio para generar ingresos, ella se dedica a la cría de ganado porcino, actividad que aprendió de sus padres y que sirve para generar el complemento de dinero para mantener su hogar.
Nellys no oculta una enorme preocupación, ella sabe que su negocio no da abastó para mantener su hogar y necesita mucho de su esposo y es algo que la molesta porque siempre se ha esforzado por crear una unidad productiva que le ayude a independizarse económicamente y si llega a lograrlo quizás su familia saldría de la pobreza.
Por lograr la independencia económica y asegurar un mejor futuro para su familia, Nellys solicita un préstamo para la compra de cerdos y alimento de engorde.
texts.en:
This is Nellys, a 45-year-old woman who is trying to generate income through independent work. She raises pigs for a living, which she learned from her parents and which generates supplementary income to support her household.

Nellys does not hide a huge concern; she knows that her business does not provide enough to support her household and that she needs her husband a lot and this bothers her because she has always worked hard to create a business that will help her become financially independent, and if she were able to achieve this her family might be able to get out of poverty.

To achieve financial independence and ensure a better future for her family, Nellys is requesting a loan to buy pigs and feed to fatten them.

loans.use: to buy pigs and feed to fatten them.

loans.name: Tamar

texts.en:
Tamar is 38 years old and is from the Lanchkhuti district. She lives with her husband, child and mother-in-law. The family is involved in agricultural activities. In particular, they have two cows and a plot of agricultural land where they grow maize and haricot. They sell the harvest locally.

Tamar decided to renovate her flat in order to rent it out and generate additional income. The startup program, which is a joint initiative with Kiva and Credo, enables her to get a loan of 1,500 USD. With the received loan she will renovate a flat and will rent it out. This will give her a chance to generate stable income and improve the living conditions of her family.

loans.use: to renovate a flat and rent it out in order to generate income

loans.name: Nelis Del Carmen

texts.es:
Nelis es una mujer de 45 años de edad, una mujer que habita en el municipio de Córdoba, un lugar muy afectado por la violencia y a pobreza, pero tiene ciudadanos como Nelis, dispuestos a ganarse la vida honestamente, con sudor y esfuerzo que a pesar de las pocas posibilidades de emplearse busca alternativas para generar ingresos y una de ellas es el emprendimiento.
Nelly no cuenta con muchos recursos, solo tiene una fe inquebrantable y muchos ánimos por hacer las cosas bien, por ello quiere solicitar un préstamo para iniciar un negocio de carnicería el cual ubicara inicialmente en su hogar, pondrá a su disposición todos los artículos de su casa para trabajar, mientras va ganando dinero para adquirir para el negocio.
El dinero del préstamo será invertido en la compra de cerdos.
Si apoyas esta empresaria le das la oportunidad a una mujer de sacar a su hogar conformado por 4 hijos menores de edad adelante, anímate, presta
texts.en:
Nelis is a 45-year-old woman, a woman who lives in the municipality of Cordoba, a place greatly affected by violence and poverty. However, it has citizens like Nelis, prepared to make a living honestly, with sweat and effort who, despite the few possibilities of employment, search for alternatives to generate an income and one of these is entrepreneurship.

Nelly cannot count on many resources; she has only an unflinching faith and a lot of energy to do things well, and because of this she wants to request a loan to start a butcher’s chop which she will initially place in her home. She will put at her disposal all of the items of her home for work while she makes money to make purchases for the business.

The money from the loan will be invested in the purchase of pigs.

If you support this entrepreneur you will be giving a woman the opportunity to bring out ahead her household made up of 4 minor-aged children. Go ahead, lend it to her.

loans.use: to begin a butcher shop, using her kitchen utensils, and to purchase a pig.

loans.name: Edgar Mauricio

texts.es: Edgar es un electricista reconocido en Chía un municipio de Cundinamarca y en esta localidad su trabajo se ha destacado en viviendas y construcciones en donde ha ofrecido sus servicio de instalaciones eléctricas que brinda a través de contratistas del sector.  Edgar cuenta con 25 años al servicio de la comunidad garantizando el mantenimiento y reparación de redes, en su local diariamente recibe a sus clientes en donde pacta el contrato a realizar, según las especificaciones es decir si va a trabajar a todo costo o simplemente prestación del servicio.   En la actualidad está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para ampliar las instalaciones de su bodega y tener una mayor capacidad de almacenamiento.  Con esta inversión garantizara los recursos necesarios para sus contratos y su servicio será mucho más ágil y dinámico. Edgar se encuentra separado de su cónyuge pero es muy responsable con el bienestar de sus dos hijos.  Su meta a futuro es comprar una vivienda.
texts.en: Edgar is a well-known electrician in Chía, a municipality of Cundinamarca, and he has worked there in homes and on construction sites, where he has offered electrical installation services through local contractors.  For 25 years Edgar has been serving his community, guaranteeing the maintenance and repair of networks.  At his workshop he receives customers daily where they agree on contracts according to their specifications, such as whether he will work all expenses included or simply perform a service.  He is currently applying for his first Kiva loan through Fundación Mario Santo Domingo to expand his warehouse facilities so he will have a larger storage capacity.  This investment will guarantee the means he needs for his contracts and his work will be much more flexible and dynamic. Edgar is separated from his partner but he is very responsible regarding his children's wellbeing.  His goal for the future is to buy a home.

loans.use: to expand his warehouse facilities and have a greater storage capacity.

loans.name: Yanira Marlene

texts.es: Yanira es una mujer de 42 años de edad que se dedica a la venta de cangrejos de forma ambulante, recorriendo las principales calles de su municipio, además buscando la manera de obtener mejores ingresos se dedica a prestar sus servicios domésticos. Yanira habita en casa de su propiedad junto a su madre y su compañero de vida en casa de su propiedad desde hace 6 años. Yanira cada día cuenta con más clientes que solicitan sus productos, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en variedad de cangrejos y mariscos para mejorar ofrecer variedad a sus clientes.
texts.en: Yanira is a 42-year-old woman who sells crabs on foot, covering the main streets of the municipality.  In her efforts to generate more income she also works as a house cleaner.  Yanira has lived in her own home with her mother and her life partner for six years.  Every day Yanira gets more customers looking for her product, which is why she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy a variety of crabs and seafood so she can offer her customers more variety.

loans.use: to buy a variety of crabs and seafood so she can offer her customers more variety.

loans.name: Isabel Cristina

texts.es:
Isabel es una hermosa joven de 19 años de edad que busco en el emprendimiento la mejor forma de sacar adelante su hogar, no tiene hijos, pero vive en un humilde morada que necesita el apoyo de todos en conjunto para mantenerse. 
Con unos ahorros inicio un negocio de alquiler de videojuegos, dicho negocio ha tenido muy buen acogida en el barrio, aunque solo cuenta con una consola, está se mantiene alquilada todo el día y cree que es tiempo de buscar la forma de comprar otra, pero sus ingresos solo le bastan para pagar los servicios públicos del hogar y colaborar con la alimentación.
Ella no ha tenido experiencia crediticia, y debido a su juventud es muy difícil acceder a un crédito, pero gracias a la corporación Interactuar, quien le ofreció la oportunidad de pertenecer a Kiva, quizás pueda lograrlo.
Esta bella joven solicita un préstamo para completar el dinero necesario para la compra de una consola de videojuegos, 4 controles, un televisor y una mesa de apoyo.
texts.en:
Isabel is a nice young 19 year old who is looking to entrepreneurship as the best way to improve her household. She doesn't have any children, but lives in a modest home that needs everyone's support to maintain. With some savings she began a video game rental business, which has been very well received in the neighborhood. Nevertheless she relies on only one console which stays rented all day and she believes it's time to find the means to purchase another, but her earnings only serve to pay for utilities around the home and assist with buying food. 

She doesn't have credit experience, and due to her age it's difficult for her to acquire a loan. But thanks to the Interactuar corporation, who offer opportunity through Kiva, maybe she'll be able to achieve this. This lovely young lady requests a loan to have the money necessary to purchase a console, four controllers, a television, and a table.

loans.use: be able to purchase a console, four controllers, a television, and a table.

loans.name: Winnie

texts.en: Winnie is a married woman. She has five children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sells fruits and vegetables. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She will use the KES 10,000 loan to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. She will use the anticipated profits to purchase additional stock.

loans.use: to buy more stock of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Ana Senia Del Carmen

texts.es:
Ana, estudio hasta noveno grado, es madre soltera, tiene 2 hijos que estudian en la escuela de su comunidad.

Ana, tiene muchos deseos de superarse y sacar adelante a sus hijos, desde la edad de 10 años trabaja en la agricultura, ya que sus abuelos fueron agricultores y fueron ellos quienes la criaron.- Además de eso ha trabajado como ama de casa durante 5 años, actualmente trabaja desde hace 1 año en una venta de granos básicos.

Ana, solicita el préstamo para comprar productos para colocar una tienda; de esta forma podrá tener otra fuente de ingresos.

Ana, sueña con tener un negocio propio y mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hijos.
texts.en:
Ana studied until the ninth grade. She is a single mother. She has 2 children who study in the school in their community.

Ana has a great desire to improve herself and to provide for her children. Since the age of 10 she has worked in agriculture since her grandparents were farmers and it was they who raised her. Beyond this, she has worked as a homemaker for 5 years. Currently, she has worked since a year ago selling basic grains.

Ana is requesting the loan to purchase products to put in a store. In this way, she will be able to have another source of income.

Ana dreams of having her own business and to improve her children’s quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase products to open a store.

loans.name: Abasolo Group

texts.es:
La comida más representativa de un municipio veracruzano es la barbacoa de res, la cual recientemente se nombró como "platillo típico del municipio" debido a su preparación única. Dicho alimento es célebremente usado en cualquier tipo de celebración o evento importante para los habitantes.  De igual forma, los tamales de masa, yuca y elote, los productos lácteos, el pez mojarra y los aperitivos fritos son una muestra de la amplia variedad gastronómica de la región. 
   En una de las colonias se formó un grupo el cual lleva por nombre Abasolo y sus integrantes son: María, Virginia y Nelly quienes se dedican a vender comida y Rosa Isela quien hace lo propio con cosméticos. 
   Rosa Isela es la más joven del grupo y se distingue por su carácter amable y su espíritu emprendedor; todos le llaman Ise  debido al cariño que le tienen. Desde hace dos años decidió vender cosméticos ya que necesitaba ingresos para pagar las colegiaturas escolares de su carrera universitaria. Comenta, “me siento contenta al ser yo quien esté pagando mi carrera, esto me motiva mucho más”. De igual modo, de lunes a viernes trabaja en una papelería ubicada en el centro de su comunidad donde aprovecha para ofrecer los productos que vende. 
   Las ganancias y el sueldo percibido, además de permitirle pagar sus estudios, le sirven para aportar ingresos a la casa de su tía en donde vive actualmente. Este es su primer ciclo en el grupo y el préstamo le será de utilidad para pagar productos como delineadores, rímel, rubor, sombra, mascarillas, cremas, lociones, tintes, desodorantes, entre otros. “Gracias por la gran oportunidad que me han dado al brindarme el crédito y por creer en nosotros, Dios los bendiga” son las palabras que expresó Ise.
*La fotografía fue tomada en “la novia del sol” ciudad donde viven las integrantes del grupo, Ise viste blusa blanca y pantalón azul.
texts.en:
The dish that most represents the municipality of Veracruz is beef barbecue, which was recently named the "typical dish of the municipality" because of its unique preparation. This food is famously prepared for every kind of celebration or important event for the locals. In the same vein, masa, yucca, and corn tamales, dairy products, sea bream fish, and fried appetizers are examples of the wide gastronomic variety of the region.

In one of these communities a group called Abasolo was formed and its members are: María, Virginia, and Nelly, who sell prepared foods, and Rosa Isela, who has a business selling cosmetics.

Rosa Isela is the youngest of the group and she stands out because of her friendly nature and her entrepreneurial spirit; everyone calls her Ise because she is dear to them. A few years ago she decided to sell cosmetics because she needed income to pay the school fellowships for her university degree. She tells us, "I'm happy to be the one who's paying for my own degree; this motivates me much more." By the same token, Monday through Friday she works at a stationery shop in the center of her community where she also offers her products for sale.

Her profits and her salary, in addition to allowing her to pay for her education, help her contribute to her aunt's household, where she currently lives. This is her first loan cycle with the group and the loan will be used to buy products such as liners, mascara, blush, shadows, face masks, creams, lotions, hair dyes, deodorants, and other items. "Thank you for the great opportunity you have given me in offering me a loan and for believing in us. God bless you," were the words Ise used.

*This photograph was taken in "La Novia del Sol" the city where the group members live; Ise is wearing a white top and blue pants.

loans.use: to buy: liners, mascara, blush, shadows, face masks, creams, lotions, hair dyes, deodorants.

loans.name: Amton

texts.en: Amton is a married man. He has two children. He describes himself to be joyful. He operates a retail business where he sells phone accessories and soft drinks. He has been involved in this business for three years. His business is located in a good area and his primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. He will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more stock of phone accessories and soft drinks. He hopes that in the future, he will educate his children and have a stable business. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for his children.

loans.use: to buy more stock of phone accessories and soft drinks.

loans.name: Priscah

texts.en: Priscah is a married woman. She has five children. She describes herself to be focused. She operates a dairy farm where she sells milk. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She will use the KES 55,000 loan to buy a dairy cow. She hopes that in the future, she will be successful. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow.

loans.name: Everlyne

texts.en: Everlyne is a married woman. She has five children. She describes herself to be committed. She operates a carpentry business where she makes furniture. She has been involved in this business for 10 years. Her business is located in a favourable area. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the KES 50,000 loan to buy more stock of carpentry materials. Her business goal is to start a carpentry training school within five years. She hopes that in the future she will be successful.

loans.use: to buy more stock of carpentry materials

loans.name: Rodriga Del Carmen

texts.es:
Rodriga, estudio hasta tercer grado, es viuda, tiene 3 hijos, dos de ellos están casados y solo un hijo y dos nietas viven con ella.

Rodriga, trabaja desde la edad de 9 años en la agricultura, ya que sus padres fueron agricultores y ella aprendió el oficio; luego que se casó y continuo trabajando en conjunto con su esposo, ambos trabajan la agricultura y crían ganado de repasto.- Su esposo falleció hace más de 15 años, pero ella sigue sembrando y criando ganado con la ayuda de uno de sus hijos. Actualmente, tienen sembrados 14,000 metros cuadrados de cultivo de maíz y tienen 6 vacas.

El préstamo será invertido para comprar ganado de repasto.

El sueño de Rodriga, es mejorar su calidad de vida y mejorar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Rodriga studied until the third grade, is a widow and has three children. Two of her children are married, and only one of them, and two of her grandchildren, live with her.

She has worked in agriculture since the age of 9, since her parents were farmers and she learned the trade from them. Later she got married and continued working together with her husband. Both of them farmed and raised grazing livestock. Her husband passed away more than 15 years ago, but she continues farming and raising livestock with the help of one of her children.

Currently, they have 14,000 square meters planted with corn, and have 6 cows. The loan will be used to buy grazing livestock. Rodriga's dreams is to improve her quality of life and improve her home.

loans.use: to buy grazing cattle.

loans.name: Naranjo Group

texts.es:
Una gran  planta hidroeléctrica permite el abastecimiento de energía eléctrica a una comunidad del estado de Oaxaca; la presa que da vida a dicha planta es, a su vez, uno de los atractivos turísticos más importantes de la región. Los visitantes pueden disfrutar de una rica comida con el pescado autóctono de la región: la mojarra. Es en dicha comunidad se integró un grupo el cual lleva por nombre Naranjo ya que los integrantes sienten una especial predilección por éstos frutos pertenecientes a su localidad. 
   Actualmente el grupo  está integrado por ocho personas honestas, trabajadoras quienes persiguen un fin común: la estabilidad de sus familias. Ellos son: Ivette quien invertirá en repostería; Javier, en una papelería; Evelyn, refresco y ropa; José, raspados; Gilberta, ropa, cosméticos y calzado; Betsabe, ropa; Alejandra, ropa y calzado y Martha, cosméticos.
   José es conocido por su carácter amable el cual le permite conseguir amigos y clientes de forma sencilla. Para ofrecer lo mejor a su familia, tuvo que desempeñar tareas en el campo y la pesca, sin embargo decidió iniciar con la venta de raspados desde hace 15 años. Dicha actividad consiste en obtener escarcha de una gran placa de hielo para posteriormente agregarle jarabes de distintos sabores dulces, de igual modo se pueden realizar combinaciones de sabores. Sobre una mesa coloca la barra de hielo y los saborizantes, en frascos de vidrio; y a un lado los materiales desechables para servir a cada cliente.  
   El éxito que ha obtenido es considerable y con las ganancias obtenidas compró un triciclo en el que recorre las calles de la comunidad ofreciendo su sabroso producto, “me gusta recorrer las calles satisfaciendo los gustos de mis clientes y lo mejor de todo es obtener ingresos para solventar los gastos del hogar” comentó. Entre los frescos y deliciosos sabores que ofrece están los de coco, piña, fresa, cacahuate, uva, chocolate, nuez, tamarindo, rompope, limón, nanche, grosella, vainilla, fresa c/leche y café. 
   El objetivo de José es establecer una peletería y ofrecer nuevos productos aprovechando las temperaturas elevadas de la región. El préstamo le será de utilidad para comprar frutas de temporada, hielo, leche, picante, vasos, popotes, cucharas, refresco y agua purificada.
*La fotografía fue tomada en la casa de Evelyn, José es el único hombre.
texts.en:
A large hydroelectric plant supplies electricity to a community in the state of Oaxaca; the dam that gives life to this plant is, in turn, one of the most important tourist attractions of the region. Visitors can enjoy a meal made of the native fish of the region: the mojarra. This is the community where the group called Naranjo was formed.  The name was chosen because members feel a special fondness for these fruits found in their town.  

The group is currently made up of eight honest, hardworking individuals who are pursuing a common goal: the stability of their families. 

They are: Ivette who will invest in baking; Javier in stationery; Evelyn, in drinks and clothing; Jose, slushies; Gilberta, clothes, cosmetics and footwear; Betsabe, clothing; Alejandra, clothing and footwear and Martha, cosmetics.

Jose is known for his friendly character which allows him to acquire friends and customers easily. To offer the best to his family, he had to take up jobs working in the fields and fishing, but he decided to start with the sale of slushies 15 years ago.  

This job is done by obtaining frost from a block of ice, which is subsequently covered with various sweet syrups, and combinations of flavors can also be made.  The slab of ice slab is placed on a table and the flavoring in glass jars and to the side disposable materials to serve each customer.

The success achieved is considerable and with the profits made he bought a tricycle with which he travels through the streets of the community offering his tasty product, "I like to walk the streets to meet the tastes of my clients and best of all to have some income which will cover the costs at home "he said. 

Among the fresh and delicious flavors offered are coconut, pineapple, strawberry, peanut, grape, chocolate, walnut, tamarind, eggnog, lemon, yellow cherry, currant, vanilla, strawberry with milk and coffee.

Jose's goal is to establish an ice-pop store where he would offer new products taking advantage of the high temperatures of the region. The loan will be useful to buy seasonal fruit, ice, milk, hot sauce, cups, straws, spoons, soft drinks and purified water.

* The photograph was taken at Evelyn's house, Jose is the only man.

loans.use: purchase; seasonal fruit, ice, milk, hot, cups, straws, spoons, soft drinks and purified water

loans.name: Mariny

texts.en:
Mariny is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be focused.

She operates a retail business where she sells tomatoes, onions, and beans. She has been involved in this business for two years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

She will use the KES 15,000 loan to buy more stock of vegetables and beans.

Her business goal is to have a stable business within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of vegetables and beans.

loans.name: Merlita

texts.en:
Merlita is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with four children.

She earns a living by raising poultry in the Philippines. She is borrowing PHP 15,000 through NWTF to buy additional sacks of feeds and other supplies to raise her chickens.

She supplements this income with earnings from her food vending and motorcycle transport.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Merlita dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of feeds and other supplies to raise her chickens.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with four children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 21,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell, like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures, like food vending.

Marilou dreams that one day she will be able to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell, like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

loans.name: Maurice

texts.en:
Maurice is a married man. He has 3 children. He describes himself as focused. He operates a retail business where he makes metal boxes. He has been involved in this business for 5 years. His business is located in a busy area.

He will use the Kes 20,000 loan to buy metal sheets, paint and other materials for making boxes. This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy metal sheets, paint and other materials.

loans.name: Felister

texts.en:
Felister is a married woman. She has three children. She describes herself to be honest.

She operates a retail business where she sells sugar, bread, flour, milk, and other items. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more stock of sugar, flour, bread, soap, and other items.

Her business goal is to be successful within five years. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sugar, flour, bread, soap, and other items.

loans.name: Roselyn

texts.en:
Roselyn is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with one child.

She runs a buy-and-sell charcoal business in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell for her business.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures, like food vending and a general store.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Roselyn dreams that one day she will be able to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional sacks of charcoal to sell for her  business

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a buy-and-sell vegetables business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase additional stock of vegetables to sell for her vegetables business.

Mercy has been in this business for 11 years. She earns more income from food vending and buying and selling dried fish.

She has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save money to expand her business in the future.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Gloria

texts.en:
Gloria is 63 years old and widowed with five children, one of whom is in school.

She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as soap, milk, sugar, eggs, chips, etc.

Gloria has borrowed and paid 11 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from buying coconut meat.

She aspires to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as soap, milk, sugar, eggs, chips, etc.

loans.name: Samuel

texts.en:
Samuel is a married man. He has two children. He describes himself to be ambitious.

He operates a retail business where he makes metallic boxes. He has been involved in this business for three years. His primary customers are locals. He describes his biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

He will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more stock of materials for making boxes.

This is his second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully. He will use the anticipated profits to puchase additional stock.

loans.use: to buy more stock of materials for making boxes.

loans.name: Jeska

texts.en:
Jeska is a married woman. She has six children. She describes herself to be God-fearing.

She operates a retail business where she sells bananas. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her business is located in a good area, and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

She will use the KES 21,000 loan to buy more stock of bananas.

She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of bananas.

loans.name: Leah

texts.en:
For almost two years now, Leah has been operating a general store, selling commodities ranging from coffee, powdered milk, sugar, seasonings, shampoo, toothpaste, bath soap, biscuits, eggs, edible oil and soft drinks.

She is married with five young dependents. Her husband's occupation is as a driver. She ran out of capital to maintain the inventory of merchandise in her store, and is struggling to support the needs of her family.

Leah decided to use the loan to buy a variety of stock, like beverages, condiments, toiletries and soft drinks. With the presence of these, Leah could continue to manage her earnings and set aside some savings for emergency use. Thus, she could continue to support the needs of her growing children.

She is grateful for getting the funds, and in return she is exerting much effort to improve her livelihood in order to become sustainable in the coming years.

loans.use: to buy a variety of stock, like beverages, condiments, toiletries and soft drinks.

loans.name: Jackline

texts.en:
Jackline is a single woman who describes herself to be honest. She operates a tailoring business where she makes clothes. She has been involved in this business for 4 years.

Her business is located in a good area and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low stock. She will use the Kes 40,000 loan to buy tailoring materials and add another sewing machine.

loans.use: to buy tailoring materials and another sewing machine.

loans.name: Analiza

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Analiza works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from pig fattening. Analiza is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy additional bundles of fishing net, gasoline, etc. for her fishing business.

Analiza has been sustaining her business activities through her past six loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional bundles of fishing net, gasoline, etc.

loans.name: Evangelyn

texts.en:
Evangelyn is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a fishing business in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 16,000 through NWTF to buy additional materials such as fishing net, gasoline, wood, bamboo, etc. for her fishing business.

Evangelyn has been in this business for eight years. She earns more income from pig fattening and fish vending.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Evangelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy additional materials such as fishing net, gasoline, wood, bamboo, etc.

loans.name: Virsie

texts.en:
Virsie works hard to support her family. She is married and has a motorcycle transport business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 27000 loan through NWTF to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

Virsie has been in this business for 10 years now.

In the future, Virsie would like to build and expand her business to secure the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to purchase spare parts for the maintenance of her motorcycle.

loans.name: Editha

texts.en:
Editha is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like making nipa roofing.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Editha dreams that one day she will be able to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, etc.

loans.name: Juan Sebastian

texts.es: Juan es un panadero reconocido en Chocontá un municipio de Cundinamarca y en esta localidad diariamente el desayuno de los habitantes es acompañado con las delicias que prepara Juan entre ellas panes de queso y mantequilla, panes integrales, pan de maíz, pan de bonos, pan francés, deditos y pastelitos horneados, tortas y postres, galletas entre otros productos que acompañan muy bien con bebidas calientes como café con leche, aromáticas o algún refresco natural o artificial que tenga en sus exhibidores.  Esta actividad la heredó de sus padres puesto que participó en este negocio familiar desde muy niño y en la actualidad cuenta con una majestuosa experiencia que le ha permitido llevar las riendas de este negocio con muy buenos resultados, ofreciéndole bienestar a su núcleo familiar conformado por su cónyuge y su pequeña hija de apenas dos años de edad. En la actualidad desea ampliar la capacidad de su negocio, es por ello que está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, que invertirá en la compra de materias primas y realizará adecuaciones para mejorar el servicio en su negocio.  Juan es muy ceñido a los detalles con esta inversión logrará apuntar a un mejor ambiente que propicie más afluencia de clientes y con ello más ventas.
texts.en:
Juan is a recognized baker in Chocontá, a municipality of Cundinamarca. In this area, the citizens' breakfasts are accompanied by the delights Juan prepares. Among these are cheese and butter, wholewheat breads, cornbread, pandebono (cheese bread), french bread, breadsticks, and baked pies, cakes, pastries, and cookies, among other goods that well accompany drinks such as coffee with milk, tea, or other natural or artificial drinks that he has in his display cases.

He inherited this work from his parents, given that he has participated in this family business since he was a young boy and currently has a masterful amount of experience that has allowed him to hold the reins of the this business with very good results. This offers wellbeing to his family, which is made up of his partner and his small daughter who is barely two years old.

Currently, he would like to expand the capacity of his business, and this is the reason he is requesting his first Kiva loan through the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. He will invest this money in raw materials and make improvements to better the service of his business. Juan is very attentive to the details of this investment and will achieve the aim of creating a better atmosphere that will contribute to a greater influx of customers and with that more sales.

loans.use: to buy raw materials and make improvements to better the service in his business.

loans.name: Norlita

texts.en:
Norlita is a resident in the town of Ajuy, Ilo-ilo. She is a very industrious woman who is striving hard to support her family.

She is a 35-year-old married woman with two young children ages four and six years old respectively.

She runs a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells commodities like noodles, biscuits, condiments, assorted canned goods, chips, sugar,coffee, shampoo, and toiletries.

Aside from running a store, she also operates a transportation service. She earns a living by the rent from of it.

She has requested a loan to purchase assorted groceries and to pay for maintenance of the vehicle. These are vital to her livelihood. It could improve the contents of her store and slowly improve her sales.

These could allow Norlita to continue provide the needs of her growing children and also handle her finances wisely.

She is determined that someday she will become successful in her chosen field.

loans.use: to purchase assorted groceries and pay for maintenance for the vehicle.

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes is a married woman. She has five children. She describes herself to be God-fearing.

She operates a farm where she keeps dairy cows. She has been involved in this business for ten years. Her business is located in a good area, and her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital.

She will use the KES 10,000 loan to buy animal feed.

She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy animal feed.

loans.name: Amelia

texts.en:
Amelia is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as canned goods, personal care products, etc.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like making nipa roofing.

She successfully paid back her previous loan, and now she has requested an additional loan to further build her business.

Amelia dreams that one day she will be able to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as canned goods, personal care products, etc.

loans.name: Zenaida

texts.en:
Zenaida is 56 years old and married with four children. She works hard to provide for her family.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell such as canned goods, personal care products, etc.

Zenaida has borrowed and paid five loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for ten years and also earns an income from buying and selling dried fish and vegetables.

She aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell such as canned goods, personal care products, etc.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a married woman with two children. She describes herself to be honest. She operates a retail business where she sells charcoal. She has been involved in this business for 12 years.

Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital. She will use the Kes 70,000 loan to buy more stock of charcoal.

She hopes that in the future, she will be successful. This is her third loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. Previous loans were repaid successfully. She will use the anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children.

loans.use: to buy more charcoal stock.

loans.name: Werner Wilfredo

texts.es: Werner tiene 40 años de edad y vive con su esposa en casa propia, el posee un taller de estructuras metálicas, donde elabora puertas, balcones, entre otros, tiene 20 años de dedicarse a este negocio, ya tiene mucha clientela pues lo buscan por la calidad de su trabajo, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el  solicita nuevamente un crédito que le permita comprar, hierro, metal, herramienta etc. y así continuar con su trabajo para poder tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en: Werner is 40 years old and lives with his wife in a house they own. He has a metallic structures shop where he makes doors, railings and other items.  He has 20 years in the business and and has many customers because they like the quality of his work.  With the profits he makes he is able to cover some of his home expenses.  He is requesting a new loan to buy iron, metal, tools, etc. and continue with his work to obtain better income.

loans.use: to buy iron, metal, tools, etc for his shop.

loans.name: Joseline

texts.en:
Joseline is 49 years old and married with three children, two of whom are in school. Joseline works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 17000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, coffee, eggs, milk, soap, etc.

Joseline has been in this business for 8 years.

In the future, Joseline would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, coffee, eggs, milk, soap, etc.

loans.name: Virginia

texts.en:
Virginia is 53 years old and married with six children. She works very hard to provide for them.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional items to sell like soap, milk, sugar, eggs, etc.

Virginia has been in this business for 11 years.

In the future, Virginia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase additional items to sell like soap, milk, sugar, eggs, etc.

loans.name: Marilou

texts.en:
Marilou is married and has a food vending business in the Philippines. Marilou works hard to support her family.

She requested a PHP 18000 loan through NWTF to buy ingredients like milk, sugar, flour, cooking oil, etc.

Marilou has been in this business for 20 years now.

In the future, Marilou would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like milk, sugar, flour, cooking oil, etc.

loans.name: Gohar

texts.en:
Gohar lives in Sisian town with her husband and 16-years-old daughter. Her elder two daughters are married and live separately.

Gohar is a teacher by profession, working at a local school. After school, all her time is devoted to her lovely farm. She has been involved in her farming business for 12 years and over these hard and tireless working years, Gohar was able to develop a beautiful farm. She keeps there livestock of three cows, 5 calves, a piglet and 60 hens and also cultivates wheat, barley and potato.

Gohar asks for this loan to purchase forage for feeding the livestock and fuel for land cultivation. This will give her a chance to be prepared for the coming winter.

Gohar has been approved for a loan, within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products. After years of tireless work, Gohar has been able to find a good job and owns a farm, which is profitable enough to cover her monthly payments. So Gohar hopes for lenders' support.

loans.use: to pay for forage for feeding the livestock and fuel for land cultivation.

loans.name: Ana Berenice

texts.es:
Ana es una mujer con 39 años de edad, casada y tiene dos hijos pequeños. Debido a que su esposo se quedó desempleado por un tiempo y ver como su situación económica desmejoraba poco a poco, esta mujer busco una solución adecuada para surgir en medio de tanto obstáculo, inicio a laborar en la cría y venta de ganado, con los ingresos generados por este logra cubrir algunos gastos de su hogar, como lo es la alimentación y el arriendo.
Trabaja todos los días durante 4 horas diarias.

Se encuentra solicitando un préstamo con el cual comprará cerdos y cuido al por mayor para los mismos.
Se siente feliz porque sabe que con el apoyo de Interactuar y los colaboradores del portal kiva su negocio mejorara y podrá cumplir el sueño de tener su propia casa.
texts.en:
Ana is 39 years old, she is married and has two young children.  Due to the fact that her husband was unemployed for a while and seeing that her economic situation was worsening, this woman looked for the right solution to stay afloat while surrounded by many obstacles.  She started working raising and selling livestock.  With the income generated she is able to cover some of her home expenses such as food and rent.

She works daily for four hours.  She is requesting a loan to buy pigs and feed at wholesale for them.  She is happy because she knows that with the support of Interactuar and the supporters of kiva, her business will improve and she will be able to reach her dream of buying a house.

loans.use: to buy pigs and feed at wholesale for them.

loans.name: Ana Yanira

texts.es:
Ana, de 41 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, está acompañada, su pareja trabaja en la agricultura y en la crianza de bovinos y tienen dos hijos que están estudiando.


Ana, ha trabajado desde pequeña junto a sus padres como jornaleros en las fincas de café, ella es una persona que se ha esforzado mucho para lograr salir adelante.- Actualmente, trabaja en su pequeña tienda, pero también junto a su esposo siembran maíz y crían ganado de repasto; de esta forma están obteniendo ingresos para seguir adelante con sus hijos.


El crédito será utilizado para comprar ganado de repasto y de esta forma junto con su esposo podrán continuar trabajando en una actividad productiva.
 
Ana, sueña con que sus hijos puedan seguir estudiando y que sean personas de bien.
texts.en:
Ana, 41, has a 9th grade education. She is married. Her husband works in agriculture and raises cattle. They have two children who go to school.

From a young age, Ana worked with her parents as day laborers on coffee plantations. She is an individual who has worked hard to get ahead. Currently, Ana is working in her small store, but she also grows corn and raises cattle with her husband. This is how she has earned income to provide for her children.

This loan will be used to buy cattle so Ana can continue to work with her husband in this productive activity. Ana's dream is that her children can continue studying and become good people.

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Sidra

texts.en:
Sidra is a young school owner who has been running her school for the past three years. She has recently requested for a loan worth 150,000 PKR to make a mini computer lab and place a water cooler in the school.

Her plan is to expand her school in different cities and make education common everywhere. She is eager to change the education scenario in Pakistan and has already started that in her hometown.

loans.use: to make a mini computer lab and place a water cooler in the school.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: el joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 29 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica a la venta y compra de chatarra desde hace 3 años, su negocio esta ubicado cerca de su lugar de residencia en una zona muy transitada y con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, el joven vive en casa propia con su grupo familiar, el esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas chatarra aluminio, cobre, hierro, etc. y asi poder continuar con sus ventas.
texts.en: The young man with his face blurred is 29 years old and lives in a high risk are.  He buys and sells scrap junk, has done this for three years, his business is located close to his residence in an area with a lot of transit and with what he makes from sales he is able to cover some of his home expenses.  He lives in a house he owns with his family.  He is requesting a loan to buy more scrap junk like aluminum, copper, iron, etc. and continue with his sales.

loans.use: to buy more scrap junk like aluminum, copper, iron, etc.

loans.name: Josue

texts.es: Josué es un emprendedor de 26 años que decidió continuar con el legado de su familia, la producción de sandalias y calzado femenino; sus padres y hermanos tienen talleres similares y él además de los conocimientos adquiridos en el seno de su familia se capacitó en el SENA en tecnología de producción de calzado y desde hace 5 años logró organizar su propia unidad productiva. Josué trabaja diariamente en el horario de 8:00 a.m. a 6:00 p.m. y vende sus productos directamente al cliente en su taller o a través de almacenes de calzado que se han constituido en su principal canal de distribución. Actualmente Josué tramita su primer credikiva a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, el cual piensa invertir en la compra al por mayor de suelas sintéticas, cuerina, pegantes y accesorios, para obtener buenos descuentos y para prepararse para la demanda que genera las festividades del fin de año. Su meta es fortalecer su negocio, adquirir maquinarías más avanzadas para competir en calidad, precios y servicios y comprar su propio apartamento.
texts.en: Josue is a 26-year-old entrepreneur that decided to continue with his family's legacy, the production of ladies' sandals and shoes.  His parents and siblings have similar shops, and in addition to what her learned with his family, he prepared himself at SENA in shoe production technology.  5 years ago he was able to organize his own producing shop.  Josue works daily from 8:00 a.m. to 6:00 p.m. and sells his products directly to customers at his shop or through shoe wharehouses that are settled in his distribution channel. Currently Josue is applying for his first credikiva through Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo.  He plans to invest the loan in buying materials such as soles, leather, glue and accessories at wholesale to be able to get good discounts and prepare for the demand that comes with the holiday season.  His goal is to strengthen his business, buy more advanced machinery to compete with quality, pricing and services.  This way he can buy his own condominium.

loans.use: to buy materials such as soles, leather, glue and accessories at wholesale for shoemaking.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Marilyn works hard to support her family. Marilyn is married and has a buy and sell meat and other frozen products business in the Philippines.

She requested a PHP 16000 loan through NWTF to purchase additional stocks to sell.

Marilyn has been in this business for 4 years now.

She would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase additional stocks to sell

loans.name: Juan Pablo

texts.es:
Pablo es un señor con 43 años de edad, la adversidad que lo ha perseguido no ha sido obstáculo para querer salir adelante y alcanzar sus sueños, lo que se propone lo logra, antes deseaba tener su propio negocio, ahora lo tiene.
Actualmente presenta una dificultad, sus ventas han desmejorado mucho y esto se debe a la competencia en el sector, es por esto que solicita un préstamo, con el fin de comprar insumos como abonos, fertilizantes, insecticidas y semillas.

Su deseo es continuar trabajando, aumentar su cultivo y cumplir el sueño de pagar la educación de sus hijos.
Con su aporte este hombre podrá hacer de sus sueños una realidad, anímese, haga un préstamo.
texts.en:
Pablo is 43 years old, adversity hasn't been an obstacle to want to get ahead and pursue his dreams, he usually achieves his goals, for example, he wanted to have his own business and now he does.

He is currently going through a difficult time because his sales have decreased a lot and this due to competition in the business.  He is requesting a loan to buy inputs like fertilizer, insecticide and seed.

He wants to continue working, have more crops and achieve his dream of paying for the education of his children.

With your help, this man can make his dreams a reality, go ahead and make a loan today!

loans.use: to buy inputs like fertilizer, insecticide and seed.

loans.name: Jose Francisco

texts.es:
Francisco, de 41 años de edad, estudio hasta séptimo grado, está acompañado y su esposa se dedica a la sastrería y junto a ella tiene dos hijos.

Francisco, tiene un pequeño negocio de venta de aparatos electrónicos como lamparas, focos y otros, este negocio lo tiene desde hace 5 años y comenzó comprando cantidades pequeñas y ofreciendolas en su comunidad y así fue comprando más mercadería, su negocio está en su casa y comienza a vender desde las 7:00 a.m. hasta que termina la venta a as 2:00 p.m.

Francisco, necesita el préstamo para comprar más aparatos electrónicos y mejorar su negocio para ofrecer más productos a sus clientes.

Sus sueños son comprar un vehículo para salir a vender a otros lugares más lejanos y poder vender más; además espera que sus hijos le ayuden en un futuro.
texts.en: Francisco, 41 years old, studied up to seventh grade. He has a domestic partner and she works as a tailor, and together they have two children. Francisco has a small business selling electrical appliances, such as lamps, bulbs, and other things. He has had this business for five years. He started buying small quantities and offering them in his community, and this is how he kept buying more merchandise. His business is in his house, and he starts selling from 7:00 a.m. until he finishes at 2:00 p.m. Francisco needs the loan to buy more electrical appliances and to improve his business in order to offer more products to his customers. His dreams are to buy a vehicle to go out to other far away places and be able to sell more. Also, he hopes that his children can help him in the future.

loans.use: to buy more electrical appliances.

loans.name: Noemy De Los Angeles

texts.es: Noemy cuenta con 45 años de edad y se dedica a la venta de tortillas, actividad que realiza frente a su vivienda, en una pequeña champa, dicha actividad le permite sostener la economía de su hogar, por lo que se siente feliz de poder sacar adelante a su familia con este negocio. Noemy se esfuerza cada día para sacar adelante a su hija que aunque tiene 25 años de edad no puede valerse por sí misma, por lo que ella trata de sacarla adelante. Noemy se despierta desde muy temprano para preparar su negocio, ya que ella no logra cumplir con la demanda de productos que solicitan sus clientes, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en maíz por mayoreo y de esta manera mejorar sus ingresos y su venta de tortillas.
texts.en:
Noemy is 45 years old. She sells tortillas in front of her house in a small hut. This activity has enabled her to sustain the household economy, which makes her happy that she can support her family with her business.

Every day, Noemy strives to get her daughter ahead who, despite being 25 years old, can't take care of herself, so Noemy tries to support her. Noemy wakes up very early to prepare her business. Since she can't meet the demand for products that customers request, Noemy is requesting a loan from Fusai to buy corn at wholesale. That way, she can improve her income and sell more tortillas.

loans.use: to buy corn at wholesale in order to improve her income and sell more tortillas.

loans.name: Nasli Del Carmen
