texts.es: Nasli de 34 años es ama de casa residente en un barrio ubicado en el municipio de Barranquilla en donde vive con su cónyuge y sus hijos de 18, 16 y 14 años y una niña de 9 años,  durante varios años trabajó como empleada de servicio doméstico para apoyar con los gastos familiares, sin embargo hace 5 años decidió conjuntamente con su cónyuge incursionar en los negocios y eligieron organizar una tienda de barrio donde venden a los vecinos y transeúntes del sector víveres como legumbres, aceites azúcar carnes, lácteos y demás productos de la canasta familiar. Ella trabaja desde las 6:00 a.m. hasta las 11:00 p.m. para conseguir el sustento diario de su familia, y aunque ha tenido que ser emprendedora por necesidad, sueñan con ir creciendo en su negocio. Nasli está tramitando su primer credikiva con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, con el fin de tener un mayor capital de trabajo que le permita incrementar sus inventarios de arroz, carnes, lácteos, azúcar, verduras, frutas y demás, incrementar sus ventas y por lo tanto obtener mayores utilidades. Su sueño de prosperidad es fortalecer su negocio y adquirir su casa propia.
texts.en: Nasli is 34, she is a housewife that lives in a neighbourhood in the municipality of Barranquilla where she lives with her spouse and children ages 18, 16, 14 and a 9 year-old girl.  For several years she worked as a domestic employee to help pay for family expenses.  However, 5 years ago together with her husband they decided to start a business and open a neighborhood store where they sell to their neighbors and people in the area groceries such as vegetables, oil, sugar, meat, dairy and other basic products.  She works from 6:00 a.m. to 11:00 p.m. to earn a living for her family.  Even though she became an entrepreneur due to financial needs, they want to continue growing their business.  Nasli is working on her first credikiva with Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo, with the goal to have more working capital that will allow her to increase her inventory of rice, meat, dairy, sugar, vegetables, fruit and other.  This way she will increase sales and have more profits.  Her dream is to have prosperity, strengthen her business and buy her own house.

loans.use: incrementar sus inventarios de arroz, carnes, lácteos, azúcar, verduras, frutas y demás

loans.name: Yuranis Yarley

texts.es: Yuranis es una joven emprendedora de 24 años que eligió como profesión el área de la belleza pues considera que ofrece muchas oportunidades de crecimiento constante. Consciente de que  las mejores oportunidades son para aquellos que obtiene una formación profesional, estudió en una academia y hace un año se decidió a abrir al público su sala de belleza donde ofrece a sus clientes los servicios de peluquería como tratamientos capilares, aplicación de técnicas de higiene, peinado y marcado, tratamientos específicos de tintes, mechas, permanentes, aplicación de extensiones, pelucas, postizos, asesoramiento y venta de productos y en estética manicura y pedicura, limpieza de cutis, maquillaje, depilaciones, etc. Ella trabaja de 8:00 a.m. a 8:00 p.m. horario en el que atiende desde su casa y a domicilio a amigos y referidos. Actualmente tramita su primer credikiva a través de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, financiamiento que planea invertir en la compra al por mayor de productos capilares y de estética. Con esta inversión Yuranis espera triplicar el número de clientes que le genere mayores ingresos que a mediano plazo pueda reunir los recursos para remodelar su vivienda  y mejorar su local comercial.
texts.en: Yuranis is a 24-year-old young entrepreneur.  She chose the beauty field as her profession because she thinks it offers many opportunities of constant growth. Conscious that the best opportunities are for those that have a professional education.  She went to beauty academy and a year ago she decided to open her own beauty salon where she offers her clients hair and skin services, hygiene and hair styling techniques, color treatments, perms and application of extensions, wigs, as well as sales of beauty products, manicure, pedicure, facials, makeup application, hair removal, etc.  She works from 8:00 a.m. to 8:00 p.m., schedule that she works from her house and that she provides at private residences of friends and referred customers.  She is currently applying for her first credikiva through Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo.  She plans to invest this financing in buying skin and beauty products.  With this investment Yunaris hopes to triple her clientele and generate more income to be able to make renovations to her residence and improve her beauty salon.

loans.use: to buy skin and beauty products at wholesale.

loans.name: Ada Ines

texts.es:
Inés es una señora con 31 años de edad, trabajadora y humilde, se dedica a la preparación y venta de alimentos en un pequeño carro adecuado para esto que le regalo un familiar, anteriormente le iba muy bien con sus ventas, pero actualmente han bajado mucho ya que en el sector este no es el único sitio donde hacen lo mismo, es por esto que solicita un préstamo con el cual comprará alimentos como carne, aceite, pan y otros, también le hará unos arreglos al carro, ya que su estado no es el indicado para la el manejo de comida.

Su mayor anhelo es poder pagar la educación de sus hijos, pues su bienestar le preocupa.
Los deseos de salir adelante son admirables, pese a los fracasos que ha tenido anteriormente sus esfuerzos no disminuyen, esto permite ver en esta persona unas ganas inmensas de superarse y por supuesto una respuesta favorable a su petición.
texts.en:
Ines is a 31-year-old lady.  She is hardworking and humble, she works preparing and selling food in a small cart conditioned for this, the cart was a gift from a family member.  she used to do very well in sales, but lately they are down because hers is not the only location where food is sold. This is why she requests a loan to buy ingredients such as meat, oil, bread and others.  She will also fix the cart because it's currently not in a good state to handle food.

Her biggest dream is to be able to pay for her children's education as she is concerned for their well-being.
Her wishes to get ahead are admirable, in spite of the failures she's had in the past, her efforts to get ahead haven't decreased.  She really wants to improve and hopes to get a favourable answer to her loan request.

loans.use: to buy ingredients such as meat, oil, bread and others and fix her cart.

loans.name: Philomena

texts.en:
Philomena, a married mother of two, describes herself as God-fearing. For 10 years she has been operating a retail business selling fruits and egetables.  Her enterprise is located in  a strategic place, and her biggest challenge is inadequate working capital. 

Philomena will use this Kes 50,000 loan, her first with SMEP Microfinance Bank, to buy more stocks of fruits and vegetables. She hopes that in the future, she will be able to buy a pick-up truck.

loans.use: to buy more stocks of fruits and vegetables

loans.name: Señor De Huanca - Terminal Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal SEÑOR DE HUANCA-TERMINAL.
La socia Edith Roció tiene 49 años de edad tiene 01 hijo y es casada, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose a trabajar en una empresa privada de transporte interprovincial, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día a su negocio, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para realizar el mantenimiento de su carro.
Los socios en general agradecen el crédito otorgado y se comprometen a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
Los socios que salen en la foto adjunta pidieron permiso para llegar tarde a la reunión por motivos de trabajo.
texts.en:
The members belong to the community bank Senor de Huanca-Terminal.
Edith Rocio is 49 years old, has a son and is married.  She alternates her daily activities working in a private interprovincial transportation business. She has been in this activity for a while and does well thanks to the effort that she puts into the business everyday.  She is a responsible and entrepreneurial person, she wants to continue working to support his family.  She requests the loan to pay for the maintenance of her car.  
The members are grateful for the loan and commits to meet the scheduled repayments.  
The members in the photo attached asked for permission to be late for the meeting due to work reasons.

loans.use: to pay for the maintenance of her car.

loans.name: Yolanda Isabel

texts.es: Yolanda es una amante de la cocina y encontró en esta actividad la oportunidad de emprender su propio negocio en un barrio del Cartagena de Indias una ciudad mágica y colorida.  Con 47 años de edad esta valerosa mujer se convirtió hace cuatro años en la propietaria de un restaurante de comida típica de la región que gracias al apoyo de su cónyuge quien le proporcionó el capital inicial pudo empezar a deleitar a cientos de comensales con exquisitos platos.  Todos los días de la semana ella tiene una carta de comidas variada que consiste en desayunos con fritos típicos; arepas de huevo, arepa dulce con anís, empanadas, caramañolas, y jugos de todas frutas o café con leche, así mismo para los almuerzos prepara pescado y mariscos, carnes asadas, cerdo o pollo que acompañan con arroces, sopas y ensaladas, patacones, tajadas o papitas fritas y de refresco agua de panela con limón o jugos de frutas naturales. Yolanda está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para invertir en víveres al por mayor y continuar con su actividad sin contratiempos. Ella es madre de dos hijos y su meta a futuro es tener su restaurante más organizado y engalanado.
texts.en: Yolanda loves to cook, and she found in this activity the chance to start her own business in a neighborhood of the magical and colorful city of Cartagena de Indias. At 47, this brave woman became the owner of a regional food restaurant. Thanks to her husband's help who gave her the initial capital, she was able to start serving exquisite dishes to hundreds of customers. Every day of the week, she has a menu of diverse dishes, which consists of breakfast with regional fried foods, egg "arepas", sweet anis "arepas", caramañolas (fruits) and fruit juices or lattes. Also, for lunch she prepares fish and seafood, baked meats, pork or chicken served with rice, soups and salads, fried plantains, plantains or french fries; and for drinks sugarcane water with lemon or natural fruit juices. Yolanda is requesting a Credikiva, her first loan with Fundacion Mario Santo Domingo, to invest in food items at wholesale prices and to continue with her business without setbacks. She is the mother of two children and her goal is to have a more organized and decorated restaurant.

loans.use: to invest in food items at wholesale prices.

loans.name: Julio Cesar

texts.es:
Julio es un joven de veinte y siete años de edad, muy esforzado y trabajador, la necesidad de mejorar su calidad de vida lo llevo a abandonar la universidad y buscar una forma de generar un ingreso, fue así como decidió vender distinto tipo artículos de forma ambulante. 
El confía fielmente en Kiva junto a MiCrédito que podra sacar adelante su negocio es por esta razon que solicita un financiamiento, el cual planea invertir en la compra de fajas, hamacas, relojes, llaveros, destapa botellas, linternas, corta uñas para luego venderlos de forma ambulante en distintas ciudades. En un futuro desea poder tener una tienda en alguno de los mercados importantes de su ciudad.
texts.en:
Julio is a 27-year-old young man and very hardworking.  The need to improve his quality of life took him to leave university to find a way to generate income, this is how he decided to start selling different articles in an informal business.
He trusts in Kiva and that with MiCredito he will be able to get his business ahead.  This is why he requests a loan, which he plans to invest in buying belts, hammocks, watches, keychains, bottle openers, flashlights and nail clippers that he will sell informally in different cities. In the future he would like to have a formal store in one of the important markets of the city.

loans.use: to buy belts, hammocks, watches, keychains, bottle openers, flashlights and nail clippers.

loans.name: Carlos Eliezar

texts.es: Carlos de 27 años de edad habita en casa de su propiedad junto a su compañera de vida y sus dos hijos de 2 años y el menor de 10 meses de edad. Carlos se dedica a prestar sus servicios de seguridad lo que le permite sostener la economía de su hogar, y poder brindarle lo mejor a su familia. Carlos desea reparar las paredes de un cuarto de su vivienda, ya que como se observa en la fotografía esta hecho de pedazos de plástico y lámina deteriorada, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: lámina galvanizada, madera, clavos y alambre para reparar el cuarto de su vivienda de esta manera brindar mayor protección a sus hijos sobre todo porque en época de invierno padecen de enfermedades respiratorias.
texts.en: 27 year old Carlos lives in a house that he owns along with his life partner and their 2 children who are 2 years and 10 months old. Carlos works as a security guard so that he can sustain the household and so that he can offer his family the best. Carlos wants to repair the walls of a room in his house because, as you can see in the photo, it is made of pieces of plastic and worn-out laminate. This is why he is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy: galvanized metal sheets, wood, nails, and wire to repair the room in his home and, by so doing, to offer greater protection to his children above all because, in the winter season, they suffer from respiratory problems.

loans.use: to buy galvanized metal sheets, wood, nails, and wire to repair a room of his home.

loans.name: Ana Julia

texts.es:
Julia, de 59 años de edad, no estudio, está soltera, tuvo 7 hijos pero todos ya están acompañados, en su casa solo 2 nietas con ella.

Julia, tiene una pequeña crianza de cerdos desde hace varios años, ella aprendió el negocio porque sus padres tenía cerdos, antes se dedicaba a los trabajos agrícolas, el corral de los cerdos está en su propiedad y los tiene cerca por lo cual se le facilita la alimentación y sus nietas le ayudan a cuidarlos.

Julia, necesita el préstamo para comprar 4 cerdos y comprar madera, clavos y alambre para reparar el corral donde tiene los credos. 

Julia, sueña con seguir trabajando y poder ayudar a sus nietas para que sigan estudiando.
texts.en:
Julia is 59 years old. She did not go to school and she is single and has 7 children who now have their own families. 2 granddaughters live with her in her house.
Julia has a small business raising pigs and has been doing this for some years. She learned the business because her parents kept pigs. Before this, she did agricultural work. The pig sty is on her property and she keeps the pigs close as it makes it easy to feed them and her granddaughters help her to look after them.
Julia needs the loan to buy 4 pigs and wood, nails, and wire to repair the sty where she keeps the pigs.
Julia dreams of being able to keep working and helping her granddaughters so that they can keep studying.

loans.use: to buy 4 pigs and to buy wood, nails, and wire to repair the sty where she keeps the pigs.

loans.name: Teresa De Jesus

texts.es: Doña Teresa de 54 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus dos hijas, ella se dedica a la crianza de ganado y cerdos desde hace mas de 20 años comercializa sus prodcutos en los pueblos aledaños y con lo que obtiene de sus ganancias logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de ganado y asi seguir con su trabajo ya que esa es su fuente de trabajo.
texts.en: Teresa is 54 years old and lives in her own house with her 2 daughters. She works raising cattle and pigs and has been doing this for more than 20 years. She sells her products in the surroundng towns and, with what she gets as profit, she is able to cover some household expenses. She is requesting a loan go buy livestock and, in this way, to continue with her work as this is the source of her work.

loans.use: to buy livestock.

loans.name: Jose Alfredo

texts.es:
Alfredo, estudio hasta tercer grado, está acompañado, su pareja es ama de casa y tiene un hijo que asiste a la escuela.

Alfredo, trabaja desde la edad de 10 años con su papá en la agricultura, desde pequeño aprendió a trabajar como jornal en las fincas de café. Así fue como aprendió a realizar las labores agrícolas pero también aprendió a criar ganado, porque trabajó como corralero durante 3 años.- Actualmente, siembra 7,000 metros cuadrados de maíz.

El crédito será invertido para comprar insumos agrícolas y de esta forma podrá realizar la siembra de cultivo de maíz.

Alfredo, sueña con tener ganado de repasto y de mejorar la calidad de vida de su familia.
texts.en:
Alfredo, who studied until the third grade, is married. His spouse is a housewife, and he has a son who attends school.

Alfredo has been working in agriculture since he was ten years old with his father. From the time he was a child, he learned about a good day’s work on coffee farms. That was how he learned to do farm work, but he also learned to raise cattle because he worked as a corralero for three years. Currently, he sows 7,000 square meters of corn.

The loan will be invested in buying agricultural supplies so that he will be able to sow his corn crop.

Alfredo dreams of having cattle and improving his family’s quality of life.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies.

loans.name: Los Carambolos Group

texts.es:
Cuando el fruto del carambolo madura tiene un sabor muy dulce y refrescante, también posee propiedades nutritivas ya que aporta vitamina A y vitamina C que reducen el riesgo de enfermedades cardiovasculares. Los árboles que contienen dicha fruta están presentes sobre todo en comunidades del estado de Oaxaca donde, de igual forma, se produce la mayor cantidad de caña de azúcar. 
    El grupo Los Carambolos hacen homenaje a este dulce producto y sus integrantes son los siguientes: Valentín y Hugo quienes venden fertilizantes y herbicidas; Samuel, agua purificada; Sonia y Gerardo, pan; Ma. De Lourdes, hamacas; Isabel, Arcelia y Ana, comida; Divina, pollo; Agustina, cerdos; Alicia, tortillas; Guadalupe, cosméticos y Minerva quien brinda servicios de serigrafía.
   Sonia  se tuvo que convertir en madre soltera ya que desafortunadamente enviudó hace poco tiempo.  Tiene tres hijos de los cuales dos depende económicamente de ella “ahora trabajare más duro que antes para continuar ofreciendo lo mejor a mis hijos” comenta. El objetivo de brindar un mejor futuro para su familia es lo que motivó a continuar con el oficio de panadería que inició junto con su esposo.  “Mis tres hijos se han interesado en la panadería, juntos lograremos hacer realidad el sueño de su padre, convirtiendo la panadería en un verdadero patrimonio” comentó emotivamente.
   La elaboración de producto la lleva a cabo de lunes a domingo a partir de las cuatro de la mañana. Una vez que está preparado lo pone en exhibición para que su clientela pueda disponer del delicioso sabor del pan recién hecho. Durante la celebración de  Día de Muertos y Día de Reyes su oficio se fortalece pues elaboran el famoso pan de sal y  la tradicional rosca de reyes. 
   Con las ganancias solventa los gastos del hogar, brinda educación a sus hijos y cubre en tiempo y forma cada uno de los pagos correspondientes al préstamo. El préstamo planea ocuparlo en la compra de harina, huevo, azúcar, leche y colorantes. 
*La fotografía fue tomada justo debajo del árbol de carambolos, Sonia viste blusa amarilla.
texts.en:
When the carambola (star fruit) matures, it has a very sweet and refreshing taste.  It also has nutritional properties, as it contains vitamins A and C which reduce the risk of cardiovascular disease.  Carambola trees are found in communities throughout the state of Oaxaca, where another crop grown in large quantities is sugar cane.  

The communal bank "Los Carambolos" pays homage to this sweet product.  The members are: Valentin and Hugo, who sells fertilizers and herbicides, Samuel, who sells purified water, Sonia and Gerardo, who sell bread, Lourdes, who sells hammocks, Isabel, Arcelia and Ana, who sell food, Divina, who sells chicken, Agustina, who sells pigs, Alicia, who sells tortillas, Guadalupe, who sells cosmetics, and Minerva, who provides silkscreen printing services.

Sonia is now a single mother, because unfortunately she became a widow a short time ago.  She has 3 children, 2 of whom are financially dependent upon her.  "Now I work harder than ever so that I can continue to give the best to my children," she comments.  Her goal of providing a better future for her family motivates her to continue the bakery business she started up with her husband.  "My 3 children have become interested in the bakery, together, we will make their father's dream a reality by making the bakery a valuable property for them to inherit," she comments emotionally.  She displays her products for sale every day starting at 4 in the morning.  Once the products are made, they are displayed so that her customers can enjoy the delicious taste of fresh bread.  

During the celebration of the Day of the Dead and King's Day, she gets a lot of business by making the famous "salt bread" and the traditional "rosca de reyes" (King's cake, a traditional ring cake consumed during the festivities of early January).  

With her earnings, Sonia covers the household expenses, the educational expenses of her children, and she also has enough to make each one of her loan payments in full and on time.  With this loan, she plans to buy flour, eggs, sugar, milk, and coloring agents. 

Note: the photograph was taken right under a carambola tree.  Sonia is seen wearing the yellow blouse.

loans.use: to buy food for her bakery

loans.name: Ana Elizabeth

texts.es: Con 35 años de edad Ana, logro hace 7 años adquirir su vivienda propia en la cual habita actualmente con su compañero de vida y sus 3 hijos una niña de 2 años y dos varones de 1 y 6 años de edad. Ana se dedica desde hace 3 años a prestar sus servicios de seguridad, lo que le permite sostener la economía de su hogar, además cuenta con el apoyo económico de su esposo. Ana desea proteger su vivienda, ya que como se observa en la fotografía no cuenta con una cerca perimetral, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: alambre de púas, postes de cemento, clavos y mano de obra para construir cerca alrededor de su vivienda y de esta manera proteger a su familia, ya que vive en una zona peligrosa.
texts.en:
35 year old Ana was able to buy her own home 7 years ago and currently lives there with her life partner and their 3 children: a little girl of 2 years old and 2 boys who are 1 and 6 years old. Ana has worked for 3 years as a security guard, which enables her to sustain the household, and she also his financial support from her husband.
Ana wants to protect her home because, as you can see in the photo, it does not have a perimeter fence. So, she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to buy: barbed wire, cement posts, nails, and labor to build a fence around her home and, in this way, to protect her family as they live in a dangerous area.

loans.use: to buy barbed wire, cement posts, nails, and labor to build a fence around her home.

loans.name: Arevik

texts.en:
Arevik works at local secondary school in Hatsavan village of Syunik region. Besides her work in the school, Arevik also runs their family farm and lives with her husband and two little sons. Her farm currently includes 70 colonies of bees, and cultivation of wheat, potato, cabbage, apple and pear.

Arevik has now applied for this loan to purchase wheat seeds, fertilizer for growing potato and fuel for land cultivation. Arevik took a loan from a local financial institution before and was unable to repay it, due to her family's weak financial situation and her unemployment. But after years of tireless work, she has been able to find a good job and owns a farm, which is profitable enough to cover monthly payments. Now, Arevik has been approved for a loan, within the framework of a new joint initiative between Kiva and SEF international. The second-chance loan program provides loans to people who have a bad credit history and have no access to credit products.

loans.use: to pay for wheat seeds, fertilizer for growing potato and fuel for land cultivation

loans.name: M.b. Group

texts.es:
Elizabeth es una mujer de 35 años de edad, vive con su pareja, tiene 5 hijos de 4, 8, 10, 14 y 16 años, y su negocio es la venta de artículos de pulpería.
Ella es buena madre, constante y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en el barrio ‘Carmen IV’ caracterizado por acoger a los sobrevivientes del desborde del río años atrás, hoy convertida en un brazo pujante de manufactura. 
Elizabeth es morena, de baja estatura y físico robusto, su lengua materna es el guaraní y habla español (la primera de la derecha, viste blusa roja), su vida la comparte con su pareja  que trabaja, y con sus hijos que estudian en la escuela, viven en una casa propia construida de ladrillo que cuenta con todos los servicios básicos. La necesidad por mejorar su negocio la llevó a liderar la banca de emprendimiento con negocios como; venta de comida, venta de medicinas naturales, venta de ropa de segunda mano, confección de sábanas, venta de fruta, verdulería y venta de comida rápida. Su negocio es la pulpería, ella vende bebidas, comestibles, artículos de mercería y otros géneros muy variados, “la necesidad de todos los días es reabastecer mi negocio…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que no cuenta con competencia cercana, la desventaja es la falta de dinero para reabastecer su negocio. Su sueño es tener un almacén bien surtido, ella desea invertir en su pulpería, surtiéndola de todo tipo de productos. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que realiza esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Elizabeth solicita un préstamo para surtir su pulpería con todo tipo de artículos para alimentar a su familia
texts.en:
called Elizabeth. Elizabeth is a 35 year old woman who lives with her partner. She has 5 children who are 4, 8, 10, 14, and 16 years old and her business is selling groceries.
She is a good mother, constant and very hardworking. She runs her business in the Carmen IV neighborhood, which is known for hosting the survivors of a river flooding that happened some years ago, and which today has become a thriving manufacturing zone.
Elizabeth is a brunette, of short stature, and physically robust. Her mother tongue is Guaraní and she speaks Spanish. (In the photo, she is the first on the right, in a red top.) She shares her life with her partner, who works, and with their children, who are in school. They live in their own home, which is made of brick and has all the basic services. The need to improve her business took her to the enterprise bank where there are businesses such as: selling food, selling natural medicines, selling second-hand clothing, making sheets, selling fruit, running a greengrocery, and selling fast food. Her business is a grocery store and she sells drinks, snacks, haberdashery, and other very variable goods. "Everyday I need to resupply my store" she says.
The advantage of her business is that there isn't local competition. The disadvantage is the lack of money to resupply the business.
Her dream is to have a well-stocked store. She wants to invest in her grocery store, stocking it with all types of products. This is her first loan cycle with the institution in the 2 years that she has been running her business.
It is for these reasons that Elizabeth is requesting a loan to supply her store with all types of goods for feeding a family.

loans.use: to supply their grocery store with every type of product for feeding a family.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay for a photovoltaic system to install in her house.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay for a photovoltaic system to install in her house.

loans.name: Las Rebeldes Group

texts.es:
Hay un municipio oaxaqueño en donde la mayoría de los habitantes se dedican a trabajar en el campo ya que la fertilidad de la tierra es aprovechada al máximo. Por otro lado, la mayor del año el clima de la región es muy caluroso por lo que no es raro ver a las familias acudir a los ríos de la comunidad para poder refrescarse y pasar gratos momentos. Los ríos más concurridos son los que se conocen como “el nacimiento”, “la palma”, “Amapá” y el arroyo de Cosolapa.
    En dicho municipio se formó un grupo llamado Las Rebeldes ya que un espíritu rebelde es aquel que luchas por sus sueños a pesar de las adversidades. Los integrantes son: Verónica quien se dedica a vender comida típica; Paulina, verdura y material reciclable; Maricela, verdura; Petra, cría de cerdos; Roberta y Laura, refrescos; María Irene, zapatos; Filomena, comida; María de Jesús, trastes y Guadalupe, tamales. 
   Verónica es una de las integrantes más alegres del grupo a quien todos conocen simplemente como Vero.  Desde que era una niña ayudaba a sus padres en el negocio familiar, pero éstos le llamaban la atención pues cada que salía a entregar un pedido, regresaba a su casa con un nido de palomas, con los huevos o, incluso, con las pequeñas aves. No obstante, su motivación principal siempre ha sido su madre quien desde hace treinta años se ha dedicado a vender comida típica en la calle principal del municipio. Por tal motivo, tiene diez años elaborando las recetas de su mamá y todos los clientes saben que si quieren encontrar una sazón y una atención únicas deben acudir a su negocio.
   Las ganancias obtenidas le son de utilidad para aportar con el gasto de la casa, cubrir en tiempo y forma el préstamo y reinvertir en su actividad. En esta ocasión invertirá el crédito en la compra de chile, cebolla, aguacate, crema, frijol, aceite, tortillas, queso, servilletas, palillos, carne y gas. 
*En la fotografía, Vero viste playera blanca y short azul.
texts.en:
There is a Oaxacan city where the majority of the inhabitants work in the fields, where the earth's fertility is maximized. On the other hand, during the majority of the year the climate of the region is very hot, so that it is not uncommon to see the families turn to the community's rivers to cool off and have some enjoyable moments. The most crowded rivers are "El Nacimiento," "La Palma," "Amapa," and the Cosolapa stream.

In this municipality a group called "Las Rebeldes" (The Rebels) was formed, since a rebellious spirit is that which fights for one's dreams in spite of adversity. The members are: Veronica, who works selling typical foods; Paulina, vegetables and recyclables; Maricela, vegetables, Petra, hog raising; Roberta and Laura, sodas; Maria Irene, shoes; Filomena, food; Maria de Jesus, dishes; and Guadalupe, tamales.

Veronica is one of the happiest members of the group, whom everyone knows simply as Vero. Since she was a girl she helped her parents in their family business. But, they had to reprimand her because every time she went out to deliver an order, she would return with a nest of doves, with the eggs, or even with the small birds. Nevertheless, her main motivation has always been her mother, who worked selling typical food for the last thirty years in the streets of the city. For this reason, she has been preparing her mother's recipes for ten years and all her clients know if the want to find flavor and top-notch service will look to her business.

The earnings obtained are useful to her for contributing to her home expenses, covering with time the loan, and reinvesting it in her business activities. This time she will invest the credit in the purchase of peppers, onions, cream, beans, oil, tortillas, cheese, napkins, straws, meat, and natural gas.

*In the photo, Vero is wearing a white t-shirt and blue shorts.

loans.use: buy peppers, onion, avocado, cream, beans, oil, tortillas, cheese, napkins, straws, and natural gas.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay for a photovoltaic system to install in his house.

loans.name: Suzette

texts.en:
Suzette lives in Ajuy, Iloilo. She is married with three children ages 10, 13 and 15.

Suzette started selling dried fish seven years ago. Dried fish is almost as important as rice in every Filipino household. It is usually fried and eaten with rice for breakfast. Suzette does a good business out of dried fish. She is asking for a loan to buy more supplies of dried fish. If she can have enough stock, she can cater to more customers, thus earning a better income.

Her only dream is to expand her business and see her children finish school.

loans.use: to buy more dried fish

loans.name: Cristobal Bajo Group

texts.en:
Placido is a young inhabitant of a remote Mexican community where there is no traditional electrification. He joined some neighbors to create the Cristobal Bajo group in order to have access to third generation solar home systems that provide them with basic electricity.

Under these circumstances, Placido and his wife can save by not having to buy items such as candles or disposable batteries, that they will no longer need.

The loan is requested so as to fund the systems for this group, and it will be paid back with the monthly fee for first year of operation maintenance services they pay.

loans.use: to pay for a photovoltaic system to install in his house.

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 59 years old with adult children. She is from the municipality of Concepcion in Iloilo. Teresita is engaged in raising hogs and selling snacks in her neighborhood. She has had these businesses for ten years now and they are her sources of income. Teresita enjoys doing business because it keeps her occupied while also earning a profit that can be used for daily expenses. It also gives her freedom to be independent and not depend on her children for her needs.

Teresita is asking for a loan to buy rice for family consumption and flour, sugar, and margarine for pancakes that she can sell. She hopes to expand her customer base to increase her business profitability.

loans.use: to buy rice, flour, sugar, and margarine.

loans.name: Leonith Del Carmen

texts.es: Leonith es una estilista profesional que ofrece en la ciudad de Cartagena de Indias una amplia gama de servicios de bellezas. Su pasión por la cosmética yace de una capacitación que le dictó el Sena una institución del estado que forma en temas técnicos y Leonith quedó encantada, así poco a poco empezó a ofrecer sus servicios en los domicilios de amigos, conocidos y familiares, y con sus ingresos compró sus herramientas de trabajo.  Posteriormente se trasladó a Barranquilla donde tomó clases y se graduó como técnica, y en la actualidad tiene su negocio en Cartagena.  Esta valerosa mujer cuenta con 15 años de experiencia en este ramo y está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para invertir en equipos para prestar servicios de masajes relajantes, reductores, exfoliaciones, limpiezas faciales e insumos de belleza.  Esta inversión le permitirá continuar ofreciendo bienestar a su grupo familiar conformado por su cónyuge y dos hijos menores de edad.
texts.en:
Leonith is a professional stylist that works in the city of Cartagena de Indias, and offers a wide range of beauty services. Her passion for cosmetics comes from a training that was given by The Sena, a state institution that teaches technical subjects, and Leonith was fascinated. Little by little she began offering her services in the homes of her friends, acquaintances, and relatives. With her earnings she bought her work tools.

She later moved to Barranquilla where she took classes and graduated as a technician, and she currently has her business in Cartagena. This courageous woman has 15 years of experience in this field and is requesting a loan - her first financing from the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo - to purchase equipment to provide relaxing massages such as reducers, exfoliants, facial cleansers, and beauty supplies. This investment will allow her to continue offering well-being to her family that is made up of her partner and two young children.

loans.use: to purchase equipment to provide relaxing massages such as reducers, exfoliants, facial cleansers, and beauty supplies.

loans.name: Valeria

texts.en:
Valeria is a 25-year-old woman. She is single and has no economic dependents. Valeria lives at her parents' house, but she likes contributing to her family's income so that she is more a support to her parents than a liability. She is pictured with some co-workers.

Valeria makes a living by working on an enterprise as a back up manager. She is in charge of data back up. She has a degree in systems engineering. But she thought that wasn't enough, so she started a master's degree to compliment her previous education.
Valeria is almost done. She just needs to pay for the last bit of tuition to get her master's degree, but this is the most expensive part so she is seeking a loan of 20,000 MXN. She knows that as soon as she gets her master's degree she will earn a higher income and she will be a step closer to accomplishing her dreams, which are mostly traveling and having a great job.

loans.use: to pay her tuition.

loans.name: Guadalupe

texts.en:
Guadalupe is a 26-year-old man. He is recently married to a loving wife. They don't have children yet because they have been waiting to have a consistent income that will allow them to cover their children's expenses.

Guadalupe earns a living by driving a gas truck, which he owns. He started this work a long time ago when his father was in charge of the business and he used to help him. When his father retired from the business, Guadalupe inherited the truck and he has been in charge. The job consists of driving the truck very early on the morning to a gas center, filling it, and then driving around the city and taking gas to people who call him and ask for it. He has a commission for every liter he sells.

Guadalupe's truck has been using lots of petrol and sometimes it doesn't start, so he is not always able to work. In order to solve this problem, he is seeking a 10,527 MXN loan. With it he will be able to refurbish his truck and get a higher and more consistent income.

loans.use: to refurbish his gas truck

loans.name: Deicy Del Socorro

texts.es: Deicy de 39 años es una empresaria independiente que ante la necesidad de generar ingresos para aportar a la economía del hogar y por sugerencia de su cónyuge, hace dos años inició su negocio de comercio de ropa, calzado, bolsos, cosméticos, una gama de artículos que vende a vecinos, familiares y amigos mediante visitas que realiza diariamente para propiciar sus ventas. Los resultados han sido positivos hasta el momento, sin embargo requiere de un mayor capital de trabajo para aprovechar la temporada de fin de año, por lo que está tramitando su primer credikiva con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, financiamiento que invertirá en los productos de mayor demanda como ropa calzado, bolsos y cosméticos. Deicy combina su actividad comercial con su rol de ama de casa y madre al mismo tiempo, ella sueña con organizar una miscelánea en su casa y remodelar su vivienda para continuar ofreciendo bienestar a su familia.
texts.en:
Deicy is 39 years old, and is an independent entrepreneur that out of necessity to generate an income to support her home's finances and at her partner's suggestion, started her business two years ago selling clothes, shoes, bags and cosmetics. She sells this range of articles to neighbors, relatives and friends through visits that she makes daily in order to solidify her sales.

The results have been positive so far, however it requires more working capital in order to take advantage of the year-end season. For this reason she is requesting her first loan with Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. She will invest this financing in the products with the highest demand such as clothes, shoes, bags and cosmetics. Deicy combines her business activity with her role as a homemaker and mother at the same time. She dreams of organizing a small store in her home and remodeling her house to keep providing for the well-being of her family.

loans.use: to purchase the products in high demand such as clothes, shoes, bags and cosmetics.

loans.name: Flor Camarosa Group 2

texts.en:
María is fifty-five years old. She has four sisters and three brothers. Her father had a general store and a nixtamal (maize) mill. María says that her father taught all the children to work when they were young and they always had something to eat.

María married when she was fifteen. She attended school up to the third grade. She has three daughters and six sons, all of whom studied to some extent. One son concluded his secondary education. The three older children are working in Guatemala City, where they sell shirts. The two youngest children are taking their secondary education.

María has has been taking loans for five years. The loans have let her give her two youngest daughters the opportunity to study, and she has been investing in producing fabric. Now four women work with her making fabric. She will invest her loan in buying thread to expand her business.

María is the leader of Camarosa Group 2. The group comprises seven women, five of whom are from the ethnicity Ixil Maya and two are from the ethnicity Quiché Maya. Three group members will invest their loans in tissue, another three members in retailing, and one member in agriculture. The average age of the members is fifty-one, with five children. Six members are illiterate. One member did not finish her primary education. The average amount of their loans is 5,125 GTQ.

loans.use: to buy thread to expand her fabric business.

loans.name: Marilyn

texts.en:
Rice is a staple food in the Philippines, thus it is always in demand. It is therefore wise to include it in a “sari-sari” (variety) store inventory if a vendor has enough capital. Marilyn, of Polomolok, South Cotabato, is trying her best to utilize her capital wisely, and she combines her variety store business with rice retailing.

She also retails cellphone load and nurtures a small farm. Her husband, Edgar, drives a tricycle. They are exerting their best efforts in order to sustain their everyday needs and support the studies of their two children. It is their dream to see their children complete their educations because, just like many Filipinos, they consider education to be the best inheritance they could bestow on them. 

But Marilyn’s business is not always smooth sailing. Stiff competition hampers her income and squeezes her family’s everyday sustenance. Therefore, she aims to improve her business further and she appeals for PHP 24,000 in additional capital to buy more sacks of rice and grocery items for her variety store.

She will also use part of the loan to pay for a load wallet for her cellphone e-loading business. Your kind generosity will help her a lot in strengthening her business. In due time, when her current businesses are stable, she plans to invest in another enterprise.

Marilyn is committed to CCT Credit Cooperative’s vision to alleviate poverty, and she regularly meets with her co-fellowship* members every week to share stories of her life and business and to draw strength and inspiration from the fellowship and the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups, each composed of 15 to 30 community partners, that gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy more sacks of rice and grocery items for her variety store

loans.name: Cesar Andres

texts.en:
Cesar is 29 years old and lives in the municipality of Marinilla. He has a beautiful little girl who is only 20 months old, and whom he loves with all his heart and he dreams of giving her the best life he can. Five years ago he started his own business; he grows different produce in his farm, something he inherited from his family.

The prices of some inputs he needs for his business are really expensive, and he wants to improve his sales and to offer more and new produce, so he can provide responsibly for his family. He’s asking for a loan so he can buy some seeds, fertilizers, and pay for irrigation.

Cesar dreams of giving his daughter an excellent education in the future so she will grow up to be a smart girl. He also hopes he can buy a house where his family can have a good life. Help Cesar to achieve all his dreams! A loan will get him much closer.

loans.use: to buy some seeds, fertilizers, and pay for irrigation.

loans.name: Arche De Noé Group

texts.fr: Mwavita est commerçante, présidente du groupe de crédits «Arche de Noé», cliente de l’IMF Hekima, veuve, âgée de 54 ans, mère de 6 enfants dont 4 étudient et 2 autres sont mariés. Elle est vendeuse des friperies au marché de la ville depuis 6 ans. Elle va s’approvisionner en deux ballons de friperies. Elle commença son business avec le capital reçu de son frère. Elle souhaite construire une maison, scolariser et nourrir ses enfants. Au final, elle remercie Hekima pour le soutien apporté aux entrepreneurs non bancables.
texts.en:
Mwavita is a small-scale retailer and president of the loan group called «Arche de Noé» (Noah's Ark.) She is a client of MFI Hekima, a widow aged 54 years old, the mother of six children of whom four are enrolled in school and two others are married.

Mwavita has been selling used clothing at a town market for six years. She is going to add to her stock by buying two bales of used items. She began her business with working capital she got from her brother.

Mwavita hopes to build a house, pay school fees, and feed her children. In closing she thanks Hekima for the support it brings to entrepreneurs who are not served by the conventional banks.

loans.use: to add to her stock by buying two bales of used clothing.

loans.name: Raul Emiro

texts.en:
Raul Emiro is 42 years old and he lives in the municipality of Sampues, where he's been working for many years and where he now has his own business. He raises pigs to sell when they are full grown. He learned to raise pigs from his father, who taught him everything.

He wants to invest in his business, but he doesn’t have the money to do so. He hopes to increase his profits and be more competitive in the market. He’s asking for a loan so he can buy more pigs.

Raul Emiro dreams of paying for his children's schooling, because he believes that education is the best way to raise good people. You can help this responsible man to accomplish all his dreams with just a loan.

loans.use: to buy more pigs.

loans.name: Biliardo Enrique

texts.en:
Biliardo is 51 years old and lives in the municipality of Tolu Viejo. He’s been running his own business for more than 15 years. He has a little place where he sells different kinds of food and where he lives, his is the only business that does that. He works really hard around 10 hours per day, always thinking about improving the quality of life for his family.

He wants to invest in his business so it can become more successful and can attract more clients so his profits will increase. He wants to have more inputs so he has more to offer the clients. He’s asking for a loan so he can buy inputs and expand his food-selling business.

Biliardo dreams of improving the condition of his house so he and his family can live safer and more comfortably. You can help this hard-working man to accomplish all his dreams with just a loan.

loans.use: to buy inputs and expand his  food selling business.

loans.name: Wilton Adriano

texts.en:
Wilton is 47 years old and lives in the municipality of Turbo. He owns a farm where he grows different kind of products, a job he’s been doing since 2010 and which has enabled him to provide for his family. He decided this small enterprise because he was going through a difficult economic time.

Now he’s in a better place, so he wants to invest in his business so he can harvest bigger crops that would enable him to have more to offer his clients. He’s asking for a loan so he can buy some fertilizers and improve his farm structure.

Wilton dreams of improving the conditions of his house so his family can live more comfortably and be safer. You can take part in fulfilling this dream and more with just a loan.

loans.use: to buy some fertilizers and improve his farm structure

loans.name: Monica Anabel

texts.en:
Monica is a woman on her mid-20's. She has no economic dependents and lives with her parents. At Kubo, we enjoy taking clients like her, because she is the kind of person who follows her dreams without minding the situation. She does her best in order to accomplish her goals. Monica is pictured with some classmates.

Not so long ago Monica decided she wanted to become a chef, but in Mexico, it is really hard to get a degree as a chef at a public institution. So she needed to attend a private college to become a professional chef. Monica knew that her parents' economic situation was difficult and they would hardly be able to support her life project, even though they really wanted to, so she decided to take a part-time job. She started working at small restaurant as a dish washer and she got a scholarship. This way she managed get into a private university.

Today Monica has a better job, as a chef at the same restaurant where she started and she earns a higher income. But she still needs to pay the last of her tuition to get her degree. This part is a little more expensive than the rest, so she is seeking a 7,500 MXN loan to settle the last bit of tuition and get her degree as a professional chef.

loans.use: to pay the last of her tuition.

loans.name: Rosa Yasmara

texts.es: Rosa de 41 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus dos hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de pupusas y tortillas desde hace mas de 4 años, su negocio esta ubicado en su lugar de residencia y posee muchos clientes, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar algunos gastos de su hogar, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de maiz, frijoles, chicharron, quesillo, entre otros ingredientes y asi poder tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en: Rosa, 41 years old, lives in her own house with her two children. She has worked selling pupusas and tortillas for more than 4 years. Her business is located in her house and she has many customers. With what she gets from her sales, she manages to cover some household expenses. She is asking for a loan to purchase corn, beans, pork rinds, quesillo, and other ingredients and, so, to be able to have more economic income.

loans.use: to purchase corn, beans, pork rinds, quesillo and other ingredients.

loans.name: Leonor

texts.en:
Leonor is a 60-year-old married woman who lives in the municipality of Yolombó. She has a big family. She’s the mother of 10 children, some of whom still live with her. And actually, one of them helped her to start her business 10 years ago, and now she has a farm where she grows different products. 

Now she’s decided to improve her business so that her sales can increase; and for that purpose, she needs to increase her clientele too. Although there are climatic issues, she’s a hard worker who always protects her products. She’s asking for a loan so that she can buy some pesticide and fertilizers so her products have more quality.

Leonor has many dreams, but she also feels very blessed with the life and family she has. This business means a lot to her because it is the result of much work and many sacrifices. With a loan, you can help Leonor to keep improving her business and to accomplish her many goals.

loans.use: to buy some pesticide and fertilizers so her products have more quality

loans.name: Maritza Alexandra

texts.es:
En ganaderos Orense un recinto del Canton San Miguel de los Bancos vive la señorita Maritza tiene 18 años es soltera no tiene hijos, vive con sus padres pero aporta económicamente para los gastos de la casa.
Maritza a pesar de su corta edad trabaja en labores de campo junto a su familia sale junto a su Padre a las 6 am ya que el negocio lo tienen a media hora en moto y media hora a pie sabe que esta actividad es muy dura por el cuidado de los animales y el mantenimiento del pasto pero cada día busca salir adelante ella se encarga de ordeñar a sus vacas  entrega leche cruda esta actividad la aprendió de sus Padres desde niña, le dedica un promedio de 6 horas diarias. 
Este préstamo lo invertirá en su negocio ya que desea comprar una vaca lechera para poder generar más ingresos y poder ayudar a sus Padres. Maritza agradece a KIVA por la ayuda que le está brindando para mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maritza lives in Ganaderos Orense, a precinct of the canton of San Miguel de los Bancos. She is 18 years old, single, and doesn't have children. She lives with her parents but contributes economically to the household expenses.

Maritza, despite her young age, works at the tasks of the countryside with her family. She goes with her father at 6 am since they have the business a half hour away by motorcycle and a half hour by foot, since this work is very hard due to caring for the animals and maintaining the fields but each day she seeks to get ahead. She is in charge of milking her cows and sells the raw milk. She learned this work from her parents when she was a girl and she works an average of 6 hours a day at it.

This loan will be invested in her business since she wants to purchase a dairy cow to be able to generate more income and be able to help her parents. Maritza is grateful to Kiva for the help that it is offering her to improve her quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase a dairy cow and with this income to be able to help her parents.

loans.name: Alcatraces Group

texts.es:
En el estado de Veracruz  hay un pequeño poblado donde la producción de caña de azúcar juega un papel muy importante en la economía local. La mayoría de los habitantes trabaja en el campo y otros más cuentan con negocios de comida, jugos, vulcanizadoras, baños públicos, entre otros, ubicados en los límites de la carretera para satisfacer las necesidades de los viajantes. 
   En dicha comunidad se formó un grupo llamado Alcatraces por el gusto que sus miembros tienen por dicha flor. Ellos son: Lidia dedicada a la venta de bisutería; María, Calixta e Irma, comida típica; Zobeida, cría de cerdos; Margarita y Paula, abarrotes; Eufrosina, rosticería y Lucia, ropa. 
   Irma es una mujer muy trabajadora quien tuvo que cuidar sola de sus 3 hijos, por ellos, decidió iniciar con la venta de comida típica desde hace tres años. En un inicio sólo contaba con una parrilla tradicional llamada “anafre”, tres pequeñas mesas y una lona con la que cubría del clima al negocio. No obstante, su rutina se ha ampliado ya que actualmente le han encomendado preparar los almuerzos de alumnos y maestros dentro de una tienda escolar; una vez terminada esta tarea se dirige a su negocio principal y atiende a su clientela hasta las once de la noche. 
   Las ganancias obtenidas y el apoyo de su madre le han permitido brindar estudio a sus hijos, además de comprar muebles para su hogar. De igual forma ha invertido en su negocio pues compró un estanquillo para guardar los materiales de su negocio. 
   En esta ocasión el préstamo lo invertirá en la compra de maíz, aceite, queso, crema, verdura, carne, refresco y gas ya que las ventas siguen en aumento debido a su gran servicio y calidad. Comenta que  “gracias por las oportunidades que nos brindan con un nuevo préstamo y por cambiar nuestras vidas de manera positiva”.
   El grupo Alcatraces agradece a todos aquellos que han hecho posible la nueva oportunidad de recibir este apoyo para enriquecer sus actividades.
*La fotografía fue tomada frente a la casa de Mari, Irma viste blusa blanca y se encuentra detrás de su mamá quien viste blusa blanca.
texts.en:
In the state of Veracruz, there is a small village where sugar cane production plays a very important role in the local economy. The majority of the inhabitants work in the fields and others have their businesses of food, juices, tire repair, public bathrooms, and more, located on the edge of the highway to satisfy travelers' needs.

In this community, a group was formed called Alcatraces due to the pleasure of the members in this flower. They are: Lidia, who works selling costume jewelry; María, Calixta and Irma, traditional food; Zobeida, raising pigs; Margarita and Paula, groceries; Eufrosina, roast chicken; and Lucia, clothing.

Irma is a very hard-working woman who had to take care of her 3 children alone. For them, she decided to begin selling traditional food three years ago. At the beginning, she only had a traditional grill called an "anafre", three small tables and a tarp with which she would protect her business from the elements. However, her routine has expanded since now she has been contracted to make the lunches for students and teachers in a school store. Once finished with this work, she goes to her primary business and serves her customers until eleven at night.

The earnings gotten and the support of her mother have allowed her to offer her children an education in addition to purchasing furniture for her home. In the same way, she has invested in her business since she purchased a stall to store her business's materials.

At this time, the loan will be invested in the purchase of corn, oil, cheese, cream, vegetables, meat, soft drinks and gas since the sales continue increasing due to her great service and quality. She says, "Thank you for the opportunities that you are offering us with another loan, and to change our lives in a positive way."

The Alcatraces group is grateful to everyone who has made this new opportunity possible to get this support to enrich their work.

*The photo was taken in front of Mari's house. Irma is wearing a white blouse and is behind her mother who is wearing a white blouse.

loans.use: to purchase corn, oil, cheese, media crema (table cream), vegetables, meat, soft drinks and gas.

loans.name: Cecilia Yanira

texts.es: Cecilia de 37 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa propia con sus cuatro hijos, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de  antojitos como: papas fritas, yuca frita, empanadas, tamales, etc. su negocio esta ubicado cerca de su lugar de residencia, con las ganancias que obtiene es como esta saliendo adelante con su familia, la clienta solicita nuevamente un crédito  para la compra de mas aceite, papas, platanos y todo los ingredientes para su elaboración para poder continuar con sus ventas y asi tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en: Cecilia, 37 years old, is a single mother who lives in her own home with her four children. She works making and selling snacks such as: fries, fried yucca, empanadas, tamales, etc. Her business is located near her place of residence. She is getting her family ahead with the earnings she obtains. The member requests another loan to buy more oil, potatoes, plantains, and other ingredients for her production to be able to continue with her sales and in that way have better economic income.

loans.use: to buy more oil, potatoes, plantains, and other ingredients.

loans.name: Daniela

texts.en:
Daniela is just 20 years old and lives in the municipality of Bello. She has a beautiful son who is only two years old and who has become her main reason to succeed in life and accomplish great things. She has decided she wants to start her own business; she’s going to sell products for personal use, especially clothes. 

She has had this dream since she was a little girl, and it’s a big challenge for her, but she’s willing to work hard to accomplish it. The issue she has is that she doesn’t have the money to start it. That’s why she asked for a loan so that she can start her business and buy clothes like jeans so that she can start selling them.

Daniela dreams big, and now she has a son to whom she wants to give the best, including a good quality of life for him and for the whole family. With this loan, Daniela can start a great story for her son, and you can be part of that story, so please loan now.

loans.use: to buy clothes like jeans so that she can start selling them

loans.name: Rafael Angel

texts.es: Rafael es un emprendedor Barranquillero que desde niño siempre quiso ser estilista, actividad en la que se ha desempeñado durante 20 años en un barrio de este municipio. Sus anhelos se hicieron realidad gracias a su interés en temas relacionados con la belleza y el cuidado personal, así logró adquirir los conocimientos necesarios para realizar cortes de cabello con las mejores tendencias de la moda.  Hoy en día su negocio es muy reconocido y estable, al ser una necesidad de todos los Barranquilleros que deseen lucir una agradable apariencia y mantener su corte de cabello permanentemente. En la actualidad está tramitando su primer credikiva con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo con el cual planea invertir en la compra de un aire acondicionado y adecuar su local para ofrecer un mejor servicio a su clientela, dado que las recientes olas de calor causan incomodidad. Su meta es organizar su peluquería en un centro comercial  en un  local que sea más agradable y que tenga una imagen muy atractiva y moderna.
texts.en:
Rafael is an entrepreneur from Barranquilla who since he was child always wanted to be a stylist, a business that he has carried out for 20 years in a neighborhood of this municipality. His wishes became reality thanks to his interest in topics related to beauty and personal care, and in that way he acquired the knowledge necessary to do hair cuts with the best fashion trends.

Today his business is very recognized and established, being a need of all people in Barranquilla who wish to show a nice appearance and permanently maintain their hair cut.

Currently he is requesting his first credikiva with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo with which he plans to invest in air conditioning and adapting his shop to offer better service to his customers, since the recent heat waves cause discomfort. His goal is to organize his hair salon in a mall in a shop that is more pleasant and has a very attractive and modern image.

loans.use: to invest in buying air conditioning and adapting his shop.

loans.name: San Judas Group

texts.es:
Una comunidad veracruzana ubicada a orilla de la carretera federal es conocida porque la mayoría de los habitantes se dedica al trabajo en el campo siendo una de las regiones más importantes en cuanto a producción de caña de azúcar. Asimismo la ganadería y la industria están creando nuevas oportunidades de empleo a los pobladores y una red de comunicaciones más amplia. 
   En dicha comunidad se formó el grupo San Judas nombrado así por la devoción que sus integrantes tienen hacia dicho santo. Ellos son: Ana quien vende abarrotes y comida; Diana, comida típica; Martha, refresco y comida y Nicolás quien cría cerdos.
   Ana Guadalupe es conocida por todos como Lupita, al ser madre soltera ha tenido que redoblar esfuerzos para cuidar de sus dos pequeños hijos. Desde  hace 8 años decidió abrir una tienda de abarrotes para obtener ingresos sin descuidar a su familia. El hecho de no tener para una inversión grande no la limitó ya que con tablas construyó un par de anaqueles en donde colocó la mercancía. Las ganancias obtenidas le permitieron iniciar poco tiempo después con la venta de hamburguesas y hotdogs de tal manera que los ingresos han aumentado considerablemente.
   Actualmente Lupita se dedica a sus hijos, a la tienda de abarrotes y, los fines de semana, a instala su carro de hot dogs en el centro de la comunidad. De igual forma les enseña el valor del trabajo a sus hijos ya que, mientras ella prepara los alimentos, uno de sus hijos sirve los refrescos y el otro los lleva hasta donde se encuentra el cliente; “estoy feliz y emocionada con la gran familia que tengo y con mis dos actividades pues en ambas convivo con mis hijos” comenta.
   En esta ocasión invertirá el préstamo con VF México en la compra de arroz, frijol, azúcar, café, leche, huevos, galletas, refrescos y botanas para continuar satisfaciendo las necesidades de sus clientes.
   Todos los integrantes del grupo agradecen a cada una de las personas que hace posible el préstamo pues con él enriquecen sus actividades  justo como lo hace Lupita.
*La fotografía fue tomada en el espacio donde Lupita instala su puesto los fines de semana.
texts.en:
A community in Veracruz located at the edge of a national highway is known because the majority of the inhabitants work in the countryside, since it is one of the most important regions in regards to sugar cane production. In addition, raising animals and industry are creating new job opportunities and a larger network of communication for the population.

In this community, the group San Judas was formed, named for the devotion that the members have for this saint. They are: Ana, who sells groceries and food; Diana, traditional food; Martha, soft drinks and food, and Nicolás who raises pigs.

Ana Guadalupe is known by everyone as Lupita. As a single mother, she has had to double her efforts to care for her two little children. Eight years ago, she decided to open a grocery store to get income without neglecting her family. The fact of not having a large amount to invest didn't limit her since with boards she build a couple shelves where she put her merchandise. The earnings she got allowed her to begin to sell hamburgers and hot dogs a little later, in such a way that her income has increased considerably.

Currently, Lupita is focused on her children, on her grocery store, and on the weekends she sets up her hot dog cart in the center of the community. Equally, she teaches her children the value of work since, while she prepares the food, one of her children serves the soft drinks and the other brings them to where the customer is. "I am happy and excited with the great family I have and with my two businesses since with them I live with my children."

At this time, she will invest the loan from VF México in the purchase of rice, beans, sugar, coffee, milk, eggs, cookies, soft drinks and snacks to continue to satisfy her customers' needs.

All of the members of the group are grateful to each of the people who make the loan possible since with it they will enrich their work, just as it will for Lupita.

*The photo was taken in the place where Lupita sets up her stand on the weekends.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, sugar, coffee, milk, eggs, biscuits, soft drinks and crisps.

loans.name: Gloria De Jesus

texts.es: Gloria de 48 años de edad es madre soltera vive en casa propia con sus dos hijo, ella se dedica a la venta de frutas y verduras desde hace 27 años su negocio esta ubicado en el mercado municipal, gracias a las ventas que realiza es como ha logrado salir adelante con su familia, ella esta solicitando nuevamente un credito pero en esta ocasion es para la compra de mas frutas y verduras por mayor para poder seguir con sus ventas y tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en:
Gloria is 48 years old, and a single mother. She lives in a home she owns, with her two children. For 27 years she has worked selling fruits and vegetables. Her business is located in the municipal market. Thanks to the sales she's made, she has been able to move forward with her family.

She is seeking another loan, but this time it is for the wholesale purchase of more fruits and vegetables, so that she can continue with her sales and have greater income.

loans.use: to buy fruits and vegetables wholesale.

loans.name: Rivera Del Río Group

texts.es:
En Oaxaca, como en la mayor parte del país, las fiestas patrias engalanan las calles de los municipios. Los habitantes colocan en el exterior de sus hogares banderas, campanas y demás ornamentos alusivos a la independencia de México. Una comunidad en específico realiza recorridos en lancha, carreras de caballos, bailables, cantos y declamación de poemas como parte del programa cultural; finalmente el alcalde da el famoso grito desde el palacio municipal y una vez realizado da paso a un gran baile.
   En dicho municipio se integró un grupo para solicitar beneficios con VF México, su nombre es Rivera del Rio y actualmente está integrado por: Nicolasa quien vende comida y productos reciclables; María, ropa; Rebeca y Regulo, comida; Israel, tortillas y Celia, dulces. Por su parte Jovita y Pablo manejan una sastrería; Quirino, una carpintería y Mauro, un taller mecánico. 
   Don Quirino  es un hombre muy trabajador y comprometido con su familia integrada por su esposa Carmela y sus cuatro hijos de los cuales dos aún dependen económicamente de él. Desde joven aprendió el oficio de carpintero gracias a su padre quien era un gran maestro en la reparación y fabricación de toda clase de muebles. Ahora cuenta con veintisiete años de experiencia y desea continuar con el negocio ya que más que una actividad económica es un legado familiar. “Me gusta mi oficio, ofrecer a mis clientes diseños únicos elaborados por mí, aunque claro si ellos traen sun modelo yo cumplo sus requerimientos” comenta contento. Su taller está ubicado detrás de su casa desde donde se observa un pequeño acantilado con vista al río que corre por la comunidad; tras la jornada laborar Quirino baja a orilla del rio para convivir con su familia. 
   Los préstamos que VF México  le ha otorgado le han facilitado el crecimiento de su carpintería pues compra mucha más materia prima y herramienta. Con este nuevo préstamo podría comprar clavos, un martillo, disco para corte, pegamento y madera ya que debe entregar pedidos pendientes. 
*Ellos son los integrantes del grupo, la fotografía fue tomada en el municipio de “la novia del sol”, Quirino viste camisa azul a cuadros .
texts.en:
In Oaxaca, like in most of the country, the national holidays decorate the streets of the towns. The citizens place flags, bells, and other decorations on the outside of their homes symbolizing the independence of Mexico. One specific community has boat tours, horse races, dances, songs and poem readings as a part of the cultural program. Finally, the mayor gives a famous shout from the municipal palace, and once complete, it leads to a large dance. In this city, a group came together to request assistance from VF Mexico. Its name is Rivera del Rio, and it is currently made up of: Nicolasa, who sells food and recyclable products; Maria, clothing; Rebeca and Regulo, food; Israel, tortillas and Celia, sweets. For their part, Jovita and Pablo manage a tailor shop, Quirino is a carpenter, and Mauro has a mechanic workshop.

Quirino is a hard-working man and is committed to his family made up of his wife Carmela and his four children, two of which are still financially dependent on him. As a young man he learned carpentry from his father who was a master of the repair and production of all types of furniture. He now has 27 years of experience and wants to continue with his business since beyond being a financial activity, it is a family legacy. "I like my job, offering my clients unique designs made by me, and of course, if they bring me their model I meet their requirements," he says happily.

His workshop is located behind his house where there is a small cliff with a view of the river that runs through the community. After the work day Quirino drops down to the river bank to be with his family. The loans that VF Mexico has provided have facilitated the growth of his carpenter shop, and he buys much more raw materials and tools. Wih this new loan he will buy nails, a hammer, a circular saw, glue, and wood since he has to deliver his outstanding orders.

*These are the members of the group. The photograph was taken in the city of "La Novia del Sol" and Quirino is wearing a blue plaid shirt

loans.use: to buy nails, a hammer, a circular saw, glue, and wood.

loans.name: Inés

texts.es: Inés es una emprendedora mujer de 46 años residente en el Madrid un municipio de Cundinamarca en donde es muy conocida por los servicios de aseo que presta, labor que inició alterno a su actividad principal puesto que trabajaba en una flota de buses y tenía tiempo para generar unos ingresos adicionales para su hogar. En la actualidad cuenta con ocho años en esta actividad promoviendo sus servicios entre sus conocidos y son ellos mismos los que la recomiendan a otras personas del municipio. Ella está aplicando a su primer credikiva por intermedio de la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, para adecuar el patio de su vivienda, con esta inversión sus condiciones de habitabilidad mejorarán.  Su meta familiar es costearles los estudios a sus tres hijos, de los cuales uno aún es menor de edad y en su negocio es conseguir muchos mas clientes.
texts.en: Inés is an enterprising woman, 46 years old, who lives in Madrid, a municipality of Cudinamarca where she is well-known for the cleaning services she offers, work that she began to alternate with her primary work since she works in a bus fleet and had time to generate some additional income for her home. Now, she has been in this work for eight years, promoting her services among her acquaintances and it is they who recommend her to other people in the municipality. She is applying for her first Kiva loan, through the intermediary of Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, to fix up the patio of her house. With this investment, her living conditions will improve. Her family goal is to pay for her three children's education, of whom one is still a minor and in her business her goal is to get many more clients.

loans.use: to fix up the patio at her house.

loans.name: Zenaida Marisela

texts.es:
Zenaida, de 42 años de edad, termino sus estudios hasta bachillerato, está casada, su esposo es motorista en un centro escolar, tiene tres hijos, dos de ellos estudian y el otro trabaja.

Zenaida, es comerciante en pequeño, ella vende tamarindo desde hace 5 años y su tía le ha enseñado como comercializar este producto, ella compra y revende dicho producto; pero además de eso también se dedica a la siembra de granos básicos, especialmente de maíz del cual siembra 10,500 metros cuadrados y también siembra frijoles; el terreno donde siembran está ubicado a unos 10 minutos de su vivienda.

El préstamo lo necesita para comprar insumos agrícolas, especialmente abono y fertilizantes, para que su siembra sea efectiva y de calidad.  

Los sueños de Zenaida, son seguir trabajando para mantener a sus hijos y darles el estudio para que se preparen académicamente.
texts.en:
Zenaida, 42 years old, completed her education through secondary school. She is married, her husband is a driver in a school, and she has three children, two of them go to school and the other works.

Zenaida is a small businesswoman, she has sold tamarind for 5 years and her aunt taught her how to sell this product. She purchases and resells this product, but in addition to this she also works planting basic grains, especially corn which she plants in 10,500 square meters and also she plants beans. The land where she plants is located some 10 minutes from her house.

She needs the loan to purchase agricultural supplies, especially manure and fertilizers, so that her planting is effective and of quality.

Zenaida's dreams are to continue working to support her children and give them an education so they prepare themselves academically.

loans.use: to purchase agricultural supplies, especially manure and fertilizers.

loans.name: Yesica Areli

texts.es: Yesica es una mujer de 19 años de edad que habita en casa de su propiedad junto a su madre y su grupo familiar. Yesica se dedica a prestar sus servicios domésticos, actividad que le permite sacar adelante a su familia, por lo que se siente feliz ya que tiene mucho años de experiencia, lo que le permite obtener muy buenos ingresos económicos. Yesica desea construir un muro perimetral en su vivienda, y de esta manera brindar protección a su familia, por lo que solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: cemento, arena, grava y ladrillo para construir un muro perimetral y brindar seguridad a su familia.
texts.en: Yesica is a 19-year-old woman who lives in a house that is her property with her mother and her family. Yesica works in domestic service, work that allows her to get her family ahead, so she is happy. She has many years of experience, which allows her to get good economic income. Yesica wants to build a perimeter wall for her house, and in this way offer protection to her family, so she asks FUSAI for a loan to invest in cement, sand, gravel, and brick to build a perimeter wall and offer her family security.

loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, gravel, and bricks to build a perimeter wall and offer her family security.

loans.name: Formando Un Futuro Group

texts.es: Esta es la alcancía comunal “Formando un Futuro” formada hace más de 5 años por personas triunfadoras y que ahora está integrada por 5 mujeres responsables que está representada por su presidenta la Sra. Elsa de 60 años de edad, soltera y tiene 2 hijos que ya son independientes. Ella tiene como negocio  desde hace algunos años la venta de todo tipo de golosinas y bebidas en un puesto de venta en la calle, es por ello que el préstamo lo invertirá en su negocio para comprar más mercadería y así surtir de muchos productos su quiosco de golosinas. Como uno de sus objetivos Elsa tiene en mente seguir ahorrando un poco más para terminar de implementar su bodega en casa donde podrá ofrecer todo tipo alimentos, golosinas, bebidas y muchas cosas más a su clientela. En la foto grupal la Sra. Elsa se encuentra de pie en medio de sus demás compañeras sentadas.
texts.en: This is the Formando un Furturo communal bank, formed more than 5 years ago by successful people and now is made up of 5 responsible women who are represented by their president, Elsa. She is 60 years old, single, and has 2 children who are now independent. For some years, she has had as her business the sale of all sorts of candies and drinks at a sales stand in the street. For this, she will invest the loan in her business to purchase more merchandise and, so, stock many products in her candy stand. As one of her objectives, Elsa has in mind continuing to save a little more to finish establishing her store in her house where she will be able to offer all sorts of foods, sweets, drinks, and many other things to her customers. In the group photo, Elsa is standing in middle of her other partners who are seated.

loans.use: stock her sales stand with more products.

loans.name: Margee Loraine

texts.es: Margee es una joven de 24 años, madre soltera de un niño de apenas tres años de edad que reside en un barrio al sur de Barranquilla, ella emprendió la búsqueda de una oportunidad de negocio para obtener una fuente de ingresos y  encontró la orientación de un amigo que la direccionó por el negocio de insumos para panadería y le facilitó un espacio en su casa para su almacenamiento. Ella trabaja diariamente en el horario de 7:00 a.m. a 5:00 p.m. visitando a su clientela constituida por los propietarios de panaderías del sector y les ofrece todo lo relacionado con insumos para panadería como harinas, aliñados grasos, aditivos, grasas, ente otros, además de recipientes desechables.
