Margee planea incrementar su capital de trabajo para comprar de contado y disminuir  sus costos, para lo cual está solicitando su primer credikiva con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo recursos que invertirá en  harinas, aliñados grasos, aditivos y grasas. Su meta es fortalecer su negocio y tener su propio local comercial.
texts.en:
Margee is a young, 24 year old woman. She is a single mother with a boy who just turned three. She lives in a neighborhood in the southern part of Barranquilla. She began a search for a business opportunity that would provide a source of income. A friend guided her to the business of providing supplies to bakeries, and provided her a space in his house for storage. She works every day from 7:00 a.m. to 5:00 p.m., visiting her customers, made up of bakery owners in the area. She offers them everything related to supplies for bakeries, such as flours, shortenings, additives, lard and disposable containers, among other things.

Margee plans to increase her working capital in order to buy in cash and reduce her costs. For that purpose she is seeking her first Kiva loan with the Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, the proceeds of which she will invest in flours, shortenings, additives and lard. Her goal is to strengthen her business and have her own commercial space.

loans.use: to invest in flours, shortening, additives and lard.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cement, sand, gravel, bricks and iron to build a room.

loans.name: Flor Camarosa Group 3

texts.en:
Teresa is an only child. Her parents separated when she was six years old and her mother had to travel to the southern region of Guatemala to work harvesting coffee. Teresa helped her mother harvesting coffee. When she was thirteen, she had to move to Guatemala City to work as a domestic servant. After working for a couple of years as a domestic servant, she went to work at a maquila (manufacturing operation). In the maquila, she met and joined her current husband when she was sixteen years old. After that she came back to live with her mother and her husband returned to work as a farmer.

Teresa looked for a loan to begin producing typical textiles, but she did not take one because of the high interest rates until she learned about the Chajulense Association of Women United for Life. Her first loan was used to buy thread and she began her textile business making small products; now she produces huipiles that can have prices of GTQ 2,500 each. This year Teresa is getting her fourth loan, and she will use it to expand her business by buying thread.

Teresa is the leader of Camarosa Group 3. The Group is made up of eight women, six of whom are from the Ixil Maya ethnicity and two from the Quiché Maya ethnicity. The group will use their loans for agriculture (25%), textiles (25%), and retail (50%). On average, each member of the group has five children, 63% are illiterate, and 26% did not finish their primary education. The average amount of their loans is GTQ 5,125.

loans.use: to buy thread to expand her textile business.

loans.name: Luis Martin

texts.es: Luis es un pensionado de las Fuerzas Armadas de Colombia de 53 años de edad, que decidió  tomar la iniciativa del emprendimiento para sentirse realizado, activo y útil, pues considera que el término de la vida laboral no debe ser en ningún caso el paso a una vida pasiva y sin proyección.  Como su cónyuge es costurera se unió al negocio de la confección para ampliar sus servicios y aprovecho sus contactos para ofrecerles el servicio de bordados para los uniformes de militares conocidos y colegios. Actualmente cuenta con una buena clientela éntrelos  colegios y militares, sin embargo su meta es lograr posicionar su servicio con variedad de bordados en camisetas, gorras, sudaderas, busos y escudos para colegios y empresas, proyecto que planea financiar con los recursos de su primer credikiva que actualmente tramita con la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, así logrará comprar las materias primas necesarias.  Su visión es seguir fortaleciendo su negocio y mirar el futuro con un enfoque de logro.
texts.en:
Luis is a veteran from the Colombian Army. He is 53 years old and decided to start his own business in order to feel fulfilled, active and useful. He believes that retirement cannot lead to a passive and goalless life.

His partner is a seamstress, so he joined her in order to offer more services. He also took advantage of his contacts to offer the service of embroidery for military and school uniforms.

These two groups have resulted in a good customer base for him. However, his goal is to position his company by offering a wide range of embroidery styles for t-shirts, baseball caps, sweat pants, sweaters, and emblems for schools and companies.

He is planning to finance this project with resources from his first CrediKiva, the one he is currently applying for at Fundación Mario Santo Domingo. In this way, he will be able to buy the raw materials he needs.

His vision is to continue strengthening his business, and look ahead with a focus on achieving his goals.

loans.use: to buy the raw materials he needs.

loans.name: Maria Veronica

texts.es:
María, de 27 años de edad, estudio hasta quinto grado, está acompañada y su pareja se dedica a la agricultura, tienen dos hijos, uno estudia cuarto grado y el otro estudia Kínder. 

María, ha dedicado la mayor parte de su vida a los oficios domésticos, también lava y plancha ropa ajena, su compañero de vida junto a su padre le ayuda en la siembra 3,500 metros cuadrados de maíz y el terreno se encuentra ubicado a 10 minutos de su vivienda.

El préstamo lo necesita para pagar mano de obra y para comprar pesticidas para la plaga del maíz, además comprará abono y fertilizantes.

Los sueños de María son, que sus hijos sigan estudiando y sean personas de bien y que su pareja siga trabajando.
texts.en:
María is 27 years old. She went to school until the fifth grade. She is in a relationship, and her partner works in agriculture. They have two children. One is in the fourth grade, and the other is in kindergarten. For most of her life María has worked taking care of her home. She also washes and irons clothes for others. Her life partner and her father help her in the sowing of 3,500 square meters of corn. The land is located 10 minutes from her home.

She needs a loan to pay for labor and to buy pesticides for corn blight, and to buy manure and fertilizers. María's dream are that her children stay in school and become good people, and that her partner keep working.

loans.use: to pay for labor and to buy pesticides for corn blight, and to buy manure and fertilizers.

loans.name: Maria Ines

texts.es: Doña María de 61 años de edad vive en casa propia con su hija, desde hace 30 años posee una pequeña tienda en su lugar de residencia donde vende una variedad de productos, con las ganancias que obtiene logra solventar algunos gastos que se le presentan en el hogar, ella esta solicitando nuevamente un crédito para la compra de huevos, pan dulce, granos básicos, golosinas, refrescos, etc. y asi seguir con sus ventas y tener mejores ingresos economicos.
texts.en:
María is 61 years old and lives in a house she owns with her daughter. She has had a small store at home for 30 years. She sells different products, and with the profits she makes, she manages to cover some of the home expenses.

She is again requesting a loan to buy eggs, sweet bread, cereals, candies, sodas, etc., in order to continue selling and improving her income.

loans.use: to buy eggs, sweet bread, cereals, candies, sodas, etc.

loans.name: Cecilio Angel

texts.es: Don Cecilio de 62 años de edad vive en casa propia con su esposa, el se dedica desde hace varios años a la agricultura siembra arros, frijol y elotes, comercializa sus productos en los diferentes mercados que se encuentran cerca de su casa, con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra salir adelente con los gastos de su hogar, el está solicitando un crédito para la compra de semillas, fertilizantes, abonos, controles de plagas, etc. y mejorar el terreno que muestra en la fotografía para poder continuar con su trabajo y tener mejores ingresos.
texts.en:
Cecilio is 62 years old and lives with her wife in a house he owns. He has worked in agriculture for a few years, growing rice, beans, and corn. He sells his produce at different closeby markets. With what he earns from his sales, he manages to cover the expenses at home.

He is requesting a loan to buy seed, fertilizer, compost, pesticides, etc., and to improve the land shown in the picture, in order to continue with his work, and continue improving his income.

loans.use: to buy seeds, compost, fertilizers, pesticides, etc., and improve the land.

loans.name: Estela Abigail

texts.es:
Estela, de 22 años de edad, estudio hasta noveno grado, está acompañada, su pareja actual es albañil, tiene 2 hijos pequeños.

Estela, vende pan francés desde hace 5 años, antes se dedicaba a la siembra de granos básicos, el negocio lo tiene en su domicilio y en el negocio le ayuda su mamá y su horario es de 4:00 a.m. a 8:00 a.m. y lo hace todos los días.

Estela, necesita el préstamo para comprar insumos para hacer pan.

Estela, sueña con tener una casa de bloque, porque donde vive es de lámina.
texts.en:
Estela is 22 years old. She went to school until the ninth grade. She is in a relationship. Her partner is a mason. They have 2 small children. For 5 years Estela has sold french bread. Before that she worked growing staple grains. Her business is in her house. Her mother helps in the business. She works every day from 4:00 a.m. to 8:00 a.m.

Estela needs a loan to buy ingredients to make bread. She dreams of having a house made of cinder blocks, because her current house is made of laminate sheeting.

loans.use: to buy ingredients to make bread.

loans.name: Antonia

texts.es: Antonia, tiene 49 años de edad, es casada, tiene tres hijos y vive en el Municipio de Morazán, Yoro. Ella se dedica a la venta de tamales y pan casero como semitas, tortas, quesadillas etc, esta actividad la realiza desde hace 12 años. Anteriormente se dedicaba a los oficios domésticos y al ver la necesidad de obtener ingresos decidió por hacer pan para vender. Las ventas las realiza de manera ambulante y por encargos. Ya ha obtenido tres prestamos anteriores con ODEF, actualmente está solicitando otro préstamo por la cantidad de 12,000 lempiras, el cual Piensa invertir en la compra de maíz, harina, azúcar, aceite, huevos, carne, arroz y otros ingredientes para elaborar tamales y pan. Considera que esta inversión le ayudará a  mantener un capital de trabajo y obtener ganancias. Su meta es continuar siempre con su negocio, y también vender ropa americana para lograr hacerle mejoras a su casa.
texts.en:
Antonia is 49 years old, married and has three children. She lives in the municipality of Morazán, Yoro. She works selling tamales and traditional homemade breads, such as semitas, tortas, quesadillas, etc. She has worked at this for 12 years. Before that she worked taking care of her house, but seeing the need to bring in income, she decided to make bread to sell. She makes her sales both as a street vendor and through orders.

She already obtained three prior loans from ODEF. She is currently seeking another loan for 12,000 lempiras, which she plans to invest in the purchase of corn, flour, sugar, oil, eggs, meat, rice and other ingredients to make tamales and bread. She believes this investment will help her maintain her work capital and increase her earnings. Her goal is to continue with her business, and also to sell American clothes in order to make improvements to her house.

loans.use: to buy corn, flour, sugar, oil, eggs, meat, rice and other ingredients to make tamales and bread to sell.

loans.name: Los Cocos Group

texts.es:
Un municipio oaxaqueño es considerado primordialmente agrícola pues la tierra, al poseer un alto grado de fertilidad, se puede cultivar caña de azúcar, maíz, fríjol, arroz, mango, papaya, café y vainilla. La pesca, sin embargo, es una importante fuente de ingresos para el municipio ya que en la presa Miguel Alemán se pueden encontrar ejemplares como la mojarra, el “pez puerco” y el róbalo.
   En una de las colonias del municipio se formó un grupo llamado Los Cocos cuyo nombre recuerda al refrescante fruto que nace de las palmeras, los miembros son: María del Carmen quien se dedica a vender zapatos, ropa y bisutería; Elena, tamales y servicio de molino; Guadalupe, María M., Cristina, Atanacio y José, refresco; Maricela, cosméticos y ropa; Yohana, ropa y pescado; Modesta, abarrotes y Etelvina, verduras y ropa.
   María del Carmen es mejor conocida como Machi, y dedica todos sus esfuerzos al cuidado de sus pequeños hijos. Con el firme propósito de apoyar su esposo con los gastos del hogar y poder brindar una buena calidad de vida a sus dos pequeños comenzó  a vender calzado por catálogo, posteriormente, las ganancias obtenidas le permitieron iniciar con la venta de ropa para dama y artículos de bisutería. Los beneficios que resultaron de dichas actividades se ven reflejados en aparatos electrodomésticos que pudo adquirir recientemente. Para poder satisfacer a sus clientes Carmen viaja hasta la cuidad de Puebla a comprar el calzado y la ropa. 
   El préstamo anterior lo invirtió en la compra de calzado y en esta ocasión lo hará en la compra de calzado escolar y blusas que le han solicitado sus clientes. Además comenta entusiasmada, “quiero continuar vendiendo de manera ambulante aunque sé que trabajando fuerte lograré poner mi propia distribuidora”. Carmen recorre a diario las calles de la comunidad para llevar a sus hijos a la escuela y, mientras tanto, mostrar sus catálogos y productos.
*La fotografía fue tomada en “la novia del sol” frente a un antiguo pozo, Carmen es quien viste blusa negra.
texts.en:
A Oaxacan municipality is considered fundamentally agricultural. Since the earth possesses a high degree of fertility, sugar cane, corn, beans, rice, mango, papaya, coffee, and vanilla can be cultivated. The fishing, nevertheless, is an important source of income for the municipality since in the Miguel Alemán dam there can be found examples such as snapper, dogfish, and sea bass.
In one of the municipality's communities, a group named "Los Cocos" ["The Coconuts"] was formed, whose name recalls the refreshing fruit that is born of the palms. The members are: María del Carmen who earns a living selling shoes, clothes, and costume jewelry; Elena, tamales and mill services; Guadalupe, María M., Cristina, Atanacio, and José, sodas; Maricela, cosmetics and clothes; Yohana, clothing and fish; Modesta, groceries; and Etelvina, vegetables and clothing.
María del Carmen is better known as Machi, and she dedicates all her efforts to the care of her small children. With the firm intention of supporting her husband with household expenses and to be able to provide a good quality of life to her two little ones, she began to sell shoes via catalogue. Subsequently, the profits she obtained permitted her to begin selling women's clothing and articles of costume jewelry. The profits that resulted from the aforementioned activities are reflected in the household appliances that she was able to acquire recently. In order to be able to satisfy her clients, Carmen travels to the city of Puebla to buy footwear and clothing.
She invested the previous loan in buying footwear. On this occasion, she will purchase school shoes and blouses that her clients have requested from her. In addition, she comments enthusiastically, "I want to continue selling as a street vendor although I know that working hard I will succeed in becoming my own distributor." Carmen goes through the community's streets daily to take her children to school, meanwhile showing her catalogues and products.
*The photograph was taken in "the bride of the sun" in front of an ancient well. Carmen is the one wearing a black blouse.

loans.use: to buy school shoes and blouses.

loans.name: Vilma Yesenia

texts.es: Vilma de 38 años de edad vive en casa propia con sus tres hijos, ella se dedica a la venta de productos varios como dulces, galletas, refrescos, chicles, jugos, etc. desde hace 15 años su negocio esta ubicado cerca de su lugar de residencia en una zona muy transitada con lo que obtiene de sus ventas logra solventar los gastos que se le presentan en su hogar, ella esta solicitando un credito para la compra de mas meraderia por mayor y asi poder continuar con su trabajo que le genera buenas ganancias.
texts.en:
Vilma is 38 years old and lives in her own home with her 3 children.  She has made a living for 15 years selling various products such as candy, cookies, soft drinks, gum, and juice, among other things.  Her business is located close to her residence in a well-trafficked area.  She uses the profits from her sales to pay for her household expenses.  

She is requesting a loan to buy more wholesale merchandise so that she can continue working and generating a good income.

loans.use: to buy candy, cookies, soft drinks, gum, and juice wholesale, among other things.

loans.name: Grupo Mujeres De La Alcaldia Group

texts.es: Antonia (se ubica en medio de la tres) es una mujer de 52 años de edad, es soltera con una linda familia de 10 hijos de las edades entre 10 y 34 años de edad, cinco de sus hijos ya cuentan con su propia familia y el resto aún está bajo su cuidado.  Antonia para obtener sus ingresos  y sacar adelante al resto de su familia se dedica a la compra y venta de verduras en la plaza de su comunidad y en los lugares circunvecinos, con este negocio lleva ella 10 años de realizarlo. Gracias a su amabilidad con la que atiende a sus clientes ahora se ha dado cuenta que no cuenta con suficiente producto para satisfacer mejor las necesidades de sus consumidores por esa razón solicita un préstamo para  la compra de más verduras como: papa, zanahoria, cebolla y tomate. Con esta inversión ella espera poder satisfacer mejor a sus clientes. Su esperanza de vida es construir una casa más amplia para que su familia viva mejor  y apoyar a sus hijos en la escuela.
texts.en:
Antonia (pictured in the middle of the photo) is a 52-year-old woman.  She is single and has a beautiful family of 10 children who are between the ages of 10 and 34-years-old.  Five of her children already have their own family and the rest are still under her care.  In order to gain an income and move forwards with the rest of her family, Antonia makes a living buying and selling vegetables in the main square of her community and in the surrounding areas.  She has been doing this business for 10 years.

Thanks to her friendly attitude when she serves her customers, she has now realized that her business has grown to the point where she doesn't have enough produce to better satisfy the necessities of her customers.  Therefore, she is requesting a loan to buy more vegetables such as potatoes, carrots, onions, and tomatoes.  She hopes that this loan will allow her to better satisfy her customers.  Her hope in life is to build a bigger home so that her family can have a better life and to support her children in their studies.

loans.use: to buy and sell vegetables such as potatoes, carrots, onions, and tomatoes.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy bricks, cement, sand, sheet metal, and iron to finalize the construction of a living room.

loans.name: Nushaba

texts.en: Some years back, she was hardly managing her household activities with the small income of her husband. Then, through loans from Kashf Foundation, she initiated her business of hand embroidery. Nushaba  is 20 years old and married. She is very skilled in the art of hand embroidery and has been using this skill for many years to earn a living. She can make beautiful designs and patterns with her hand. Her skill is known throughout the town. She has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR. This loan will enable her to purchase more beads, threads, and frames to meet the orders of her customers on time to earn a good amount of profit.

loans.use: to purchase more beads, threads, and frames to meet the orders of her customers on time to earn a good amount of profit

loans.name: Dina Angelica

texts.es: Con 43 años de edad, Dina se esfuerza a diario por llevar el sustento diario a su hogar para su hijo de 16 años de edad que la acompaña en su diario vivir, su hijo le da fuerzas y motivos para esforzarse en su trabajo. Ya que Dina es madre soltera, ella presta sus servicios domésticos en un hotel en el cual lleva varios años realizando esta labor, labor de la cual se gana el dinero para mantener la economía del hogar y de esta forma con este mismo empleo le da el estudio a su hijo. Dina desea tener una mejor forma de vida y para lo cual solicita a FUSAI un crédito para invertir en: cemento, arena y pago de mano de obra para la reparación de la pared de su vivienda ya que se encuentra en mal estado. Así también Dina expresa con mucha alegría su agradecimiento por el crédito anterior ya que con eso pudo invertir en el piso de su casa permitiendo esto una mejoría en su vida.
texts.en:
At 43 years of age, Dina makes an effort each day to bring home the daily sustenance for her 16 year old son who accompanies her in her daily life. Her son gives her strength and motive to exert herself at her work. As Dina is a single mother she works as a maid in a hotel where she has been working for a number of years. With this work she earns the money to maintain the finances of her household and in this way with the same work she has provided her son his education.

Dina wants to have a better living style so she is requesting a loan from FUSAI to invest in cement, sand and pay for labor to repair the wall of her house, which is in poor condition. Dina at the same time expresses with great joy her gratitude for the previous loan as she was able to invest in her floor of her house allowing her an improvement in her life.

loans.use: to invest in cement, sand, and pay for labor to repair the wall of her house.

loans.name: Doffina

texts.en: Doffina is a married woman with three children. She operates a retail business where she sells cooked eggs. She has been involved in this business for six years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be inadequate working capital and storage. She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy a hot pot to keep the cooked eggs warm. She hopes that in the future, she will educate her children. This is her first loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank.

loans.use: to buy a hot pot to keep the cooked eggs warm

loans.name: Jessy

texts.en: Jessy is a married man. He describes himself as honest. He operates a farm where he keeps dairy cows. His primary customers are locals. He describes his family challenge to be lack of clean water for domestic use. He will use the KES 50,000 loan to pay costs for digging a well and buy a water tank to store clean water for domestic use. This is his fourth loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. His previous loans were repaid successfully.

loans.use: to pay the costs of digging a well and buying a water tank.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: La joven a quien se le ha pixeleado la cara por tener 23 años de edad y vivir en zona de alto riesgo, se dedica a la venta de antojitos (pastelitos de carne, yuca y papas frita, empanadas, etc.) y fresco, su negocio esta ubicado cerca de su lugar de residencia en una zona muy transitada, gracias a su trabajo es como ha podido salir adelante con su familia, la joven vive en casa propia sus padres y su hermano, ella esta solicitando nuevamente un crédito para la compra de mas carne, verduras, yuca, papas, etc. para continuar con sus ventas yya que le ha ido muy bien y ha obteneido buenas ganancias.
texts.en:
The young woman who has had her face pixelated because of being 23 years old and living in a high-risk area, makes a living from selling snacks (small fried pies made of meat, yucca, and potatoes, empanadas, etc.) and soft drinks. Her business is located near her residence in a well-traveled area. It is thanks to her work that she has been able to succeed with her family. The young woman lives in her own home with her parents and her brother.

She is requesting a loan once again to purchase more meat, vegetables, yucca, potatoes, etc., to continue with her sales since it has gone very well for her and she has made good profits.

loans.use: to purchase more meat, vegetables, yucca, potatoes, etc.

loans.name: Marina Esmeralda

texts.es: Marina es una persona muy trabajadora de 33 años de edad, quien lucha por sacar adelante a su familia, por brindarles una buena educación a sus dos hijos una niña de 14 años y un niño de 6 años de edad. Marina día con día sale de su casa en dirección a su trabajo el cual está en una institución de salud pública en la cual presta sus servicios y de esta manera ganarse el sustento diario para su hogar. El compañero de vida de Marina ayuda con la economía del hogar y así, de esta forma buscan la manera de mejorar su calidad de vida y la de sus hijos y es para ello que Marina solicita un crédito a FUSAI para invertir en: bloques, cemento, arena y pago de mano de obra para la elaboración de un muro frente a su casa. De esta manera poco a poco ir mejorando su calidad de vida y a la vez tener una mejor seguridad en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Marina is a very hard-working person of 33 who works every day to raise her family and to offer a good education to her two children, a girl, age 14, and a boy, age 6. Every day Marina leaves her house to go to her job, which is in a public health institution where she offers her services and in this way earns the daily sustenance for her household. Her life companion helps with the household economy, and thus, in this way they seek a way to improve their quality of life and that of their children.

It is for this reason that Marina is applying to FUSAI for a loan to invest in blocks, cement, and sand and pay for labor to build a wall in front of her house. In this way, little by little, she is improving their quality of life and at the same time providing better security in their home.

loans.use: to invest in blocks, cement, and sand and pay for labor to build a wall in front of her house.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en: Naseem is 36 years old, married and a mother of two children. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all the household expenses, so she initiated her business of milk sales. She has been doing it for many years and has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality. With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business; currently, she has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales and earn profits for providing her family with the basic necessities of life. Naseem aspires to further expand her business and increase the number of animals she owns at present.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales and earn profits for providing her family with the basic necessities of life.

loans.name: Amna

texts.en: Amna is a 44-year-old working woman. After her marriage, she felt that she should support her husband to improve their financial condition. So she started a business selling cloth. She believes she can earn some respect and make a better world for her children and their education. Amna is famous among her neighbors for her collections and has a good client list. Currently she needs a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase good quality cloth in different colors to earn substantial profits through this investment. This would lead her to live a decent life and improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to purchase good quality cloth of different colors to earn substantial profits through this investment.

loans.name: Shafal

texts.en: Shafal was living a tough life some years ago; it was very difficult to bear her household expenditures. So with the support of her husband she started her business selling milk. She is 36 years old. She has buffaloes for milking purposes. She sells the milk in her area. Her business is doing well enough to pay for her family’s expenses. She is a dedicated lady and wants the best for her family. She has taken many loans from Kashf Foundation. Now she has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase one more buffalo to increase milk sales. This will enable her to earn a good amount of income to fulfill her dream of providing better living conditions for her children.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo to increase milk sales. This will enable her to earn a good amount of income to fulfill her dream of providing better living conditions for her children.

loans.name: Lisquine

texts.en: Lisquine is 28 years old and married with two children. She joined Hand in Hand Eastern Africa in 2013 and acquired skills in enterprise development and financial management. Her economic activity is dairy farming. She is borrowing a Kiva loan to buy fodder for her cows in order to improve milk production. She looks forward to more income in order to provide quality education and better medical services for her children.  Lisquine appreciates Kiva and their lenders for the support and promises to repay the loan promptly.

loans.use: to buy fodder for her cows thus giving her more income to cater for basic needs.

loans.name: Karimi

texts.en: Karimi is a married woman with three children. She describes herself as ambitious. She operates a retail business where she sells cereals. She has been involved in this business for three years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be seasonal changes. She will use the KES 21,000 loan to buy more stock of cereals. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cereals

loans.name: Regina

texts.en: Regina is a married woman with five children. She operates a retail business where she sells maize, cereals, and other cereals. She has been involved in this business for five years. Her primary customers are locals. She describes her biggest business challenge to be low stock. She will use the KES 30,000 loan to buy more stock of cereals. Her business goal is to have a big cereal store within five years. This is her second loan with SMEP Microfinance Bank. The previous loan was repaid successfully.

loans.use: to buy more stock of cereals
